Job Summary:
IBI Group is a globally integrated architecture, planning, engineering and technology firm. From high-rise to industrial buildings, schools to state-of-the-art hospitals, transit stations to highways, airports to toll systems, bike lanes to parks, we design every aspect of a truly integrated city for people to live, work and play. 


We organize our expertise into three sectors: Intelligence, Buildings and Infrastructure. 


Intelligence - systems design and software development 


Buildings - building architecture, interior design, building engineering (mechanical, structural, electrical) 


Infrastructure - planning, urban design, landscape architecture, transportation and civil engineering 

Our collaborative and combined approach focuses not only on creating the best solutions today, but also creating the right solutions for tomorrow.  

We believe cities must be designed with intelligent systems, sustainable buildings, efficient infrastructure and a human touch. 

At IBI, we're defining the cities of tomorrow. 

  

Transportation Engineering Co-op Student - Toronto 

Words like motivated, enthusiastic, collaborative, independent, willingness to learn and take initiative - describe our ideal student candidate. 

  

What's in it for you?

Work with, learn from and be motivated by industry professionals
Play an integral role in projects
You will be treated like any other member of your team; not "just a student"
You will be given as much responsibility as you show us you can handle
Direct industry exposure in your field of study
Access to our student community Campus Connext
Potential part time employment during the school year and full time permanent opportunities upon graduation

  

Where will you be working?

  

IBI Group's traffic operations and road user safety group, at the Toronto office, is looking for a four month Co-op student to join our team. We are currently in a work from home model during COVID-19, but when we do return to the office we're located at 55 St Clair Ave West, Toronto, Ontario. The student will need to be local to the Toronto office and able to work remotely until we return to the office. 


  

Do you want to save lives, and generally make the world a better place? If so, IBI Group's Traffic Operations and Safety Group wants you! Don't let the name fool you, it's not just about cars. The traffic operations and road user safety practice at IBI Group works with transportation agencies across North America, and around the world, to provide safe and efficient transportation solutions including proposing new Intelligent Transportation Systems deployments/plans and transit priority measures. We rely heavily on the use of simulation and prediction models to assess the delay and collision impacts of proposed changes to traffic controls and other roadway features to improve operations for all modes. The work we do is highly analytical and data driven, and we take on a lot of challenges that have never been attempted before. At present, we have a portfolio of active projects which involve traffic operations and safety analysis and modelling, design and implementation of traffic control and transit priority systems, rapid transit multi-modal network integration, and parking supply and demand management. We also work on a variety of major rapid transit infrastructure projects in the Greater Toronto Area including York Region VIVA, the Yonge North and Scarborough Subway Extensions, Eglinton Crosstown LRT, and Hurontario LRT. We're looking for keen, motivated individuals, who are interested in exploring a career in the operations side of transportation. 

  

Most of the analysts and engineers that make up the traffic operations and road user safety group are former co-op students, and we do our best to provide all of our students with meaningful work and opportunities to learn through real world problem solving. We want your time at IBI to be a mutually beneficial experience.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				ENG - Civil, Environmental and Geological Engineering
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Introduction 

At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk. 



There are positions in multiple locations in Canada:  Toronto, Markham, Ottawa, Calgary.  


It is mandatory that all applicants are enrolled in full-time studies at a post-secondary institution and returning to full-time studies upon completion of the work term. 


About IBM 

IBM's greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action. IBMers believe that the application of intelligence, reason and science can improve business, society and the human condition. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, with more than 380,000 IBMers serving clients in 170 countries.
Job Responsibilities:
As an IBM Intern, you will work on projects that have a lasting effect on the world we live in and define the technology of tomorrow. We are looking for the one-of-a-kind, to not just think outside the box, but reinvent it. At IBM, you will work alongside a global community of 6000+ interns in a workplace that champions inclusion and a culture of giving back.


IBM's internship programs are an opportunity to learn from the best and develop skills that will make you stand out in today's rapidly-evolving market. If you're ready to do what you love and having a great time doing it, join us.

 
Check out our job postings on this page https://ibm.biz/IBMinternships. To be eligible for our internships, you must be a full-time student returning to full-time studies after the completion of the work term. Co-op enrollment is not mandatory.

Job Summary:
Ophthalmology Clinic Intern - Creating patient education media/packages for ophthalmic disease, diagnosis and treatment/surgery. Working with patients and staff to improve clinic flow, quality of care and patient satisfaction. Assisting the ophthalmologist with patient care, such as performing diagnostic tests and coordinating patient flow.  


We are a group of 6 ophthalmologists that provide medical and surgical care for eye disease. Our clinic is located in the west end of Ottawa and it is called iCare Surgical & Optical Centre. We are affilated with the University of Ottawa Faculty of Medicine and The Ottawa Hospital. We have a staff of 20 administraters and technologists. Often there will be medical students and ophthalmology residents working with us at our clinic. We are looking for a bright and energetic individual who can work independently on multiple projects that will directly impact the care to the patients we serve.
Job Responsibilities:
Working closely with the Clinic Manager and the practicing Ophthalmologists and support staff. 

Establishing patient education packages regarding ophthalmic disease, treatment and surgery. 

Working with patients to improve quality of care, flow and satisfaction. 

Creating or improving other patient care forms. 

Managing the clinic website. 

Assisting with patient care - administrating diagnostic tests and coordinating care.
Required Skills:
Excellent interpersonal skills 

Initiative 

Ability to work independently 

Carry on responsibility for multiple projects 

Work well with patients 

Web Design/Marketing not essential but beneficial since will be working on patient education info via website/animation/info packages

Job Summary:
About ICSPI


ICSPI designs, manufactures and sells single-chip scanning probe microscopes for educational, research and industrial applications. Our flagship product, the nGauge atomic force microscope (AFM), has reset the expectations for AFM and nanoscale metrology: all of the scanners and sensors have been integrated onto a single 1 mm x 1 mm micro-electro-mechanical systems (MEMS) chip; miniaturizing the size, driving down costs, and dramatically simplifying the operation of nanoscale metrology instruments. ICSPI is based in Kitchener-Waterloo, Canada. 


COVID-19 Restrictions

*This position will be based in our office in downtown Kitchener. However, hybrid or remote work may be required for the entire term depending on the COVID-19 pandemic. 


Job Description

ICSPI is looking for a Hardware Engineering Co-op for a 4-month or 8-month term during Winter 2022 or Winter 2022 and Spring 2022. As a Hardware Engineering Co-op at ICSPI, you will be working on:
 

Pushing the limits of our micro-electro-mechanical systems (MEMS) devices
Unlocking new modes of operation for our MEMS devices, enabling radically new use cases and applications of AFM
Developing new precision systems using our MEMS devices, including:
	 
  
Mechanical/mechatronics hardware design and prototyping
Electrical hardware design and prototyping
Development of internal software tools (data processing and analysis)



About you

You are curious, driven and adaptable. You enjoy solving problems and developing new and innovative technology.
You are capable of working independently and meeting tight deadlines with changing priorities.
You are motivated by working in a small team, making decisions that will directly impact the business. No task is too big or too small.
You deliver results. You are motivated to build consistent and reliable solutions.
Job Responsibilities:
Job Responsibilities:

Design and integrate single-chip scanning probe microscopes (MEMS device assembled on a PCB) into a mechanical assembly with precision electromechanical positioning system
Soldering, 3d printing, test jigs
Integration of circuit boards, MEMS, mechanical components, and connectors
Perform qualification tests on hardware including electrical, mechanical and reliability testing.
Required Skills:
Required Skills

Mechanical design with CAD software (Solidworks)
Experience with conventional machining and rapid prototyping (3d printing, test jigs, soldering)
Experience sourcing components and materials
Experience working with electromechanical systems
Programming experience in C++ and/or Python

Preferred Skills

Experience designing and/or using scientific or industrial measurement (metrology) instruments
Experience with precision electromechanical system design and manufacturing
Circuit design with Eagle 
Familiar with low power MCU (ST, Atmel, TI etc.) and its peripheral circuits (MIPI, SPI etc.).
Experience with firmware development for embedded systems
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Manufacturing and Process Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Nanotechnology Engineering
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
About ICSPI
ICSPI designs, manufactures and sells single-chip scanning probe microscopes for educational, research and industrial applications, including failure analysis and quality control. Our flagship product, the nGauge atomic force microscope (AFM), has reset the expectations for AFM and nanoscale metrology: all of the scanners and sensors have been integrated onto a single 1 mm x 1 mm micro-electro-mechanical systems (MEMS) chip; miniaturizing the size, driving down costs, and dramatically simplifying the operation of nanoscale metrology instruments. ICSPI is based in Kitchener-Waterloo, Canada.

COVID-19 Restrictions
This position will be based in our office in downtown Kitchener. However, hybrid or remote work may be required for the entire term depending on the COVID-19 pandemic.

Job Description
ICSPI is looking for an Application Engineer Co-op for a 4-month or 8-month term during Winter 2022 or Winter 2022 and Spring 2022. As an Application Engineer Co-op at ICSPI, you will be working on:

Pushing the limits of our micro-electro-mechanical systems (MEMS) devices
Developing applications for our AFM-on-a-chip technology (scanning new samples, investigating applications)
Development of internal software tools (data processing and analysis)
Product development (working with MEMS devices, hardware)

Depending on the skills and interests of the successful candidate, other projects could include:

Electrical hardware design and prototyping
Mechanical/mechatronics hardware design and prototyping
Software and firmware development
Semiconductor device fabrication

About you

You are curious, driven and adaptable. You enjoy solving problems and developing new and innovative technology.
You are capable of working independently and meeting tight deadlines with changing priorities.
You are motivated by working in a small team, making decisions that will directly impact the business. No task is too big or too small.
You deliver results. You are motivated to build consistent and reliable solutions.
Job Responsibilities:
Job Responsibilities

Pushing the limits of our MEMS devices, characterization of specifications
Development new applications for our AFM technology
Scientific modeling and data analysis
Development of internal software tools
Product development (depending on the successful candidate: electrical, mechanical/mechatronics, software)
Supporting business operations (manufacturing, marketing, customer success, business development)
Required Skills:
Required Skills

Familiarity with statistical analysis concepts and methodologies
Experience with electrical prototyping (test jigs, soldering, oscilloscope)
Programming and data analysis experience using Python
Basic knowledge of semiconductor devices and MEMS
Experience with rapid prototyping (3d printing)

Preferred Skills

Programming experience using C++
Experience using scientific or industrial measurement (metrology) instruments, especially atomic force microscopes
Experience with MEMS based sensors and semiconductor devices
Mechanical design with CAD software (e.g. Solidworks)
Experience with firmware development
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Hardware
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Nanotechnology Engineering
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
Idea Notion Development Inc. is a software consulting firm that designs, develops, and delivers solutions to help transform a business into a digital enterprise.

We are a team of passionate and skilled consultants based in Toronto. We create well-crafted software solutions for premium clients. Our expertise in a wide range of technologies and platforms allows us to maximize the benefit of each and deliver the most fitting solution. With our strong technological background, continuous investment in the latest tech, agile development approaches, and lean operational practices, we deliver great solutions for our clients.

You will be working in a fast pace environment where solving complex problems using simple solutions is the prime objective. You will be in a constant learning environment where each project will be a new challenge and each challenge will be a great learning experience. You will also get to work on a SaaS product under DealerAI.com, where you will design and develop AI-based chatbot applications.

The selected individual will be responsible for working closely with the team to understanding requirements and implement elegant, maintainable, testable software using cutting-edge technologies. Eager to learn and having initiative will be key success factors in this role.

Visit our website at http://ideanotion.net/
Job Responsibilities:
- Maintain a company owned eCommerce platform
- Work on specific components of assigned projects
- Make modifications to the company websites
- Improve on operational process scripts
- Maintain client websites
Required Skills:
REQUIRED CREDENTIALS, ATTRIBUTES, AND EXPERIENCE:
- Strong communication skills including verbal, written and listening
- Willing to learn and master new technologies
- Ability to understand system requirements and translate them into development/implementation
- Experienced with creating web applications and interfaces
- Experienced with mobile app development
- Positive team member with a desire to help others, share ideas, inspiration and knowledge
- Ability to manage one's work component and focus on deliverables
- Punctuality and reliability are key traits

The following tools and technologies are used:
- Object-Oriented Programming

Job Summary:
IGNIS was spun out of the University of Waterloo in 2000 and has since then become a globally recognized technology provider for the Organic LED (OLED) display industry. Our commitment to research and development has pioneered the way to solving ongoing fundamental problems plaguing the industry such as image burn-in and lifetime. Our team of circuit designers develop all aspects of the display including the pixel circuit, display layout, display driver, and interconnect circuitry. Complementing the circuit design team is a dedicated group of software developers focused on writing application software to support both research and product development. 


With a portfolio of over 400 patents, IGNIS has licensed some of the largest OLED display manufacturers such as LG Display. As we continue to evolve in a rapidly changing industry IGNIS is committed to holding its position at the forefront of technology development.  At IGNIS you will be part of the team that improves the quality, longevity, and affordability of AMOLED displays. 


To learn more about IGNIS and our technologies please visit our website at www.ignisinnovation.com.
Job Responsibilities:
Reporting to the Senior Embedded Systems Engineer, this position will support the hardware engineering team for Active-Matrix Organic Light-Emitting Diode (AMOLED) displays using IGNIS's compensation algorithms. 


Your responsibilities will include:

Working with hardware engineer and display engineer of the team to learn the basics of AMOLED displays, IGNIS's MaxLife technology, and the hardware and software platforms.
As there are a variety of disciplines in the firmware, embedded software, and Andriod NDK software development the specific tasks given to the co-op student will depend on their experience. Tasks will likely involve design, implement, debug, test, and maintain the AMOLED Display algorithm, driver, and Test software.
 You are also encouraged to independently identify opportunities for new and improved features.
Required Skills:
Must have:

C/C++ development on Linux/Windows platform
Knowledge of using embedded programming techniques and tools such as Eclipse, GNU tools, GCC/G++ make and GDB
Problem-solving skills, and demonstrated experience in software debugging skills 

Nice to have:

Knowledge of Android NDK development
Knowledge of GPU development, i.e. OpenGL, Nvidia CUDA
Working knowledge of communication protocols/buses TCP/IP, UDP, Ethernet, RS-232, I2C
Experience with multithreaded/multitask programming techniques for Linux
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

Job Summary:
IGNIS was spun out of the University of Waterloo in 2000 and has since then become a globally recognized technology provider for the Organic LED (OLED) display industry. Our commitment to research and development has pioneered the way to solving ongoing fundamental problems plaguing the industry such as image burn-in and lifetime. Our team of circuit designers develop all aspects of the display including the pixel circuit, display layout, display driver, and interconnect circuitry. Complementing the circuit design team is a dedicated group of software developers focused on writing application software to support both research and product development.

To learn more about IGNIS and our technologies please visit our website at www.ignisinnovation.com or watch our AOIS system in action at https://youtu.be/Aflc8diIbrg.


If you love to work with a variety of tools, technologies, and projects. If you want to be exposed to the latest technologies. Then this is the co-op role for you. At IGNIS, you will be part of a small dynamic team working on a broad scope of projects, platforms, and development environments.
Job Responsibilities:
Day to Day you will:

development uses C, C++, C#, LUA, and OpenGL. You will learn how to write code that uses multi-languages at the same time.  For example, a C# .NET program that makes function calls into functions written in C++.
development is done in Windows and Android, often communicating between the two.
be responsible for the testing and deploying your own code at your desk and in the lab on our products.
test and debug software and hardware related issues in our lab
work alongside our researchers to develop and refine algorithms
keep your eye out for opportunities to improve our products

As a small company, everyone does many different kinds of projects daily. Some of our past co-ops have developed a GUI controls library for our system that goes from the C# .Net layer interfacing with C++ and Lua through TCP and UDP communications frameworks.

experience in C++ and C# development
strong communication skills

Job Summary:
IKO Industries Ltd. is a global leader in the manufacture and supply of asphaltic and bituminous waterproofing products. IKO is a family owned, Canadian operated business with production facilities throughout North America and Europe.  IKO Industries Ltd. has been committed to manufacturing quality roofing products since 1951.  Our company motto is "Setting the Standard" and that is what we do; set the standard for quality, durability, and innovation.  The company's branded materials are specified for house building, commercial property and engineering structures in many countries worldwide.  Please visit www.iko.com for more information. 


At our Madoc, ON facility we mine, manufacture and distribute coloured granules for our shingles.  The Madoc facility is comprised of a 400 acre open pit mining operation, industrial manufacturing plant (crushing and colouring), product distribution services and on-going construction projects.  As this is a facility that includes the mining and crushing of rock, the work environment can be quite harsh.  The plant is not climate controlled, and the nature of our process creates dusty and dirty conditions within the facility.  Open grating on platforms and stairs are used to access all 5 levels of both plants.  Madoc is a rural community of approximately 1000 people located a 30 minute drive north of Belleville, ON.  The IKO plant is located in the country 5 kms west of Madoc. Housing is available, free of charge, in a company owned house beside the plant.  Candidates must arrange for their own transportation - this is a very rural setting and no form of public transportation is available.
Job Responsibilities:
The job responsibilities consist of a combination of maintenance duties, project management and design engineering (all depending on student's capability) Some of the responsibilities include: 

- Manage aspects of implementing capital and non capital projects on or before schedule, at or under budget 

- Assist in designing, installing and commissioning new production units, monitoring modifications and upgrades, and troubleshooting existing processes; 

- Contribute in defining project scope, goals and deliverables that support business goals in collaboration with senior management 

- Track project timelines and milestones using appropriate tools  

- Develop and deliver progress reports, proposals, requirements documentation, and presentations to ensure mutual understanding of project deliverables, status and results at all organizational levels 

- Updating instructional documentation by shadowing employees on their daily routines 

- Work closely with hourly employees on the shop floor and the JHSC to come up with solutions to improve Safety
Required Skills:
- Basic detail and conceptual design skills; proficient with MS Office 

- Excellent organization, analytical, problem solving & trouble shooting skills  

- Strong communication (written, verbal, and presentation) and interpersonal skills  

- Ability to work effectively in a team, develop and maintain relationships with a wide range of people/personalities 

- Interest in heavy production and mining applications 

- Demonstrated commitment to accuracy, quality, detail and time management while meeting goals, budget and deadlines  

- Experience with MP2, AutoCAD, Inventor 3D, or Maximo considered an asset
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Manufacturing and Process Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering
Application Documents Required: Cover Letter,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
IKO Industries Ltd. is a global leader in manufacturing roofing products with production facilities worldwide. We are currently seeking a Reliability Engineering Intern to join our team of skilled professionals based at IKO's office in Brampton, Ontario. 


IKO recognizes that its success is due to the strength of its employees.  A primary goal of IKO is to promote individual employee's sense of accomplishment and contribution so that employees enjoy their association with IKO. The Company invests in its employees so that they are the most knowledgeable in the industry, and undertakes great efforts to nurture loyalty to, and teamwork at, IKO. 


For information on our company visit www.iko.com.
Job Responsibilities:
Accurately create Hyperlinks between large volumes of related PDF drawings and corresponding Service Request forms, Bill Of Materials, Manuals, etc., to accelerate time to find correct parts and create requests for work, etc.
Assist Reliability Engineers to perform data analysis, categorization of parts, parts usage rates, etc.
Review drawings and field labels on assets to build a cross reference with standardized asset names at other sites.
Work with the Plant Maintenance Supervisor, Reliability Engineer, Inventory Coordinator, Planners/ Scheduler, Mill Wrights, etc., to help drive the progress with the Top 5 Reliability initiatives
Perform Data collection and some analysis within Prodac (Downtime Tracking System) exported to Excel and Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS) with interpretation and trending of highly critical equipment with common repeating failure patterns at the plant
Supporting Reliability Engineer Data collection and standardization of Failure modes and the Preventive (PM) and Predictive (PdM) Maintenance tasks to maintain the assets
Document asset information that needs to be updated in the drawings
Recommend more efficient ways to sort through and categorize and standardize the above items
Work with Reliability Engineer to perform Spare Parts optimization that support the above Preventive Maintenance (PM) and Predictive Maintenance (PdM) inspection tasks for the Highly Critical Assets
Assist Reliability Engineers with collecting evidence and data during Root Cause Analysis investigations
Occasional travel to the different North American plants may be required
Required Skills:
Proficient in MS Excel, analyzing spreadsheet information, using Pareto's, Bar Charts, Look Up Tables, Pivot Tables, Drop Down Menus, etc.
Able to read drawings
Proficient in, MS Word and MS Power Point
Proficiency in AutoCAD is a plus
Fluent in English
Knowledge in French and/or Dutch is a plus
Troubleshooting capability is a plus
Self-starter and eager to work

Education:

 

Industrial, Mechanical or Electrical Engineering Student or equivalent

Job Summary:
Openings available for All Levels of UW students. 

Co-op Students working at Imagine Communications are given challenging problems and real tasks while working with broadcast, playout and media processing technologies. Students work as integral members of the software delivery team, in an open office environment with friendly people who have a passion for software development and making cool things. Your efforts will shape the future of world-class software that keeps over 3,000 customers in more than 185 countries - including the top broadcast facilities and the most technologically advanced sports and live-event venues - on-air every day.
Job Responsibilities:
As a co-op developer at Imagine Communications, a typical day would include the following:

Breakfast with provided coffee, tea, bagels, etc. in our kitchen.
Morning stand-up scrum to discuss what was done yesterday, what will be worked on today, and anything blocking or concerning you.
Spend the remainder of the day working on your assigned tasks or pick up some new tasks from the sprint backlog.
Having trouble? Talk to your mentor to discuss your challenges and talk through some potential solutions.
Need a break? Take one. You are responsible enough manage your own time and priorities.
Have a great idea or need more information? Talk to your manager, we welcome your inspiration, insight and ideas.
After a productive day, head home or stick around for some of the occasional social events such as LAN parties, sushi dinners, board game nights, bowling, or karaoke. These are all optional, but a great way to get to know your co-workers!
Required Skills:
This job might be for you if:

You are currently enrolled in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related discipline.
You are interested in researching emerging technologies, implementing prototypes and work on proof of concepts.
You are able to work with QA and technical support teams to resolve issues identified by internal testing and customers in the field.
You have User Interface development experience in any combination of: HTML5, JavaScript/TypeScript, CSS/LESS, AngularJS, .NET.
You have experience with object-orientated development in C# or C++.
You have worked with or developed RESTful web services.
You are versatile and adaptable when it comes to new tools and challenges as well as excellent troubleshooting and debugging skills.
You have well-developed oral and written communication skills.

Bonus points for:

Visual Studio experience
Multi-threaded application development
Event-based programming
Video knowledge - file formats, codecs, industry standards, etc.
Experience in Agile work environments
Database experience - preferably SQL Server

Job Summary:
A cooperative education student will support the design of products for a Division in the Department of Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC) from May 2021 to August 2021.
 
The student will assist in all stages of design from initiation and planning to conception and completion, to deliver products for the Temporary Resident Integrity Management Authority Division. These products may include, but are not limited to, dashboards, reports, and infographics.

The student will also gather and analyze large amounts of information and data for the Integrity Risk Management Branch (IRMB) related to IRCC program requirements, in order to prepare products for the Division.
 
Hours:  The work would be scheduled between 8:00 am and 5:00 pm EST daily for a total of 7.5 hours (37.5 hours per week).
Job Responsibilities:
Provide advice and creative guidance on products.
Use design and desktop publishing software and other multimedia software within the Government of Canada.
Assists senior officers in the preparation of briefing notes, memoranda, discussion papers, decks and presentation material on IRMB and IRCC operational issues for senior management and the Minister; 
Provides support and research assistance for IRCC staff on legislation, regulations, operational policies, program services as they generally apply, or apply to specific cases; assists senior officers in the production of statistical and/or analytical reports; 
Analyze risk, trends, and data to synthesize issues on policies, programs, strategies or initiatives involving information from multiple sources
Establishes and maintains effective working relations with colleagues within the department as well as other departments or agencies.
Support with clerical administrative tasks, such as: accept/decline/delegate invitations from others; schedule and support logistics for meetings; participate in meetings; track and update various administrative tasks, tools and deliverables.

Job Summary:
IRCC wants you! 

  

The International Network (IN) of the Department of Immigration Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC) is looking for people who think independently, work creatively and thrive in a team to help us deliver great results. 

We are based in the National Capital Region (Ottawa/Gatineau). This work term, our new team members will work remotely. So, if you are fully autonomous, can manage your time and projects effectively and can deliver results in a digital workspace, please read on! 

 
 
Who we are
The Workforce Management Division is responsible for the People Operations of nearly 1800 team members located around the world. Our main focus is to help our employees be productive at work, from the moment they're hired to the moment they leave. 

 
 
What do we do in real life?

Assign people to work in our missions abroad and to jobs in Canada
Determine, manage and have a clear pulse on staff capacity and resources
Manage the IN wellness program and focus on staff well-being
Plan and deliver Branch communications
Support and represent staff to navigate through change
Build up our workforce through recruitment, promotion, career development, forecasting, relationship management
Design and manage the famous Foreign Service Development program that prepares our migration diplomats to represent Canada abroad
Support our staff hired overseas
Deliver, design and coordinate learning, development and official language strategies and products

About International Network
At the International Network, we are the eyes, ears and voice of IRCC abroad. Outside Canada, we bring unique place-based value with our international presence in over 60 countries to represent Canada's migration agenda and lead on international migration topics. In Canada, we take the work done overseas and integrate it to inform and improve our policies, our partnerships and our services at IRCC. 

 
 
About IRCC
IRCC is responsible to shape the face of Canada and lead on international migration issues on behalf of Canada. We connect with almost every Canadian, welcome and facilitate immigrants from abroad and build the diversity that is part of our Canadian identity. We are looking for people who are passionate about our mandate and take pride in finding innovative solutions on improving how our services are delivered. 

We have been recognized as one of the National Capital Region's Top Employers of 2020. 

Using modern tools, we build and keep meaningful relationships with our clients and partners across the country and overseas. We believe in work-life balance and wellness of our team members. We care about our clients and believe in excellence while having fun.
Job Responsibilities:
Job Responsibilities:
As a Student in the Wellness and Culture team, your everyday work will include the following:

 

Assist us to develop and deliver sustainable and manageable communication plan
Design branding and marketing products
Write communication and messages that are delivered in various print media
Write communication and messages that are delivered orally (in-person or via recordings)
Work with clients and colleagues to design and implement visuals and content related to branding, marketing and communication activities
Support the administration of projects related to Change Management, Corporate Culture, and Wellness.
Perform administration tasks as required
Required Skills:
Required: 

+Experience developing and delivering communication plans 

+Knowledge of marketing techniques, including social media marketing 

+Ability to develop networks and liaise with internal and external clients 

+Excellent ability to communicate clearly and succinctly in writing 

+Excellent verbal communication 

+Knowledge and experience in visual design and visual storytelling, including branding and marketing products 

+Ability to work independently with minimal supervision. 

+Ability to work effectively in teams. 

+Sound judgment, thoroughness and flexibility 

+Ability to work and adapt in a fast-paced and fast-changing environment 


Asset: 

+Bilingual in Canada's official languages (French and English) 

+Graphic design knowledge 

+Marketing and design experience 

+Change Management concepts knowledge 

 
 
Additional Information:

Hiring Preference ? Reliability Security Clearance
Hiring Preference ? Canadian
Hiring Preference ? Bilingual (French and English)

Job Summary:
Job Description

At Imperial, inclusion & diversity is one of our core values. Our focus on inclusion & diversity helps create a workplace where people's unique contributions and perspectives are respected and valued. We believe that different ideas and viewpoints ultimately strengthen our company and help it grow and innovate. 

As part of our focus on diversity, it's our goal to achieve an increase in Indigenous representation in our workforce to better reflect the populations of the communities in which we operate. Please see here for Imperial's Indigenous Relations Guiding Principles and Guidelines. The Indigenous Student Employment Program is designed to provide top Indigenous talent with the opportunity to learn and develop their professional skills as they continue their formal education. 

You can hear more from past program participants here.
Job Responsibilities:
We are currently offering challenging, practical work experience in the following areas:
 

Engineering
	 
  
Variety of positions available across multiple departments including, but not limited to: upstream production and mining, refining and supply, chemicals, project engineering development and design, sales and marketing, environmental services, safety health and environment and facilities management


Procurement / supply-chain management
Accounting
Computer Science
Environmental Science
Required Skills:
Qualifications

This posting is intended for applicants who self-identify as Indigenous (First Nations, Inuit or Métis) or North American Indian (status or non-status). 


Academic:

Currently pursuing a university Bachelor's or Master's degree in Engineering, Business, Commerce, Environmental Science, Computer Science or related disciplines and returning to school after this work term.
Available for a work term beginning in January 2022
Your most recent unofficial transcript(s) must be submitted with your application

Other:

Effective communication (written and verbal), interpersonal and leadership skills
Strong analytical and time management skills
Ability to work with minimal supervision and in a team-based environment
Self-motivated, problem solver, and willingness to learn
Proficiency with Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook
A valid driver's license and a safe driving record are requirements for certain positions
Fluency in French is an asset for certain positions; please note in your cover letter if you are fluent in French

Job Summary:
Imperial is one of Canada's largest corporations and has been a leading member of the country's petroleum industry for more than a century.  We are the largest refiner and marketer of petroleum products - sold primarily under the Esso and Mobil brands - across the country.  A proven leader in hydrocarbon research, development, production, manufacturing, distribution, supply and logistics and marketing, we offer tremendously challenging and diverse employment opportunities. 


Discover what's possible!

There is more than one way to make a difference. Imperial hires talented students and new graduates from across the country.  If you're a student or new graduate in Engineering, Science, Business or related disciplines, explore the possibilities at Imperial.  

  

Relocation assistance is provided for successful candidates who qualify. 

  

All applications must be received to our careers website at: www.imperialoil.ca/careers. Ensure you submit a copy of your most recent unofficial transcript(s) with your application. 


To learn more about Imperial, please attend one of two across Canada information sessions:
 

Wed, Sept 22, 2021 at 5:00pm MST

Job Summary:
The position will be responsible for providing engineering support to the intermediate and senior engineers at Improtech. Applicants should have experience in preparing PFD's, P&ID drawings, and use of 2D AutoCAD drawing and support project management teams.   Assist lead project managers to support performing equipment checks, validation testing during project start up, and generate documentation for each test. 

Travel may be a requirement of this position when required for project/engineering work.  The successful candidate must have a valid driver's licence and access to a reliable automobile, or access to public transportation.
Job Responsibilities:
Perform equipment check-out, validation and documentation for testing during each phase of the project life cycle.
Follow job guidelines as described in the Improtech practice and procedure manual.
Use Solidworks and/or AutoCAD to prepare and/or revise drawings as required
Prepare and/or edit P&IDs or PFD drawings in a timely manner to ensure accuracy for client requriements
Work as a member of an engineering team, colaborating with the team leader and with Improtech management in an effective manner to perform engineering work of a high quality, with no errors.
Take care to produce work which is right the first time.
Be aware of budget and schedule constraints on all work executed for Improtech. Make every effort to complete assignment on time and on schedule.
Treat all Improtech information and customer information in a confidential manner.
Understand and abide by office policies and procedures.
Informs director of problems or issues which affect the companies' ability to meet customer requirements.
Maintain and continually improve technical and professional abilities described above and required to perform assigned tasks. 
Promptly inform Improtech management of any change in customer status or any information on customer business which may affect Improtech relationship with the customer or with work in progress.
Required Skills:
Candidates should have: 

experience using Solidworks, 3D and 2D AutoCAD software,
experiences from prior co-op terms in food, beverage or dairy industries
experience in preparing PFD's, P&ID drawings


Travel may be a requirement of this position for project/engineering work.

Job Summary:
Incognito Software Systems Inc. is at the forefront of digital transformation in the Communication Service Provider (CSP) market. Our solutions allow CSPs to manage in-home, enterprise, and IoT devices and services, bringing extensive AI/ML analytics and automation to reduce operational costs and improve the user experience. With over 25 years of experience, we've helped global service providers accelerate and innovate broadband services. Incognito is a division of the Lumine Group, a portfolio of Constellation Software Inc., the largest independent software company in Canada. 


We are looking for an experienced co-op student with Computer Science, Software Engineering or Computer Engineering background to join our team. You will be part of a team designing and implementing state of the art applications based on Java technologies and have the opportunity to grow and develop your career. As a software developer your responsibilities include designing and developing solutions on high-volume, low-latency multi-threaded applications for managing multi-million CPE and IoT devices. 


https://www.incognito.com/
Job Responsibilities:
·       Be a core participant in design, implementation and testing of software solutions. 

·       Create automated tests and ensure code is well tested. 

·       Coordinate with team to ensure timely delivery of project milestones. 

·       Research new technologies and identify opportunities to bring them into our codebase. 

·       Work with the product team to identify key customer requirements.
Required Skills:
·       Strong Java programming skills with experience in multi-threading and data structures 

·       Good database skills 

·       Ability to learn new technologies such as Kubernetes, Containerization and Elastic Stack.  

·       Experience with design and architecture of software 

·       Good knowledge of TCP/IP networking on Linux 

·       Experience using JUnit test framework 

·       Experience with HTML/ JavaScript is an asset
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
About Us:

We are a global technology company that connects the largest publishers and marketers across the globe through programmatic advertising. We ensure publishers are able to secure their bottom line so they can provide content to consumers and bring news and information to society at large. Our mission is to democratize digital advertising, all while helping marketers reach the audiences that matter most to them across digital channels. For over 20 years, IX has been known as the change agents of digital advertising - innovators who help shape how our industry reacts to new challenges and shifts in the market. As a result, we've been able to partner with some of the most prominent players in the media industry including Hearst, Disney, and Meredith Corporation among many others. Learn about Index Exchange https://www.indexexchange.com/about/. 


Why you will love working here:

Catered Lunches each Friday (will resume once back in offices)
Above average salary
Fully stocked fridge & snack shelves
Downtown Kitchener location (remote working until further notice)
Casual Dress
Job Responsibilities:
Responsibilities:

Develop our foundational platform that enables other engineers to build upon
Provide standards, templates
Experiment with new technologies
Contribute to code reviews, testing and deployments into our containerized environment
Participate in agile ceremonies
Required Skills:
What we are looking for:

Team Player: You will work in a six person agile team to help accomplish the team's goals while interacting with other teams.  How do you work with others to find the best solution?
Curiosity and Drive: Do you enjoy asking questions, learning, and creating solutions?
Problem Solvers: You don't stop until the problem gets solved and you find more than one way to solve it. 
Passion: You love tech and top-notch code and plan to make it better. 
Knowledge Hungry: Learning new frameworks and languages is exciting to you. 

Required Skills & Experience:

Currently enrolled in a BSc/MSc in Computer Science or related field/equivalent degree 
Proficient programming skills 
Strong communication skills, spoken and written 
General familiarity with computer science concepts and software technologies

 Nice to have(s):

Experience working with Frontend Frameworks (Angular, React)
Experience working with HTML, CSS and Javascript
Experience working with GoLang and/or NodeJS
Experience working with REST APIs
Experience working with Docker, Kubernetes
Experience working with Databases (MySQL, NoSQL)

Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				- Theme - Data Analytics, Statistical Analysis and Mathematical Optimization 
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering

Job Summary:
The 'Generating New Opportunities: Indigenous Off-Diesel Initiative (IODI)' aims to support remote Indigenous communities in developing and implementing ambitious plans to reduce diesel use for heat and power. Over three years, the Indigenous Off-Diesel Initiative has supported Indigenous Clean Energy Champions and their communities with tailored clean energy training, access to expertise and financial resources to develop and start implementing an ambitious diesel reduction plan.    


The Indigenous Clean Energy (ICE) Social Enterprise is the lead capacity-building institution providing training and support resources to energy champions and their communities participating in this program. ICE is seeking a full-time co-op student as a Program Assistant to support the ongoing mentorship and support services for this initiative. The Program Assistant will support the development of tools and resources, carry out research to support the IODI initiative, and build a meaningful relationship with Indigenous community champions to support them with their project endeavours.  


We are an equity employer and encourage all interested people to apply. However, First Nations, Inuit or Métis candidates will be given priority, please self-identify. Travel within Canada may be required. Compensation commensurate with experience.
Job Responsibilities:
- Lead the development of content for the quarterly newsletter
- Support the creation of templates for tools and resources for the IODI participants
- Support the developments of posts for the ICE Network about tools and resources available for IODI participants
- Support the development of IODI webinars which take place during the work term
- Support the maintenance of the ICE Mentor Database
- Lead the development of communications collateral for the program website and promotions
- Lead the development of case studies and project stories

Job Summary:
We're looking for an Electrical Product Development Intern to join the team at Inertia for a 4 month work placement - a talented electrical or mechatronics engineer who thrives in a collaborative environment where a diverse range of complex new products are designed, engineered and manufactured with quality and customer satisfaction always top of mind.  


About Inertia   


Inertia is a world-class team of new product design, engineering, and manufacturing experts, driven by results and obsessed with quality and customer service. We're also #1 ranked on the 2021 Best Workplaces™ in Canada. Our mission is to partner with product innovators to transform their dreams into thriving businesses.  We offer a full suite of product development services including strategy, design, engineering and manufacturing - all to ensure our clients have what they need to successfully bring their products to market.     


Inertia collaborates with clients across a variety of industries - from medical devices to sports wearables, to internet connected devices to agricultural robotics. Ranging from start-ups to multinationals, our customers share the drive to develop innovative products. They recognize the value and capacity of Inertia to help them bring their ideas to reality, and into customers' hands. The quality of our customers' products speak for themselves - see examples of our work at www.inertiaengineering.com.
Job Responsibilities:
Responsibilities 


As Electrical Product Development Intern reporting to a Product Development Engineer / Team Lead, you will, depending on the project and its stage of development: 

 
 

perform product / market / user research. 
design and implement proof-of concept electronics prototypes using various development kits and programming languages such as C or Python. 
carry out product testing.
create reports on your design / prototype / testing work.
actively participate in customer meetings. 
design and engineer electronics and electro-mechanical solutions that will actually work.
collaborate with the Inertia team and vendors to ensure a seamless customer experience and outstanding results.
develop and encourage strong peer relationships across various disciplines, functions, teams, and geographies. 
use Inertia's Business and Product Quality Management System to guide daily work.   
identify and implement continuous improvement opportunities. 
actively support and promote workplace health, safety and wellness. 
perform other relevant duties as may be assigned.
Required Skills:
Who we are looking for  


This job separates the great from the good, requiring a rare mix of spectacular smarts, creative problem solving, first-rate communication skills, strong work ethic, and an openness to connect and have fun with the team. 


You are/have: 
 

a third- or fourth-year Electrical Engineering or Mechatronics student with previous experience in product design or manufacturing.
good basic knowledge of electronics and microcontrollers. 
someone who tinkers and builds electronics / mechatronics projects in your spare time. 
have a curious nature and always strive to understand how things work. 
someone who knows how to use a soldering iron and are not afraid to use it! 
very comfortable troubleshooting projects using electronics test equipment such as a multimeter and an oscilloscope. 
have played with Arduinos, Raspberry PIs, Beaglebones or similar types of quick prototyping embedded platforms and can't wait to tell us all about your projects! 
are comfortable with embedded C programming and able to implement / test projects. 
a true passion and the perseverance for product design, engineering, prototyping and manufacturing (you'll need to because product development is a marathon).


You are someone who: 
 

wants to make a real and positive impact on the people around you and the world at large. 
listens intently and reacts with careful confidence and humility. 
likes to gather facts. You use them to help evaluate ideas and make decisions on what's best for the product and the customer. 
is great at communicating ideas.  
is the first to take on responsibility, the last to take credit (everyone gives it to you anyway) 
has a proven ability to develop constructive relationships with all internal and external partners.  
can work collaboratively, effectively, and efficiently without ego getting in the way.  
can tactfully and effectively address concerns or conflicts openly within the team. 
has the persistence and resourcefulness to overcome project obstacles and drive to resolution.  
can deal with uncertainty in a constructive manner and generate options for moving forward. 
does whatever it takes to get the job done. Without being asked.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Hardware
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
We're looking for a Product Development Intern to join Inertia's growing product development team for a 4 month work placement.  We are looking for a talented mechanical or mechatronics engineer to be part of a collaborative environment where a diverse range of complex new products are designed, engineered and manufactured with quality and customer satisfaction always top of mind. 

  

Interested in Joining Our Team?

Our people are our single biggest advantage.  We have a talented and motivated team looking for more great people to work and grow with.  We've built an amazing culture on a foundation of openness, service, and integrity - that also makes for a great place to work. Inertia ranks #1 on the 2021 Best Workplaces™ in Canada list for companies <50 employees, based on our practices and survey results from all Inertia employees. 


If you're interested in becoming part of our team, learn more about our values at www.inertiaengineering.com.  If you feel your values fit with ours, then we're off to a great start... 


What We Offer

Competitive compensation and benefits are just the start. At Inertia you will have the opportunity to create your own experience, build the kind of career you want, and help build the kind of company you want to be part of. You'll be treated as a part of the team from day one.   


We create truly unique products and outstanding customer experiences. You'll have the opportunity to be a key part of the customer journey, from first contact through to product delivery as Inertia works in all stages of the product development process.     


We are big believers in continuous growth. You'll have the opportunity to learn and grow, maybe more than any company you've ever worked with (our employees have told us so).   


Friendliness and smarts are not mutually exclusive at Inertia. You'll work with a diverse group of world-class team members that are open, collaborative, friendly and even a little nutty at times.   


Inertia is committed to building a diverse team and providing a safe and inclusive workplace.  We are continually learning and growing, including in our efforts to improve diversity and build equity.   


About Inertia

Inertia is a world-class team of new product design, engineering, and manufacturing experts, driven by results and obsessed with quality and customer service. Our mission is to partner with product innovators to transform their dreams into thriving businesses.  We offer a full suite of product development services including strategy, design, engineering and manufacturing - all to ensure our clients have what they need to successfully bring their products to market.     


Inertia collaborates with clients across a variety of industries - from medical devices to sports wearables, to internet connected devices. Ranging from start-ups to multinationals, our customers share the drive to develop innovative products. They recognize the value and capacity of Inertia to help them bring their ideas to reality, and into customers' hands. The quality of our customers' products speak for themselves - see examples of our work at www.inertiaengineering.com.
Job Responsibilities:
As Product Development Intern reporting to a Product Development Engineer / Team Lead, you will, depending on the project and its stage of development:
 

    perform product / market / user research.
    create CAD design studies and design parts and assemblies in Solidworks.
    carry out mechanical simulations including Finite Element Analysis (FEA).
    build electro-mechanical prototypes.
    carry out product testing.
    create reports on your design / prototype / testing work.
    actively participate in customer meetings.
    design and engineer mechanical and electro-mechanical solutions that will actually work.
    collaborate with the Inertia team and vendors to ensure a seamless customer experience and outstanding results.
    develop and encourage strong peer relationships across different functions, teams and geographies.
    use Inertia's BPMS (Business and Product Management System) to guide daily work.   
    identify and implement continuous improvement opportunities to help ensure a great customer and team experience.
    actively support and promote workplace health, safety and wellness.
    perform other related duties as assigned.

Who we are looking for  


This job separates the great from the good, requiring a rare mix of spectacular smarts, creative problem solving, first-rate communication skills, strong work ethic, and an openness to connect and have fun with the team. 


You are/have:

    a third or fourth year Mechanical Engineering, Mechatronics, Systems or Biomedical Engineering student with previous experience in product design or manufacturing and,
    a true passion and the perseverance for product design, engineering, prototyping and manufacturing (you'll need to because product development is a marathon).

You are someone who:

    wants to make a real and positive impact on the people around you and the world at large.
    listens intently and reacts with careful confidence and humility.
    likes to gather facts. You use them to help evaluate ideas and make decisions on what's best for the product and the customer.
    is great at communicating ideas.  
    is the first to take on responsibility, the last to take credit (everyone gives it to you anyway)
    has a proven ability to develop constructive relationships with all internal and external partners.  
    can work collaboratively, effectively, and efficiently without ego getting in the way.

Job Summary:
Co-op Software Developers are junior members of a software development team, performing developer related activities. They will assume supervised responsibility for implementing features/improvements, fixing bugs and developing tooling and solutions to help improve software development.  Co-op Software Developers have an understanding of software development, coding practices and, under the direction of senior team members, study and perform software development practices.  They should provide continual updates on the status of their work to their project lead.  Learning by example from the more senior staff on their projects, Co-op Software Developers should have strong teamwork and interpersonal skills, including strong communication skills to facilitate collaboration with their team. 


What we do:


At InFlight, we believe that multimillion dollar enterprise software can and should be every bit as easy-to-use as a $1 smartphone app. 


InFlight modernizes and mobilizes business critical enterprise applications for Fortune 500 customers, giving them full control over the user experience. 

Our technology is unique in the market and enables customers to completely re-imagine cumbersome and complicated applications to put users first and make it easier for them to complete tasks. 


Thanks to InFlight, there are millions of users who are now more productive and more engaged with the software they rely on to do their jobs. 


Who you are:


Co-op Software Developers are 2nd year, or above, students in Computer Science, Engineering or Mathematics. Previous software developer experience is a plus, but a keen interest in web application development and technology will also help set you apart. You will have a supervised role in developing and learning essential best practices, but as we are a young company, you'll also have a chance to help contribute in defining these areas.
Job Responsibilities:
So what do we need?:


Responsible for developing fixes/features, implementing tooling, under supervision of senior team members 

Adhering to / Creating software which adheres to good coding practices and maintainability 

Develop and consume HTTP/RESTful APIs 

Adhere to current web standards and best practices with a focus on mobile user experience 

Work closely, and collaborate, with other developers 

Participating in stand-ups, status meetings, providing reports from testing process to the team
Required Skills:
You may be the person we're looking for if you have:


Previous experience as QA/Software Developer/University Study 

Experience with these tools considered a plus: 

HTTP/Web Services/RESTful APIs 

Javascript, Typescript, HTML, CSS 

AngularJS, React.js

We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Software Developer to join our growing Workforce Management organization for 1-2 Co-op terms.  Infor Workforce Management is a powerful scheduling solution that focuses on employee scheduling, and time and attendance tracking, serving a Fortune 500 client portfolio.

Job Summary:
Infrastructure Ontario (IO) is a Crown corporation which plays a critical role in supporting the Ontario government to modernize and maximize the value of public infrastructure and real estate, manage government facilities, and finance the renewal of the province's public infrastructure. We believe in the potential of the public and private sector working together. With a province?wide portfolio that features nearly 5,000 provincial buildings/structures and 130,000 acres of land, IO is one of the largest real estate management companies in Canada.  Working at IO offers you the opportunity to contribute to the wellbeing of the people of Ontario, develop your career and learn from some of the most qualified individuals in the industry.  


To learn more about IO and the work we do, visit www.infrastructureontario.ca. 

  

The Environmental Management team supports all IO business streams in oversight of environmental, geotechnical and cultural heritage projects and provisions of related advice.
Required Skills:
Experience:

Training in the identification of environmental issues
Knowledge of various environmental legislations (i.e. Ontario Environmental Assessment Act, Environmental Protection Act, Ontario Species at Risk Act, Environmental Bill of Rights)
Past work experience with Environmental Assessment - Class EA, Phase I and II ESAs, designated substance surveys, implementing remedial action plans, conducting risk assessment, and environmental knowledge transfer considered an asset

  

Skills and Personal Attributes:

Excellent oral and written communication, customer service, and interpersonal skills
Analytical, interpretive, and project skills
Proficient in the Microsoft Suite Office Products, project management applications, GIS applications,  and geospatial solutions
Attention to detail and good organization and ability to manage numerous on-going projects is an essential requirement for this position

  

Education and Knowledge:

Enrolled in a co-op undergraduate program in environmental studies, geosciences, geography, environmental sciences, impact assessment, or environmental engineering. 
Knowledge of environmental assessment and class environmental assessment process
Knowledge of environmental investigation, contaminated sites remediation, procedures in risk assessment, and environmentally significant areas analysis
Knowledge of Environmental Management Systems (eg. ISO 14001)


General knowledge of real estate industry considered an asset

Job Summary:
Currently we are working remotely, with a possibility of returning to the office on a hybrid approach (some office/some remote) in early 2022. As such, we require all students to reside in or near the Greater Toronto Area or National Capital Region for the duration of their placement.  


Meet Innovapost and the Canada Post Group of Companies

  

Innovapost is the Information Technology Shared Services provider for the Canada Post Group of Companies, which includes Canada Post, Purolator, and SCI Group. Together, this group of companies generates approximately $8.7 billion in revenue and employs close to 67,000 people. Each year, Canadians from coast to coast rely on this organization to deliver more than 8 billion pieces of mail, parcels and messages across 16+ million addresses. Operating both the largest transportation fleet (18,000 vehicles) and the largest retail network in Canada (7,000 locations), the online world relies on this group's innovative products and services every day.  

  

Innovapost provides the technology and services powering some of the most complex systems and online properties in Canada. Our core services include application development and maintenance, IT infrastructure and Network Management, IT Architecture and Technology development, and much more. These technologies and services help support the largest mobile device deployment in Canada (35,000), one of the largest ERP installations in Canada, and $15 million in e-shipping transactions per day. 

  

Not only does the work at Innovapost improve services used by millions of Canadians, we also find the time to give back to our communities. Innovapost has been a committed supporter of local charities throughout Ottawa, Mississauga, and Toronto. Our commitment to social and community responsibility is heightened by our employees' spirit of cooperation, collaboration and giving. Not only are we making a real difference and noticeable impact in our communities, our community activities further strengthen team relationships and make Innovapost a rewarding place to work.  

If you constantly strive for excellence, are passionate about technology, love to deliver amazing customer experiences and want to work with a collaborative, energetic team, Innovapost is the right place for you! 

  

  

Summary

  

In these unprecedented times, the need for Data insight has increased dramatically!  We are seeking results and performance driven individuals that have demonstrated the ability to lead, work independently as well as part of a group. You are passionate, customer-focused and adaptable to our every changing Business need!  Your analytical, interpersonal, problem solving, and oral and written communication skills should be excellent as you'll be collaborating with our Business and Internal Partners identifying priorities and requirements.
Job Responsibilities:
Job Responsibilities:     

  

The successful candidate will join our QA team and assist with the development, establishment, and enforcement of quality assurance measures and testing standards for new and legacy applications, and software upgrades throughout their development and product lifecycles.  The successful candidate will be responsible for:
 

Defining and applying quality procedures for every stage of the project life cycle
Designing test plans, test cases and test data based on business/functional requirements
Creating and executing automated test scripts using testing software programs
Track, log and report defects using defect management tools
Collaborate with the business and project teams to evaluate requirements for testing new or modified products and documentation prior to production release
Execute various systems, performance, batch testing, UAT testing, integration, regression and ad-hoc tests according to approved test plans and testing schedules
Troubleshoot, in conjunction with end users and development teams on issues of reproducing, investigating and debugging software

  

The successful candidate will become familiar with Software and Platform testing for one of the leading Data Warehouse technologies.  The successful candidate will work with all internal teams within the Data Analytics environment as well as the Business User community.
Required Skills:
Required Skills:               

 
 

Currently enrolled at a Canadian post-secondary institution with a focus on Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Commerce, or Business Analysis.
Leadership acumen and a passion to apply it in a dynamic business environment
Excellent interpersonal and highly developed communication skills (verbal and written)
Creative and analytical thinker who is self-driven and capable of working in a fast paced environment
Strong MS Office skills - Word, Outlook, Excel
Basic concept of Software Quality Assurance Testing
Basic relational database and SQL scripting knowledge
Understanding of Agile methodology and knowledgeable about related tools such as JIRA are an asset


  

Nice-to-have: 

 
 

Prior experience in Data Warehouse application
Teradata database
Ability to learn and absorb new concepts (in business and in systems) quickly and apply new knowledge

  

Reporting to:  QA Team Lead

Organization: Innovation Science and Economic Development Canada
Job Summary:
Canadian Intellectual Property Office
Position:  Patent Examination Student  - Mechanical Division
Location: Gatineau, QC
 
About us:
The Canadian Intellectual Property Office (CIPO), a branch of Innovation, Science, and Economic Development Canada (ISED), is responsible for delivering intellectual property (IP) services in Canada and plays an important role in fostering innovation. Intellectual property refers to creations of the mind, such as inventions; literary and artistic works; designs; and symbols, names and images used in commerce. Intellectual property in Canada is protected by law and includes patents, trademarks, copyrights, industrial designs, and integrated circuit topographies. The protection of IP rights allows for the interests of inventors and innovators to be protected, while also allowing the wider public to benefit from new innovations.
 
Job Opportunity:
An opportunity exists within the Patent Branch of CIPO, located in Phase 1 of the Place du Portage complex in Gatineau, QC.  The successful candidate will be involved in the day to day workings of the mechanical patent examination division and will gain valuable training and experience working with intellectual property and the Canadian Patent System. Relevant experience and coursework is an asset, however no formal experience is necessary, and in-house training will be provided.
 
The successful candidate will work in conjunction with Patent Examiners, and will be involved in a range of activities pertaining to the examination of a mechanical patent applications.

Career development and training:
Enhance your knowledge of the Canadian Patent system and the role of intellectual property in the innovation cycle
Learn to understand and effectively communicate complex technical systems and concepts
Gain insight into new and exciting innovations in Canadian technology
Learn to quickly and efficiently gather useful information from large databases
Grow your professional network by connecting with Examiners from diverse engineering backgrounds with broad public and private industry experience in numerous fields
Experience work and life in the public service
 
Work Environment :
CIPO has a diverse workforce of roughly 1000 employees, of which approximately 375 are patent examiners. CIPO is proud to offer an organization which fosters the use of both French and English. As a new employee, you can expect a fully bilingual work environment, which includes your work tools, your training, and speaking to your manager in the official language of your choice.
 
Transportation: 
Place du Portage 1 is accessible via public transportation and parking is available for a fee.
 
** The candidate must bring proof of Canadian Citizenship to the interview.
 
For more information about CIPO, please visit:
http://www.ic.gc.ca/eic/site/cipointernet-internetopic.nsf/eng/Home
 
For more information about the role of Patent Examiners, please visit:
http://www.ic.gc.ca/eic/site/cipointernet-internetopic.nsf/eng/wr01175.html
Job Responsibilities:
Job responsibilities:
Examining Canadian patent applications for defects pertaining to Canadian patent practise
Determining inventive concepts and technical solutions for which patent protection is being sought
Defining inventive concept statements and developing search strategies
Searching patent and non-patent literature databases to identify pertinent documents and relevant, state of the art technologies
Preparing Canadian application files: creating document folders, determining patent application family
Other examination related tasks
Required Skills:
Required skills:
Ability to analyze and synthesize the technical elements of a situation or a process
Ability to compare and contrast complex systems and identify their similarities 
Ability to communicate effectively orally and in writing
Ability to work independently and manage a workload with minimal supervision
Ability to learn quickly and ask questions when needed

				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering

Organization: Innovation Science and Economic Development Canada
Division: Economic Strategy Tables and Skills Branch
Job Summary:
Background

Forces driving the changing nature of work, such as artificial intelligence, automation and digital technology are advancing quickly; leading to both skills mismatches and labour shortages. In response, industries, academics, and governments around the world are exploring new and innovative ways to improve the skills and talent for labor forces. Recent impacts of COVID-19 on industry and the workforce are expediting some of these changes, altering others and creating new employer needs.  

  

The future of work is well documented. Employer skills challenges and opportunities are not always well understood and are changing as the economy experiences the impact of COVID-19 on its operations and workforce. The ISED Skills and Talent Directorate works to better understand these changes to make it easier for industry to have access to skilled workers, to train/retrain the workforce needed for the digital and innovative economy and to help the industry move into recovery as COVID-19 restriction ease.

Essential skills and competencies required:

Excellent oral and written communication skills
Ability to work horizontally as a member of a project team
Time management and the capacity to work under tight timelines
Flexibility to approach new challenges and priorities
Ability to manage multiple projects at once
English language proficiency (oral and written)
Ability to interpret and explain complex material
Intellectually curious and creative

  

Asset Criteria (not essential for employment)
