Organization: Innovation Science and Economic Development Canada
Job Summary:
Who We Are

Situated within Innovation, Science and Economic Development's Industry Sector, the Manufacturing and Life Sciences Branch (the Branch) is responsible for policy analysis and development for key sectors of Canada's economy, including advanced manufacturing (e.g. steel and aluminum, plastics and chemicals, critical minerals, and machinery and equipment); food and beverage processing, manufactured consumer products, textiles and apparel. The Branch conducts stakeholder outreach and analysis related to the development and delivery of government programs and priorities affecting industry competitiveness. Government priorities and programs that are a key focus for the Branch include: decarbonization of Canada's economy; international trade; critical minerals; digital transformation, AI and robotics. 


The Branch puts forth evidence-based ideas that can further the Innovation and Skills Plan, the Government's industrial policy. This includes supporting four Economic Strategy Tables (Health and Biosciences, Retail, Agri-food and Advanced Manufacturing) and two flagship programs (Innovation Superclusters Initiative and Strategic Investment Fund). The Branch is deeply involved in advancing environmental priorities such as achieving net-zero emissions and zero plastic waste and driving the development and adoption of clean technologies. 


The Branch regularly engages with other branches at ISED as well as other departments on strategic, cross-cutting files such as climate change, technology adoption, and trade. We actively conduct stakeholder outreach with firms and industry associations on a regular basis, to gather information and communicate the Government's policies. 


We have a proud history of bringing back exceptional students for multiple work terms, recruiting them following graduation, and helping them secure positions in highly competitive programs such as the Advanced Policy Analyst Program. We are seeking an energetic student to support the exciting work that the Government is doing to grow innovation in Canada.
Job Responsibilities:
Job Description:

The Consumer Products Directorate is seeking one Junior Analyst to join their team. The Junior Analyst will assist with research, analysis and the development of policy advice on issues related to Canada's agriculture and agri-food sector, including trade, competitiveness, productivity, sustainability and regulations. 


The Junior Analyst will collaborate with other members of the dynamic team to generate compelling analytical and research products. 


The Junior Analyst will also complete sector scans of existing government and industry initiatives.

Job Summary: Innovation, Science and Economic Development Canada has a Spectrum Management and Telecommunications Sector. The Sector is responsible for Spectrum management modernization including automation of licensing to support large numbers of licences over small areas (e.g., campuses, mines) and potentially for shorter and/or variable periods (hours/days/weeks/months/years). This project involves several workpackages and several stakeholders. It covers the development of the licencing policy, process and conditions, including public consultation and legislative review. It also includes coordinating the IT upgrade (with possible migration to cloud) for the implementation of the policy and monitoring of user compliance to spectrum regulations. The job involves the planning, coordination of all the work packages, ensuring timely deliverables, effective collaboration with stakeholders and risk management.

Job Title: Engineering & Computer Science Trainee in Advanced Telecommunications Research & Development
Organization: Innovation Science and Economic Development Canada
Job Summary:
Workplace

Communications Research Centre Canada (CRC) is the federal government's primary laboratory for research and development (R&D) in advanced telecommunications systems and technologies. It performs wireless telecommunications R&D that advances the efficient exploitation of the radio spectrum, and serves as the federal government's leading source of scientific knowledge and long-term technical advice, primarily to support the development of public policy and services for Innovation, Science and Economic Development Canada. CRC is located in Ottawa.  More details can be found at: http://www.crc.gc.ca/


CRCs Grand Challenges are designed to tackle fundamental problems facing our wireless future. Much of CRC's R&D is performed in pursuit of its three Grand Challenges: spectrum environment awareness; breaking the frequency barrier; and making better use of spectrum. 

 
 
 Spectrum environment awareness (SEA)

CRC researchers are working to develop a prototype system that will monitor and analyze spectrum usage in real time, a necessary first step in moving toward better management of the resource. 
 

Making better use of spectrum (MBUS)

CRC researchers are developing innovative technologies and techniques for making better use of the spectrum through, for example, spectrum and network sharing. 
 

Breaking the frequency barrier (BFB)

CRC researchers are studying advanced technologies, such as new antennas and engineered surfaces that will allow us to open up new swaths of spectrum for future commercial mobile communications. 


Candidate

CRC has 18 positions open for co-op work terms of 4, 8 and 12 months duration available. The selection of candidates will be based on course marks, previous work experience, attitude, personality and academic achievement. Candidates should have a strong interest in the field of telecommunications or computer science. Candidates will be assigned to projects based on current organizational requirements and the candidate's resume.  This will result in candidates who are furthest along in their academic career getting the more challenging work assignments.  Candidates are welcome to express interests or preferences which will be considered during the student-to-assignment matching process. 


Work term offers can only be made to Canadian citizens.  All students who work at CRC are subject to a security clearance process prior to receiving a contract.  Only students enrolled in Computer Science, Computer/Software Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics, Physics or a related field will be considered.
Job Responsibilities:
Areas of Expertise


Cloud Computing

CRC has moved its entire compute-power up to a Virtual Research Domain in the public cloud.  All engineers, scientists and students work from virtual machines configured with the latest software.  Students participate in the ongoing development and management of this complex environment. 

 
 
 Example student activities:

Create/update visuals for dashboards using PowerBI
Write/modify code in Python to insert/update MySQL databases
Data collection/preparation/validation for data in the Sustainable Spectrum Management testbed system


Big Data

CRC is collecting 100s of gigabytes of new wireless spectrum data annually from a network of sensors located across Canada.  This data is gathered, managed and analyzed by engineers, scientists and students who are exploiting machine learning and conducting predictive analytics to meet the goals of the 3 Grand Challenges.   

 
 
 Example student activities:

Investigate trends in crowdsourced mobile spectrum data, spectrum license database, and other sensed or external data sources
Develop interactive dashboards for data exploration and analysis
Implement algorithms for data cleaning, data fusion, clustering and predictive modelling


Advanced Technology Demonstrations

As CRC is focused on what is possible and what works, engineers, scientists and students are called upon to demonstrate CRCs discoveries.   CRC is pushing boundaries on the visualization of data with a 3D stereoscopic curved wall and the use of virtual and augmented realities.  CRC also demonstrates in-house developed prototypes such as new sensing technologies and engineered surfaces for the propagation of millimeter waves.
 


Example student activities:

Continue the development of the Collaborative Spectrum Operations platform with the Augmented Reality App under Unity
Contribute to the construction of a radio environment map
Setup a Land Mobile Radio network in the lab (P400 radios, attenuators)
Perform propagation analysis using electromagnetic simulation tools such as Wireless InSite and Winprop.
Required Skills:
Useful background knowledge and/or experience in: 

  Basic knowledge in one of the following areas:  digital signal processing and wireless communications; propagation and antennas; wireless broadband communication (LTE, WiFi); sophisticated RF or IF measurement equipment; test automation; cloud computing and parallel processing; graphical information systems (GIS) and mapping; indoor/outdoor field work. 
 
Programming languages:  C/C++/C#, VB, Java, JavaScript, HTML, MATLAB. 
 
Analytics and databases:  Python, R, Spark, SQL. 
 
Programming using:  GPU; GNURadio; RFNOC; signal processing (analog and digital), OpenCL, OpenGL 
 
Operating Systems:  Windows, GNU/Linux, Android.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Applied Mathematics
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science
				
			
				SCI - Physics

Job Summary:
Inscopix has developed a miniaturized, real-time, brain mapping platform - enabling radically new approaches to understanding the brain.  The Company is not only advancing the mechanistic understanding of the brain at the level of neural circuits and networks, but also paving the way for incisive new insights into healthy brain function and next generation diagnostic treatments and therapeutics for brain disorders.  

We are seeking an Optomechanical Engineer to integrate optical and mechanical methods to design a miniaturized microscope for recording neural network activity in behaving animals.
Job Responsibilities:
The Optomechanical Engineer will:
- Integrate optical (Zemax) and mechanical software packages (Solidworks) to design, 3D print and test miniaturized fluorescence microscopes
- Explore and initiate development of novel methods for use in in vivo brain imaging
- Design custom optical, mechanical and/or electronic components/systems
- Bring optical (imaging) systems from concept to prototype
Required Skills:
The applicant must have:
- Ablity to communicate technical concepts clearly
- Proficiency with Solidworks or mechanical software packages
- Experience developing at least one project from the ground up (course work counts)
- Ability to work in teams

Desired Experience (Not Required):
- Experience with Zemax or optical software packages

Targeted Clusters

				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Systems Design and Biomedical Engineering

Job Summary:
About Us: 


Insticator increases engagement and ad revenue for publishers through interactive content while enhancing viewability and purchase intent for brands. 


Over 350 million consumers are reached monthly across Insticator's vast network of elite publishing partners that include Warner Bros., Ancestry.com, Tribune Media, Rodale, Evolve Media, Crave Media, The Atlantic and more. Insticator empowers more than 6,000 content creators monthly with its revenue and engagement increasing products, while providing monetizing content opportunities for publishers and brands. 


The Position 


Insticator is looking for a front-end engineer to join our growing team of talented developers. We want someone who's passionate about creating engaging web experiences that users love interacting with and engineers love maintaining. 


You should love clean, intuitive interfaces and be somewhere on the scale of professionally to inappropriately excited about reusable, modular, efficient code. it would kinda be like designing the exterior armor of a spaceship except we work in adtech. It's pretty close.
Job Responsibilities:
Our tech stack is ever evolving and always open to change. For now, here's what we're running: 


React 

Our products are built using React. We find the modular nature of react refreshing to develop in. Allowing us to break applications into very small component level pieces which helps us more easily isolate tasks when multiple developers are working in the same code base, helps us better update and extend features, and generally makes the DX much more enjoyable. 


Redux 

We use Redux for application state management. This enables us to centrally track changes in state to the application and adjust the UI based on these changes. Coupled with local component state we find this a very powerful tool in our arsenal and generally like to use it with wrapping HOCs.  


JSS 

JSS is how we style our UI. We find the integration with the component based architecture of React to be incredibly useful. Stylesheets are broken into small fragments that are grouped together with the component they'll be styling. Ultimately just JavaScript, this means we can dynamically update styles with great ease as well as import and extend code.
Required Skills:
What we're looking for in a candidate? 


Someone who cares 

We don't want candidates who just see this as a job. You should care about the quality of work you produce. You have to be driven to create something you're proud to show to others. You have to be willing to work hard and smart. 


Someone who owns their work 

A person who goes the extra mile to communicate to intra/cross team members when they feel it's necessary, calls out things that are concerning, and generally does what's right for the product and code. 


Dedication to craft 

You should be fanatic about the quality of code you write. Efficiency, conciseness, composability, modularity, extensibility, readability are some words that come to mind. If these things matter to you, you're who were looking for. 


High level of skill 

We need an impact player. Someone who can come in and code amazing things quickly, help us move our product along at a higher rate of speed, and be an autonomous contributor when necessary.  


Experience 

- Strong knowledge in Javascript fundamentals (ES6 preferred) 

- Strong experience building production ready applications, specifically in React 

- Experience with responsive, single page, event driven web applications 

- Experience with asynchronous data-driven actions 

- Ability to replicate designs to a pixel and hand write stylesheets in a maintainable fashion  

- Ability to intuitively animate UI elements via custom CSS animation 

- Ability to quickly diagnose issues and correct them 

- Solid grasp of application state vs local state and how these affect UI renders 

- Data intensive dashboard experience is a huge plus
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Information Systems 
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Quality Assurance 
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				- Theme - Digital and Graphic Media; Web Site Design and Development 
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

Job Summary:
It's more than a great career.  It's a bright future. 


Are you looking to gain invaluable industry experience and fast-track an exciting career?  


At Intact, we're leading an insurance transformation to better protect people, businesses and society. We want future leaders -- like you -- to help us lead the charge. Join our Actuarial team as an Actuarial Analyst Co-op/Intern for the Winter 2022 term. In this role, you'll make a difference while building the skills and experience that will propel your career forward.
Job Responsibilities:
About the role 


Here, we cultivate an environment that will help you meet your full potential. You'll be encouraged to seize on challenges, learn from our diverse teams, and grow. As a valued member of the team, you'll get hands-on business experience, on-the-job coaching and opportunities to build relationships. That's how we develop the future leaders who will continue to deliver on our purpose to help people, businesses, and society prosper in good times and be resilient in bad times. 


As an Actuarial Analyst Co-op/Intern at Intact, you will learn to analyze and manage risk  - ultimately driving our insights and business solutions. 


What you'll do here:

Collect, process, validate and analyze statistical data; prepare actuarial reports 
Assist in product pricing, corporate planning, statistical modelling, actuarial indications and/or underwriting analysis 
Use actuarial techniques to ensure that the company has adequate loss reserves and reinsurance as well as a sufficient amount of capital to respond to various catastrophe scenarios
Contribute to the company's innovation initiatives in machine learning, customer experience, usage-based insurance and climate change

You will also have the chance to:

Visualize a career in Property and Casualty Insurance as you discover more about our exciting, evolving industry
Build relationships and networks to support your professional growth and success
Expand your skills through collaboration with and training from our experts
Collaborate with colleagues on developmental projects and share your knowledge
Help us innovate through data

Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team: 

An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work 
Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career
Required Skills:
What you bring to the table:

Currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Actuarial Sciences, Finance, Economics, or related fields
Available to work with us for Winter 2022 (January to April) 
Must be returning to full time studies in 2022 following the internship
Proficiency in MS Excel 
1-2 CAS/SOA exams completed is considered an asset
Basic programming knowledge; experience in programming languages such as Python, SAS, SQL, Visual Basic is considered an asset
Strong analytical and interpersonal skills
Strong leadership skills and business acumen
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Data Analytics, Statistical Analysis and Mathematical Optimization 
				
			
				- Theme - Information Science and Data Management 
				
			
				- Theme - Insurance and Risk Management 
				
			
				MATH - Statistics and Actuarial Science

Job Summary:
Intel is expanding its leading position in graphics for the PC market with high-end discrete graphics solutions for a broad range of computing segments. Millions of users today enjoy computing experiences powered by Intel's leading cores and visual computing IP. We are adding to our portfolio of unmatched capabilities, advancing our strategy to lead in computing and graphics, and ultimately be the driving force of the data revolution.  

  

Intel is looking for a highly motivated, passionate individual to join the Graphics Platform Engineering Validation team to validate our next generation of discrete graphics hardware and work with cutting edge IP design technologies.
Job Responsibilities:
- Design, develop, and execute test plans to validate latest Intel dGPUs 

- Triage, track and assist in root-causing any potential hardware or software bugs through hands-on lab debug and experimentation 

- Collaborate with cross-functional, globally located silicon, board design, and thermal mechanical teams to drive issues to closure to meet aggressive schedules 

- Develop automation infrastructure and implement test cases in Python 

- Setup and maintain test platforms (various host PCs), equipment used on benches, thermal apparatus, and other test equipment  

- Database and inventory management for equipment/platforms used in lab.  

- Continuously look for ways to innovate and improve Intel's products and/or processes
Required Skills:
- Candidate must be pursuing a Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science or other science/engineering related field  

- Experience with Windows drivers, operating systems, error logs, setting up/configuring programs  

- Experience with Linux operating systems and windows command line   

- Programming skills in Python or similar languages   

- Strong fundamental knowledge of computer architecture, computer organization   

- Experience with lab equipment such as oscilloscopes/multimeters/power supplies/etc  

- Excellent written and verbal communication skills with attention to detail  

- Able to excel in an agile and dynamic work environment 


Ways to stand out above the crowd: 

- Computer enthusiasts and excellent knowledge of current leading PC technology  

- General knowledge of discrete graphics add-in cards or mobile discrete graphics systems  

- Familiar with PC x86 architecture and excellent system level knowledge including: CPU processor, multimedia, memory, PCIe, display technologies, power management, 3D graphics  

- Experience in building your own PC

Job Summary:
Intel manufactures some of the most advanced silicon products in the world.  FPGAs are one class of these products that present unique challenges due to their high degree of programmability.  FPGA chips are used globally in everything from modern high end AI systems, modern high speed networking, and down to small scale hobby boards. 

Modern FPGAs also feature highly programable Input and Output (IO) banks that can deliver a variety of protocols (DDR3, DDR4, LVDS, etc.) and features.  In this position the intern will be working directly with silicon data on how the IO banks work and how they are modelled.  The job also involves working on a variety of IPs, their implementation and testing.
Job Responsibilities:
Wide variety of languages: Python, C++, TCL, and Verilog
Work with variety of IPs : DDR3, DDR4, LVDS, PLL, General Purpose IOs
Algorithm work: Place and Route, mapping between physical and model, optimization scripting for large changes.
Required Skills:
None
Year 3A+ preferred
Prefer C++, TCL and similar language skills
Python, and Verilog skills a benefit
Prefer combination of Software and Hardware experienceet

Job Summary: Intel manufactures some of the most advanced silicon products in the world.  FPGAs are one class of these products that present unique challenges due to their high degree of programmability.  To ensure that the FPGAs Intel produces meet the performance and power requirements predicted by Intel's Quartus software, extensive testing and data analysis is required.  In this position, an intern will develop and optimize software tools that enable this analysis.  These tools take data collected by teams around the world and analyze the data to determine the accuracy of timing and power models of FPGAs.
Job Responsibilities: The position provides exposure to a range of tools and technologies from database design & architecture to Python development to application deployment with Cloud Foundry and other tools.  Strong problem solving skills along with experience programming with Python will allow a successful intern to develop a number of new features and improve the efficiency of multiple teams.

Job Summary:
Job Summary

Excited about the potential of mixed reality (AR/VR) as a transformative technology? Eager to develop new skills and find solutions to real world problems? Also - wanna have fun doing it? :) Interaptix has great opportunities to build industrial solutions using AR and other technologies. Every member of the team is vital to both our work and our culture - ideas can come from anyone and your input is valued. Come work as an integral member of our R&D and engineering team where you will apply your passion, knowledge, and ingenuity to develop novel solutions at the cutting edge of technology! 


About Us

Interaptix is an augmented reality startup working at the intersection of mixed reality, HCI, machine learning, and computer vision to fundamentally revolutionize how people interact with the world and one another. With our headquarters in downtown Toronto, Interaptix is funded by some of the most prominent tech investors and entrepreneurs. We are a tight-knit team that produces mind-blowing experiences, and we have a great time doing it! If you are passionate about making an impact in this exciting space, join our growing team in building new realities! https://www.instagram.com/interaptix/

Researching and prototyping cutting edge techniques to improve existing systems
Implementing algorithms in areas such as image processing, 3D reconstruction, sensor fusion, networking, graphics, or machine learning
Ownership of your contributions and areas where you build expertise
Troubleshooting and bug fixing

Prototyping skills
Python experience
Strong math skills with an emphasis on 3D math, linear algebra, and numerical optimization
Experience creating and working with REST APIs
Attention to detail and a passion for producing high quality work
Familiarity with computer vision, image processing concepts, information theory, and machine learning
Familiarity with at least one version control software: Git, Perforce, Subversion, etc
Background in computer science, mechatronics, software or computer engineering (or related field)


Bonus Skills:

Experience with Django
Experience with React (or other front end technologies)
Experience with ARCore and/or ARKit
Experience working with cloud technologies (e.g. MS Azure, AWS, etc.)
Experience working with databases

Job Title:
NEW
									



										Mobile Developer Co-op (Android & iOs) - TurboTax
Job Summary:
About Intuit, Inc.

At Intuit, we get up every morning with our hearts beating fast, excited and driven by the knowledge that we're transforming the world of consumer and small business finance. We're obsessed with our customers, and because of our obsession, we're continually challenging and disrupting ourselves to improve their financial lives. It's why our products TurboTax, Mint and QuickBooks, continue to resonate with 50 million consumers around the globe. We are a Fortune 500 fintech company and are proud to have been ranked as the #1 Best Workplace in Canada in 2019, and #2 in 2021. We've been at the top of this list for 10+ years! 


Imagine a career where your creative inspiration can fuel BIG innovation. Year-over-year, Intuit has been recognized as a best employer and is consistently ranked on Fortune's "100 Best Companies To Work For" and Fortune World's "Most Admired Software Companies" lists. Immerse yourself in our award winning culture while creating breakthrough solutions that simplify the lives of consumers and small businesses and their customers worldwide. 


Discover what it's like to be part of a team that rewards taking risks and trying new things. It's time to love what you do! Check out all of our career opportunities at: careers.intuit.com. 

  

About the Opportunity

At Intuit, we believe that student hires are the next generation of tech entrepreneurs.  Our internship program is focused on identifying high-potential university students and equipping them with the tools they need to succeed in the tech industry. We support students by fully integrating them into our teams and providing direct support from fellow technologists, encouraging participation in team-run learning sessions, sharing timely feedback, and giving the opportunity to share their work with the broader team. 


About the Team

We're the Mobile Development Team for the Consumer Group (TurboTax). We're a team of passionate innovators who are obsessed with delivering the best customer experiences. If you are interested in hands-on mobile development experience, and an opportunity to make a real impact on the lives of our customers; you're in the right place. 


Intuit is expanding its social, mobile, and global footprint with a full suite of products and services that are revolutionizing the industry. Utilizing design for delight and lean startup methodologies, our entrepreneurial employees have brought more than 250 innovations to market: from QuickBooks®, Quicken®, and TurboTax®, Mint.com, big data, cloud (SaaS, PaaS) and mobile apps. The breadth and depth of these customer-driven innovations mean limitless opportunities for you to turn your ingenious ideas into reality at Intuit.  


Who you are

You love partnering with your dev & designer friends and realizing their visions with your code. You're a lover of learning, teamwork and having fun during the work day. You are ready to solve seriously real problems through agile and Agile and experiment-driven mobile development.
Job Responsibilities:
What you'll do

Assisting with architecting, designing, and developing applications, prototypes, or POC's for the TurboTax group.
Gathering of functional requirements, developing technical specifications, and project & test planning
Contribute to quality best practices including peer reviews of estimates, design, and code
Required Skills:
Qualifications

Currently enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate degree in a related field

Job Title:
NEW
									



										UX Design Co-op (Product, Interaction, Content & Research Designers)
Job Summary:
About Intuit, Inc.

At Intuit, we get up every morning with our hearts beating fast, excited and driven by the knowledge that we're transforming the world of consumer and small business finance. We're obsessed with our customers, and because of our obsession, we're continually challenging and disrupting ourselves to improve their financial lives. It's why our products- TurboTax, Mint and QuickBooks- continue to resonate with 50 million consumers around the globe. We are a Fortune 500 fintech company and are proud to have been ranked as the #1 Best Workplace in Canada in 2019. 

  

About the Opportunity

At Intuit, we believe that student hires are the next generation of tech entrepreneurs.  Our internship program is focused on identifying high-potential university students and equipping them with the tools they need to succeed in the tech industry. We support students by fully integrating them into our teams and providing direct support from fellow technologists, encouraging participation in team-run learning sessions, sharing timely feedback, and giving the opportunity to share their work with the broader team. 

  

About the team

We're a small but mighty team of designers (visual, interaction and content), who work to deliver amazing customer experiences for our TurboTax and QuickBooks users. We're looking for a candidate who is passionate about user experience, learning and creative problem solving.  

 
Sound interesting? Hear what our previous UW co-op had to say about their time with us:

  

"If you're interested in UX/UI or Product Design, Intuit should be top of your list. Intuit is a design driven company that places a huge focus on user experience, which provided me various opportunities to develop my design and research skills throughout the term. I've always felt valued as a team member and was constantly encouraged to speak up about anything."
Job Responsibilities:
What you'll do

Make an impact in the lives of our customers through customer research, data and iterative prototyping to deliver amazing designs. Based on your skills and interests, you may have the opportunity to work on visual, interaction, or content design focused work. 
Collaborate with our team of designers, product managers, developers and marketers.
Learn, a lot! Get ready to learn from the best in the design business and take your design skills to the next level. 


Learn more about Intuit's famous Design 4 Delight process here - www.intuitlabs.com/design-for-delight
Required Skills:
Qualifications

Must be currently enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate degree seeking program, eligible for a 4 month work term (Jan - April)
You're customer-obsessed and are passionate about creating products that resonate on an emotional level and drive business results.
Strong fundamental knowledge of UX Design practices and tools such as design thinking, decision mapping, prototyping & wireframing, Figma, AdobeXD, conducting deep user research.
You're ready to work on many projects at once, collaborating with a variety of Design & Product experts!


Additional Information

Imagine a career where your creative inspiration can fuel BIG innovation. Year-over-year, Intuit has been recognized as a best employer and is consistently ranked on Fortune's "100 Best Companies to Work For" and Fortune World's "Most Admired Software Companies" lists. Immerse yourself in our award-winning culture while creating breakthrough solutions that simplify the lives of consumers and small businesses and their customers worldwide. 

  

Intuit is continually expanding its social, mobile, and global footprint with a full suite of products and services that are revolutionizing the fintech industry. Utilizing design for delight and lean startup methodologies, our entrepreneurial employees have brought more than 250 innovations to market through our products- QuickBooks®, TurboTax®, Mint.com- leveraging big data, cloud computing (SaaS, PaaS), and mobile apps. The breadth and depth of these customer-driven innovations mean limitless opportunities for you to turn your ingenious ideas into reality at Intuit.

Job Summary:
Jablonsky, Ast And Partners is a Structural Engineering Firm originally established as Farkas Barron (Canada) Limited in 1955. The name has changed over the years to reflect the growing importance of Canadian management and ownership in the firm, along with changes in design philosophy. 

  

Jablonsky, Ast And Partners believes that structural design should be optimized to the needs of interrelated design disciplines, as well as to satisfy the requirements for economy and rapid construction.  The search for the optimum solution requires the development of a number of alternative structural arrangements and materials, to support a detailed cost comparison and the selection of the most suitable structure for each unique project. 

  

This philosophy has aided us in designing some of Toronto's most iconic structures like One Bloor East, L Tower, Pier 27, and the ongoing 1 Yonge St., and will lead design in projects that will embody the Toronto skyline in the years to come.

Job Summary:
Developer's Mission: 


Jam3 is a design and experience agency that partners with modern, global brands. At Jam3 we relentlessly generate smart, creative, and forward-thinking solutions in the space between people and technology. As a Jam3 Developer Intern you will work on an incredible variety of digital productions. If it's technically possible, we want to see your passion, desire, and interest to make it happen! Projects are delivered on time, on budget, and with maximum creativity! 


You'll be part of an international development team, comprised of some of the most talented makers, producers, and creative minds in the industry. You are responsible for contributing your expanding coding skills while producing brilliant best practice executions, working on real team + client-facing projects including, but not limited to, Adidas, Google, Facebook, eBay, Coca Cola, Fox, and Disney. We look forward to meeting with you to discuss this amazing career opportunity!
Job Responsibilities:
The Real Opportunity!


- Attention to detail is critical. We take great pride in making sure every deliverable is 100 percent. You will help us get better through your keen technical eye and upholding of coding standards on a daily basis 

- Work with Producers, Designers and other Developers in the execution of new work from a technical perspective to directly influence the outcome of the project 

- Your love of technology is insatiable to the point you think researching is fun. Constantly learning is your dream job 

- Surface risk and ask great questions within projects through effective team communication by developing a safe and trusting teamwork environment involving every team member you work with 

- Your love for order leads you to produce standards based code with the support of many OOP design principles 

- Our clients and your teammates are counting on you to be here every day. If you've ever worked in this type of environment, you know how important teamwork and commitment are to your personal success 

- Ability to learn a new technical skill on the job and apply it professionally while simultaneously being exposed to some of the top Development talent in the industry
Required Skills:
Be Prepared to discuss things like:


- Fundamentals of Web Development 

- Your knowledge of JavaScript, HTML, CSS, coding best practices, and all aspects of development 

- Your opinion on popular frontend frameworks: React.js, Angular, Vue.js 

- Specific topics such as module bundlers, CSS preprocessors, task runners, Your experience with animation on the web using CSS transitions, Greensock or other libraries

Job Summary:
We have an exciting opportunity for students. JamLabs is a rapidly growing data science firm that works with financial institutions around the world to organize, analyze and monetize their data. We create customized solutions for our clients as well as develop our own in-house products. 


We are looking for curious, focused, independent and entrepreneurial engineers. You will work with a small team that has advanced expertise across software and cloud engineering, machine learning, data science and product design and development. You will be working remotely but collaborating daily with team members.
Job Responsibilities:
You'll be working on JamLabs' core data products that help bring our customers' data to market. You will have the opportunity to work with a variety of interesting technologies, shape core products, and define the fundamental processes we will use going forward. 

  

Design and build data solutions on AWS using Lambda, Kinesis, Elastic Map Reduce, Athena and Glue. 

Create web applications using NodeJS and React. 

Practice Agile/Scrum process. 

Support what we create for our clients.
Required Skills:
What You Will Need To Succeed


Experience with SQL, a web technology like React/Angular, REST APIs, WebSockets, JavaScript and Python. 

Full stack development experience. 

Familiarity with software development best practices such as unit testing, version control (we use Git), code reviews, etc. 

Outstanding communication skills. 


Nice To Haves


Good knowledge of AWS. 

Experience with big data technologies, non-AWS cloud platforms and capital markets.

Working with JANA's squad of Masters and Ph.D. level pipeline experts, you will be performing a wide variety of technical tasks related to pipeline integrity management, including research, report writing, data loading and data analysis.  You will gain knowledge and experience regarding how gas distribution and transmission companies operate with and depend on GIS within their Integrity Management Programs.

Job Summary:
JANA is a rapidly growing engineering firm focused on improving the integrity of gas distribution and gas transmission pipeline systems through the application of advanced risk modeling technologies.  An entrepreneurial company, we provide an exciting, dynamic and respectful work environment where you will be an important contributor to the JANA Team.  Our Mission at JANA is "Better Pipelines for a Better World" - we are true believers and inspire our employees to join us in this Mission!  

  

JANA has a progressive culture of personal and professional growth.  With a vested interest in each employee's professional growth and continuous improvement as an individual, JANA supports professional development, continuous education, industry participation and technical accreditations. Other Perks that come with joining JANA's Software Product Team include: 
 

Make a Difference: Joining an emerging Software Product Team, you'll influence technology vision and product development 
High-energy Collaborative Environment: JANA combines the energy of a start-up with the discipline of a precision engineering firm 
Regular Social Events: Join the entire JANA Team for fun Social Events like our Weekly Beer Club, Annual Birthday Bonspiel, Ice Cream Parties, Cinco de Mayo? even an Easter Egg Hunt! 

As a Product Analyst, you will work with our cross-functional teams to help drive our product development process. You understand that a good product is not only built and delivered around carefully gathered, solutioned and communicated requirements, but also within a healthy team environment.  You are passionate about consistently delivering high-quality products.
Job Responsibilities:
Responsibilities

The JANA Way: Functions in alignment with JANA's Values and Professional Culture 
Foster a safe and open environment through transparency, collaboration, trust and fun
Able to jump in to help and fill gaps when needed 
Assisting with product delivery by working and consulting with internal & external stakeholders to ensure quality deliverables are produced in a timely manner
Assist Product Analysts and Owners / Business Stakeholders to understand, analyze, research, and document business cases, current state, solution context, and the future state of the product
Assist in documenting business and functional requirements for existing products and upcoming products
Assisting with documentation of user stories and acceptance criteria
Supporting product team in preparing for the design workshops and subsequent follow-up/research
Assisting with product training, including the creation of material for internal or external audiences
Become a reliable point of contact for business / functional knowledge and ensure there are no communication gaps between cross-functional teams
Gathering appropriate competitive knowledge and market opportunities by exploring market trends and be a reliable resource in the industry landscape
Assisting with reviewing test cases
Assisting with documenting process and flow diagrams for new or existing processes
Required Skills:
Education: Working through an undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent program
Experience: At least one term of work experience
Empathy: Experience in facing customers and understanding their needs
Communication: Excellent technical writing and presentation skills 
Soft Skills: Analytical skills with good communication, works effectively with others, time management and self-organizing skills  
Attention to detail: You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don't.

Job Summary:
About the Position

We are looking for Software Engineering interns to join our Winter 2022 Co-Op program. At Jane Street, we are big believers in functional programming, using OCaml, a statically-typed functional programming language, as our primary development language. We also believe in the value of open source software, using it in our daily work and releasing hundreds of thousands of lines of our own code as open source. We use code to approach a variety of problems, so we're interested in everything from machine learning to systems administration to programming language design.
Job Responsibilities: If you'd like to get an idea of what we cover in our Software Engineering interview process, you can read this blog post, and to get an idea of projects Software Engineering interns work on you can read this post highlighting a few of our Summer 2021 projects.

Deep experience with-and love for-technology
Humble attitude and not afraid to admit mistakes or ask for help 
Can work effectively in close-knit teams
Communicates clearly and respectfully with colleagues
No background in finance, functional programming, or OCaml required
Must be able to work from January through April 2022
Fluency in English required

Job Summary:
At Jane, we're working to find the best ways to help small businesses succeed, and we're using the latest technology to build a better online marketplace. We have some pretty big goals and are always looking for talented people who want to be a part of something new. We not only work hard at our jobs but also to maintain a culture of authenticity and collaboration.  


Jane's values:
 

  Lead with empathy 


  Pull together 


  Just say it 
 
Make it count 
 
Make your mark 


About the Team:  

The Data Team was recently formed under a single executive to combine resources throughout the organization to optimize and enhance the data-driven capabilities at Jane.  The main pillars of our data team are:   


-Analysis and Insights 

-BI Development 

-Data Engineering  

-Data Governance 

-Data Science 

-Performance Management 


You will have the opportunity to work with others across our team collaborating to deliver services to enhance the execution of our business. While supporting all business functions at Jane, You will also have the chance to develop other data skills within the data team to apply to your development as a data professional. 


Due to Covid-19, this is a remote opportunity where the student needs to based out of the province of Ontario.
Job Responsibilities:
What You'll be Doing: 

You will be part of the Data Enginneering / BI team with the Data organization and working closely with the other teams during your term.  Your focus will be on developing and updating our Enterprise Data Warehouse and supporting other data teams as required.  Everything from potential working on a new data mart, developing data operation improvements or supporting a data pipeline for Machine Learning models.

Excellent communication and presentation skills in both written and verbal, including the ability to produce clear and well organized documentation 

Excellent interpersonal, negotiation and mediation skills 

Ability to thrive in a dynamic and agile environment 

Work Experience with any combination of the following:
 

  SQL 
 
Pyton  
 
BI tools like Tableau, PowerBI, Cognos, Looker 
 
ETL technologies 
 
Airflow (ideal) 
 
Various database technology

Job Summary:
Exciting Tunnel Heading Engineering Internship opportunity with Jay Dee Canada starting in January 2022. 

Jay Dee Canada is the managing partner of North Tunnel Constructors ULC, a joint venture of three leaders in Heavy Underground Construction, who are constructing the Coxwell Bypass Tunnel in Toronto, Ontario. This tunnel consists of 10,340 Lineal Meters (33,924 L.F.) of 6.3 Meter (20.67 FT) ID tunnel, Shafts, Drop/Vent Shafts, Diversion Structures, Connecting Tunnels and Adits, and Consolidation Sewers. Projected construction duration is 5 years. Jay Dee has been pushing the boundaries of innovation since 1965. Our team of skilled employees, paired with an extensive inventory of equipment has allowed us to build a project portfolio that varies in size, scope and level of complexity. To date, the Jay Dee team has completed over 100 miles of safe and effective underground spaces and tunnels in a variety of ground conditions, including soft ground and hard rock. We encourage you to learn more by visiting our website: http://www.jaydee.us/careers. 

JOB SUMMARY:  The purpose of the internship is to provide meaningful hands-on Heavy Underground Construction Engineering experience to students with proven academic performance and leadership potential through exposure to both technical and administrative duties. Typical responsibilities require applying critical engineering and management thinking. This internship will be working on the Coxwell Bypass Tunnel located in Toronto, ON starting in January 2022. 

Jay Dee Canada is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Job Responsibilities:
PRINCIPAL FUNCTIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES:

Record, analyze and report basic engineering functions related to underground construction.
Perform cost studies and estimating functions.
Perform downtime studies.
Perform basic geotechnical and structural analysis.
Develop variety of CAD drawings for different aspects of the work.
Perform hands on activities in the job site or in the tunnel.
Perform quality control related activities including segment damage monitoring and documentation, proof grouting, document control, survey, muck sampling, etc.
Required Skills:
ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS: 

Enrollment in a Bachelor's or Master's Degree program (and/or graduate program) in Civil, Construction, or Mining Engineering, Construction Management, or related field.
Major GPA of 3.0 or higher.
Completed at least two years of college education prior to start of internship.
School and/or work experience using Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, Project, Power Point, Internet Explorer, and AutoCAD.
Creative problem solving abilities with the ability to develop positive working relationships in a cross functional team environment.
Excellent verbal and written communication, time management and organizational skills.
Ability to lift and carry 20-30 lbs and work in a confined space environment.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS: 

Overall GPA of 3.0 or higher.
Leadership experience, including involvement in Construction related student organizations.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Construction and Infrastructure Development 
				
			
				ENG - Civil, Environmental and Geological Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering

Job Summary:
Does a job with real responsibilities and meaningful contributions interest you? Are you looking for an opportunity to work with a team of industry leading professionals? Do you want to gain hands-on experience that could lead to full-time employment upon graduation? 

  

If so, we might have the position for you!

  

At J.D. Irving, Limited, our Transportation and Logistics team works with a powerful group of unique and successful businesses in the marine, railway, and trucking sectors. As a recognized leader in freight movement and logistics services, we are the destination of choice for curious, energetic, and collaborative people. 

  

We hire high-energy, motivated student leaders for our Careers in Motion program that allow them to gain knowledge across our various business units. We invest in continuous professional growth through strong career development programs, while providing an opportunity for students to leave their mark on a growing company. Join us and work among the best in the Maritimes! 

  

We Have Student Opportunities for Winter and Summer 2022!

  

A Careers in Motion student will work with a dynamic team of business professionals within a Transportation and Logistics business unit. We welcome all students with a business background to apply - whether it be Human Resources, Finance, Commerce, Communications, Marketing, Supply Chain Management, etc. 

  

Our opportunities range from Fleet Coordinator with RST/Sunbury to Sales Analyst with NBM Railways. Come explore positions such as Logistics Coordinator with JDI Logistics, or roles in fields such as Business Analytics or Human Resources, supporting multiple businesses at the Divisional Level.
Job Responsibilities:
Student Expectations for Your Work Term

Participate in developing and executing key projects
Firsthand, practical experience within a fast-moving, growing organization
Job shadowing opportunities and establishment of mentor relationships
The ability to have your voice and ideas be heard
Real responsibility from day one

Qualifications

Currently enrolled in an accredited university in good academic standing
Self-starter, attention to detail, punctual, consistent, and flexible
Goal-oriented, demonstrates initiative, and enjoys working in a team environment
Demonstrates problem solving skills and evidence-based decision-making abilities
Curiosity, drive for excellence, and a deep interest in the business environment
Superior communication skills, both written and verbal

As a recognized leader in freight movement and logistics services, we are the destination of choice for curious, energetic, and collaborative people. 

  

We hire high-energy, motivated student leaders for our Careers in Motion program that allow them to gain knowledge across our various business units. We invest in continuous professional growth through strong career development programs, while providing an opportunity for students to leave their mark on a growing company. Join us and work among the best in the Maritimes! 

  

We Have Student Opportunities for Winter 2022!
 

A Careers in Motion student will work with a dynamic team of engineering professionals within a Transportation and Logistics business unit. We welcome all students with an engineering background to apply - whether it be Mechanical, Electrical, Civil, or Industrial. 

  

Our opportunities range from Mechanical Analysts to Civil Engineering Project Coordinators. Come explore positions such as Operations Support with Atlantic Towing or RST/Sunbury, or roles in fields such as Business Analytics, supporting multiple businesses at the Divisional Level.

Job Summary:
At Johnson & Johnson, we use technology and the power of teamwork to discover new ways to prevent and overcome the world's the most significant healthcare challenges. Our Corporate, Consumer Health, Medical Devices, and Pharmaceutical teams leverage data, real-world insights, and creative minds to make life-changing healthcare products and medicines. We're disrupting outdated healthcare ecosystems and infusing them with transformative ideas to help people thrive throughout every stage of their lives. With a reach of more than a billion people every day, there's no limit to the impact you can make here. Are you ready to reimagine healthcare?

Here, your career breakthroughs will change the future of health, in all the best ways. And you'll change, too. You'll be inspired, and you'll inspire people across the world to change how they care for themselves and those they love. Amplify your impact. Join us!

Johnson & Johnson Inc. located in Guelph is looking for a current student to join us as a R&D Analytical Assistant Scientist (co-op) for a 4 or 8-month work term. The Guelph plant is one of the many Johnson & Johnson Consumer Companies. Johnson & Johnson's brands are household names in Canada and around the world. In just about any home in the country, you'll be able to find a J&J brand: TYLENOL®, Neutrogena®, Johnson's Baby®, and Acuvue® to name a few. At J&J, our organization is passionate about innovation and bringing real value to Canadian consumers in the health care industry, as a leader in Pharmaceuticals, Consumer Healthcare and Medical Devices.

As a member of the R&D team, the individual will provide support to the R&D Analytical Laboratory. In this capacity, the student supports the general maintenance of lab systems and equipment to ensure facilities remain in a compliant state acceptable to current Good Manufacturing Practices (cGMP) and assist with activities required for analytical testing of solid and liquid dose products. The student will also have some opportunity to participate in and gain exposure to the R&D activities which support the life cycle of Over the Counter (OTC) pharmaceutical products.
Job Responsibilities:
Key Responsibilities:

Maintain equipment and lab in good order in accordance with cGMPs.
Handle disposition of chemical waste according to government regulations.
Ensure integrity of laboratory glassware.
Manage laboratory inventory of reagents and materials.
Prepare various solutions for use in analytical testing.
Assist with analytical and physical testing of solid and liquid dose products.
Maintain up-to-date and accurate records of all work performed.
Miscellaneous tasks as required by project owners.
Required Skills:
Qualifications
Requirements:

Currently enrolled in a bachelor's degree program and eligible to complete a 4 or 8 month co-op term at our Guelph manufacturing location (Johnson & Johnson Inc.).
Preferred majors: Sciences - Chemistry, Pharmaceutical Chemistry, Biochemistry, Toxicology or Biomedical Toxicology, Chemical Physics, Chemical Engineering.
Must have completed at least 1 analytical chemistry or related course and be comfortable working in a laboratory environment.
Proven track record to work independently without continuous feedback.
Strong documentation and communication skills.
Strong time management and organizational skills


Someone who takes initiative, has a high level of attention to detail and knows when to seek assistance will be successful in this role. Previous experience in a laboratory setting would be an asset but not required.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Scientific Experimental Design and Laboratory Assistance
				
			
				ENG - Chemical Engineering
				
			
				SCI - Biological Sciences
				
			
				SCI - Chemical Sciences
				
			
				SCI - Physics
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
ABOUT US:
Johnson & Johnson Inc. is a member of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies, the world's most comprehensive and broadly based manufacturer of healthcare products, as well as a provider of related services, for the consumer, pharmaceutical, and medical devices and diagnostics markets.  In Canada, Johnson & Johnson Inc. markets innovative consumer products focusing on skin and hair care, baby care, wound care, oral health and women's health as well as a broad range of well-known and trusted over-the-counter products through our McNeil Consumer Healthcare division.

Johnson & Johnson's brands are household names in Canada and around the world. In just about any home in the country, you'll be able to find a J&J brand: Tylenol®, Neutrogena®, Johnson's Baby® to name a few. At J&J, our organization is focused on innovation and bringing real value to Canadian consumers in the health care industry, as a leader in Pharmaceuticals, Consumer Healthcare and Medical Devices. We're looking for a current student to join us on our mission.We offer a work culture that is open, innovative, and performance driven with an environment that is fun and sophisticated. Within our facilities, we have a fitness centre that you can access. We have an online employee store where you can purchase J&J products. We also offer opportunities for employees to get involved in sports team, social events and to volunteer with local charities and to participate at J&J Connect forums.

This position's primary responsibility is to assist with implementation of quality systems based on business, regulatory and customer requirements. This role has responsibility to assist with Change Management, Batch Records (P360), Specification/Document Management and Systems Support. These Quality Systems activities support both product launch and product release processes. This role ensures that J&J Inc. Canada operates in compliance with internal procedures, Canadian regulatory requirements and Johnson & Johnson Quality Standards.
Job Responsibilities:
This position is located in Guelph, Ontario, in the Quality Compliance Department.  As a member of the Quality Compliance Department, you will be responsible for supporting the Department's objectives through coordinating activities related to the Quality Compliance teams. You will be required to support the following processes:

YOUR ROLE:

Administrator for EtQ Symphony system, a repository for change control, corrective action and investigation documents.
Author and revise documents then lead routing of document for approvals through the TRU system.
Liaison with multiple business partners through troubleshooting EtQ Symphony problems and ensure timely action to meet metrics.
Create change control meeting agendas, notifications and action list generation and complete metrics.
File documentation, distribute and organize samples. (as required)
Lead and provide support to continuous improvement initiatives within the Quality Compliance department through effective review and analysis of information.
Coordinate monthly JJI BQ metrics meetings. Collect, compile and present monthly metrics to Leadership and appropriate stakeholders/SMEs.
Required Skills:
WHAT YOU BRING:

Enrolled in a post-secondary institution to complete a degree in a science-based discipline such as chemistry, microbiology or engineering.
Previous employment experience preferred, but not required.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Strong organization skills, communication skills and the ability to work both independently or as an integral member of the team.
Strong computer skills including use of Word, Excel, and enterprise data management systems are required in this position. Experience with sharepoint sites, Adobe Pro and Outlook are an asset.
Work effectively in a team environment within the Quality Compliance Department through open communication and collaboration.
Excellent attention to detail and quality mindset are essential.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:

				- Theme - Business Administration
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Information Systems 
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Quality Assurance 
				
			
				- Theme - Quality Assurance and Control 
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Systems Design and Biomedical Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science
				
			
				SCI - Biological Sciences
				
			
				SCI - Business
				
			
				SCI - Chemical Sciences

Job Summary:
COMPANY 

JSI Telecom has an over 40 year history of success, stability and profitability with a reputation for engineering excellence and high customer satisfaction. We employ approximately 300 people working in the niche market of telecommunications applications for the worldwide Law Enforcement and Intelligence communities. Our products are mission critical, enterprise class systems, engineered to work where failure is not an option.  


CANDIDATE  

You demonstrate a history of personal excellence. Software development is your passion, hobby and career. You program for fun, take things apart to find out how they work, and can even put them back together in working condition. You have respectful, accurate and well developed communication skills. You know cool isn't cool unless it works fast, reliable and under extreme conditions.  


JOB SUMMARY  

Successful candidates will be given the opportunity to contribute, as part of our agile teams in which team work, open communication and discussion are encouraged. They will participate in active mentoring with team members to facilitate and encourage professional growth.
Job Responsibilities:
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:  

Alchemy

The Alchemy team is responsible for working on product features and augmenting Data Collection Streams which are the end to end process of file data collection, validation, modelling, insertion into 4Sight using the 4Sight APIs, monitoring, and status reporting. 

We develop data collection solutions, which includes custom tooling, loaders, enrichments and apps 


Appa

Appa is a solutions team that works on 4Sight Apps and other custom solutions. 


Database

If you like working in a dynamic environment and  like being involved in a critical part of data integrity while helping others achieve success. And you want to work on something different. Then join database team at JSI. Recently team has been working on integrating exciting new features of SQL server 2019 into our products at JSI. 


Frostbyte

If User experience is your passion, the Frostbyte agile team will be exploring interface metaphors to provide a fresh, intuitive approach for our customers to solve difficult problems. Their challenge is to deliver a high-fidelity experience, utilizing the latest Visual Studio 2019 release and .NET Framework class library, which includes C#, and ASP.NET. The team is most recently developing efficient and high-quality .NET Core based APIs to run in Docker containers. 


Majora

Majora is focused on Solutions Enablement and Project Solutions Development, which involves extending and improving the platform for customer and developer solutions (e.g. loaders, custom apps, custom enrichments, 4Sight dashboards, 4SOC jobs, etc.) 


Minions

The Minions team focuses on developing high quality software and tools to be consumed by both customers and other internal development teams. Coops on team Minions will have the opportunity to work on areas throughout the JSI software stack. With team Minion's wide focus there are many opportunities to research, design, build, and test features to be included in JSI's diverse software suite. 


Oculus

Oculus writes everything from a web based UI, restful web services, to GO libraries that execute and manage pods in a kubernetes cluster. The team is constantly learning new technologies and challenged to create new solutions. If you're up for a challenge and are eager to learn this is the team for you. 


Portal

Portal is responsible for tools and algorithms for analyzing data 

While most other teams are concerned with collecting, querying and visualizing data, our mandate is to help the user to produce something valuable with that data. 


Titan

The Titan team is responsible for maintaining Cassandra and SOLR, search extensions, performance tuning, 4SE, and operational jobs. 


Vegas - CAT API

The Vegas team focusses on automating all the different API's that our product creates.  Tests are done in our own C# framework.  Some responsibilities for the coops would include running the existing tests and analyzing results across different systems and versions as well as creating new tests (from scratch and from manual tests).  Deploying different systems as well as exploring automating more of that process.   


Zen

The Zen team specializes in the 4SE client and supporting services, Export App, Dataviewer, and a develops and maintains core APIs.
Required Skills:
REQUIRED SKILLS:  

You are passionate about programming. You are looking for a technically interesting and challenging term. You are serious about becoming the best developer you can be.  


Technical requirements: 

* Object-oriented programming skills 

* C# and .NET 4/4.5 

* Java 

* Ruby 

* Windows 10, Server 2012 

* Visual Studio 

* Familiarity with Linux 


Personal requirements: 

* Strong analysis skills  

* Good communication ability 

* Initiative 

* Teamwork 

* A sense of humor 


In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, JSI will provide accommodation, accessible formats and communications supports for the interview process upon request.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

Do you see yourself leading teams in the future?  If so, come join the Project Management team at JSI.  In this role you will be working closely with a Project Manager and Senior Development Manager to help understand what makes the Software Engineering department tick, and design and extend tools to make the 200+ developers at the company more effective.  There will also be some basic administrative duties to help the Project Management team go about their day to day activities.

Corporate Overview

JSI is an established leader in state-of-the-art collection management solutions for the law enforcement and intelligence communities. A privately held, customer-focused company with more than 30 years of experience in the industry, we have developed products and solutions for customers in more than 20 countries. 

Founded in 1979, JSI currently has more than 400 employees worldwide. JSI is very well known within the Law Enforcement and Intelligence communities as a company that produces high-quality, mission-critical enterprise solutions. 


At JSI, employees enjoy opportunities for on-the-job development, a people-friendly management style, and a relaxed, casual work environment. Open communication and discussion are encouraged.

KA Imaging is a spinoff company from a UW research group that now focuses on several innovations in the space of X-ray digital imaging. KAI has grown to several teams of passionate and talented engineers, researchers and creators. We believe that innovations in medical imaging will improve quality of life worldwide, and are committed to making that a reality.  

Your role as a Mechanical Designer is to work with a varied team of engineers to help bring products into market. This will include designing mechanical housing, tools, and components for every stage of production, from iterative prototyping to final product design. You will also communicate with external manufacturers and shops to help them build what you have designed, allowing you to be a part of the entire production process.

Assist with assembly, repair, and maintenance of mechanical and electronic products

Job Summary:
About Kaleidescape

Kaleidescape is the only way to enjoy luxury home cinema. Kaleidescape designs and manufactures the most sophisticated home cinema experience for the world's most discerning clientele. We serve the world's most famous celebrities and wealthiest magnates.  Our flagship product, the Strato S, is the world's finest movie player with 4K Ultra HD, high dynamic range, and electronic delivery. Kaleidescape systems have exclusive access to our online movie store with the largest collection of downloadable movie titles in the highest fidelity. Kaleidescape provides movie lovers with innovative hardware and software that produce the best movie experiences in their homes. 


We're on a journey to bring our elite movie experiences to a much larger audience with some killer new features and are in need of great talent to help us scale. Please help! 


Our people

Great products don't simply build themselves. At Kaleidescape, talented and passionate individuals come together to build products and features that win awards and make a difference in customers' lives. 


Our culture 

Our team values the time we spend together. We gather for lunch and learn sessions every Thursday over a free meal, and in the summer we hold additional weekly BBQs outside. We provide a ping-pong table and theatre room for video games or quick movie breaks.  We also celebrate our accomplishments with off-site events. 


We value creativity, intelligence, and team collaboration centered on a strong work ethic and a disciplined approach. Our team is full of great talent more than happy to mentor you and mature your skills. 


About Kaleidescape Engineering

Our engineering team is small but impactful. The work you do will ship to end customers. We develop all aspects of the system including an animated onscreen user interface, a browser-based user interface, media playback engines, display device drivers, custom hardware platforms, a custom-built real-time Linux OS distribution, a distributed database engine, and an online store.
Job Responsibilities:
As a Kaleidescape Software Quality Engineer, you will develop the test suites, test automation frameworks and test tools for our embedded operating system (kOS), the gorgeous on-screen display, media playback engines, web services, mobile applications, and the Kaleidescape movie store.  

  

Sample co-op projects include:

Developing test suites for new features/functionality
Writing automated tests in Python using embedded system APIs for on-screen device control
Enhancing or extending test frameworks that automate testing of Kaleidescape sub-systems
Designing/executing large-scale movie playback/performance tests

The position will include:

Working alongside Software Developers and Product Management to deliver high quality products
Familiar with agile or scrum software development process 
Troubleshooting complex software problems
Writing SQL queries to perform validations
Creating articulate and accurate defect reports
Gain broad understanding of embedded system architecture
Creating robust automated test design
Code inspection
System and component level performance testing techniques
Setup and configuration of third party automated control systems

Technologies and tools students will be exposed to:

Scripting languages such as Python, Perl, Ruby, Cypress and Selenium
C++, Java, JavaScript, React (code inspections)
SQL/Data modeling, JSON, XML, HTML
Linux operating systems
Defect management tools such as Jira
Required Skills:
Technologies and tools students will be exposed to:

Scripting languages such as Perl, Python, Ruby, Cypress and Selenium
C++, Java, JavaScript, React (code inspections)
SQL/Data modeling, JSON, XML, HTML
Linux operating systems
Defect management tools such as Jira

What else are we looking for?  Well, you must have an insatiable passion for learning and a strong collaborative instinct. You'll be writing code that's part of the shipping product and will get direct mentoring from top notch developers.  Don't forget to tell us about your computer related passions and activities away from school as well.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Information Systems 
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Quality Assurance 
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

Job Summary:
Kenota is poised to disrupt the allergy diagnostic market with the introduction of a point-of-care testing system that dramatically enhances the speed, convenience and accuracy of allergy testing. Our development centre is in Kitchener, Ontario where we are building our future success based on the talent, energy and commitment of over 30 professionals and team members. 


Kenota is currently seeking a talented and meticulous student for the System Test Engineering role to join our growing team. The student will work closely with software, hardware and mechanical engineers to verify and validate system design and function. They will conduct device performance tests, troubleshoot failures, analyze data and prepare test reports. Teams at Kenota are highly collaborative and cross-functional; any experience you have in electrical engineering, mechanical design, biological science, etc. is highly valuable.
Job Responsibilities:
The primary job responsibilities of the System Test Engineering role will include designing verification/validation experiments, performing component and system level tests, analyzing results, and system level debugging.  


Specifics include:

Develop and perform device verification tests (Translate technical documents/requirements to experimental plans and pass/fail criteria)
System and component level bugging, failure mode identification and root cause analysis
Perform statistical data analysis for results generated from sensors, actuators, test fixtures, etc. 
Present data to the engineering team to make informed and evidence-based decisions 

Other projects may come up during the work term. We can also add projects based on the student's interests.
Required Skills:
Required Skills

Test automation (running electromechanical systems, collecting and processing data)
System bug/failure identification and problem solving
Statistical data analysis
Hard working, result driven, self-starter
Highly organized and attentive to detail 
Strong written and oral communication
Willingness to learn and have new experiences
Able to prioritize competing tasks
Experience with using/calibrating metrology tools 
Preferably from a discipline such as Nano, Chemical or Biomedical engineering
