Job Summary:
General Company Information

  

Kinectrics is the category leader in providing life cycle management services for the electricity industry. Trusted by clients worldwide, our expertise in engineering, testing, inspection, and certification is backed by our independent laboratory and testing facilities, a diverse fleet of field inspection equipment and an award-winning team of over 1,000 engineers and technical experts. 

  

From initial design and type testing to operational deployment and maintenance services, Kinectrics collaborates closely with customers to ensure that utility assets perform safely, reliably and efficiently throughout their entire life cycle. 

  

Visit our website:  www.kinectrics.com

  

The Opportunity

 
 

Department: Strategic Growth & Innovation (SGI)
Location: Toronto, ON

  

The Kinectrics Innovation Hub is focused on the development and application of innovative solutions within the electricity industry. With a focus on digitization and smart, connected products & services, the Innovation Hub seeks to foster a sustainable company-wide ideation program, building a culture of innovation. This program includes a systematic approach to ideation, incubation, and commercialization. Kinectrics seeks to collaborate through key partnerships with academia, incubators, and other institutions and aims to adopt technology to increase productivity, human performance, and improve quality. The primary purpose of this role is to support the Director, Innovation in the operation of the Innovation Hub.
Job Responsibilities:
The work involves (but is not limited to):
 

Identification and investigation of new technologies with the potential to provide transformative improvements to Kinectrics operations and/or provide new and innovative products/services for our clients. This may include technologies such as augmented/virtual reality, artificial intelligence/machine learning/computer vision tools, advanced materials, advanced manufacturing such as additive manufacturing, new sensor and inspection technologies, waste processing cycles, advanced fission reactors and fusion reactors, and novel testing facilities.
Research and trial use of new business productivity tools, particularly those which hold promise to improve human performance and automate repetitive tasks.
Developing content within the Kinectrics Innovation Management System, "Planbox". Planbox is the system of record used to submit, evaluate, and prioritize innovation ideas for further development. This may include the development of workflows to support the evaluation process, generation of success stories based on key innovation activities, and liaising with technical leads and innovation champions within the organization to facilitate the innovation process. This activity requires strong communication skills and some level of artistic creativity in the development and presentation of the authored content within the system.
Developing project monitoring tools or data analysis tools to support effective management of innovation projects. This includes the use of project dashboards and other data intelligence tools such as Microsoft Power BI.
Monitoring the execution of innovation projects (project schedule and financials) utilizing Kinectrics tools.
Supporting the conduct of brainstorming or roadmap sessions with operational teams to help stimulate ideas and find solutions to industry challenges.
Developing technical material and business case inputs to support New Product Development (NPD) initiatives. This may include the development of Capital Expenditure (CAPEX) assessments, market investigations, or similar.
Development of intellectual property (IP) management strategies and IP reviews.
Supporting operations teams with the responses to requests for proposal that involve a specific focus on innovative solutions.
Liaising with external organizations such as the Nuclear Innovation Institute, Canadian Centre for Nuclear Sustainability, and other innovation clusters.

Supporting the monitoring and execution of divisional plans for growth and innovation
Required Skills:
The Qualifications

  

A successful candidate will be a highly motivated individual who is comfortable multi-tasking on a variety of tasks and topics. The ideal candidate is able to utilize problem solving skills and basic research skills to propose ideas and potential solutions to challenges of a technical and management nature. 

  

Other skills/qualifications include:
 

Currently enrolled full-time in a post-secondary Engineering or Entrepreneurship program requiring a co-op placement
Proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite, particularly the use of templates in MS Word and financial operations in MS Excel.
Experience in the use of workflow and data management tools like Power BI, Power Automate, etc. is desired.
Functional use of one or more computer programming languages such as C, C++, Fortran, Visual Basic, Python.
Strong written and oral communication skills.
Strong organizational skills supporting a large number of parallel activities.

				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering

Job Summary:
General Company Information

Kinectrics is the category leader in providing life cycle management services for the electricity industry. Trusted by clients worldwide, our expertise in engineering, testing, inspection, and certification is backed by our independent laboratory and testing facilities, a diverse fleet of field inspection equipment and an award-winning team of over 1,000 engineers and technical experts. 

  

From initial design and type testing to operational deployment and maintenance services, Kinectrics collaborates closely with customers to ensure that utility assets perform safely, reliably and efficiently throughout their entire life cycle. 

  

Visit our website:  www.kinectrics.com
Job Responsibilities:
The Opportunity

Department: Finance
Location: Toronto, ON

  

Join our Finance team and gain experience in areas such as Accounts Receivable, Accounts Payable, Treasury and General Accounting, and in Fixed Asset Accounting. This is an excellent opportunity to gain experience in accounting in an open and friendly environment.

Job Summary:
KixCare is a digital health company created by doctors, with more than fifty years of combined clinical and business experience. Our vision is to enable equitable access to quality care for all Canadian children. 

  

Our platform connects Canadian families and their children with pediatric telehealth services. Families that use our platform want the best for their children. They know how stressful it can be when your child is not feeling well and there are no healthcare providers available, so they turn to KixCare to make sure their children are well taken care of from the comfort of their home. 

  

KixCare also offers providers the opportunity to expand their healthcare practice virtually, set their own hours, and deliver an enhanced patient experience through a community of integrated care options. We are proud to offer Pediatricians, Mental Health Practitioners, Sleep and Lactation Consultants, Dieticians, Concussion Specialists, and more.
Job Responsibilities:
Reporting initially to the CEO, the Marketing Coordinator will contribute to the strategic development and execution of marketing and sales initiatives during the roll-out of a state-of-the-art virtual care platform.  


Specific responsibilities include:


Community Management
 

Utilize our chatbot and social media management platforms to help customers discover our services, book appointments, and learn more about what makes KixCare unique
Call qualified web leads to help them through the booking process
Moderate and facilitate active discussion on ads, social media, and blog postings across several channels including our website, facebook, Instagram, and google


Marketing
 

Produce copy (e.g., text and messaging) for website landing pages to increase organic traffic to KixCare according to SEO strategy
Utilize our content management system to publish written copy to web pages, optimizing page templates based on usability and conversion
Research competitors' marketing activities (including US and Canadian pediatric virtual care platforms) to identify areas of opportunity for generating customer awareness, engagement, and conversion
Participate in marketing meetings, taking notes and preparing follow-ups

  

Sales
 

Perform market research to build lists of eligible providers to join KixCare as we scale provincially and nationally
Develop marketing materials such as one-pagers, pamphlets, and email campaigns for provider outreach
Manage provider outreach, onboarding, and contracting through HubSpot CRM and other sales tools
Develop recommendations to improve provider recruiting and client success processes
Required Skills:
Required: 

- Excellent proficiency in Microsoft PowerPoint and Excel 

- Demonstrated success in quickly solving problems 

- Proven ability to be a self-starter and work collaboratively 

- Clear written and oral communication 

- Experience in healthcare, tech, consulting or finance 

- Ability to own projects and be proactive in managing numerous responsibilities 

- Ability to operate in a very dynamic and fast paced environment 


Additional: 

- French is an asset

Job Summary:
KixCare is a digital health company created by doctors, with more than fifty years of combined clinical and business experience. Our vision is to enable equitable access to quality care for all Canadian children. 

  

Our platform connects Canadian families and their children with pediatric telehealth services. Families that use our platform want the best for their children. Job Responsibilities:
KixCare is seeking a Patient Care Coordinator to make sure that every parent, child, and doctor has a great healthcare experience. You will use our electronic medical record and virtual care platform to make things as smooth as possible for patients and providers alike. 

Responsibilities will include:
 

Appointment booking,
Medical intake,
Billing and invoicing,
Referrals, and
Patient follow-ups via email and VOIP
Communication with providers
This individual will also familiarize themselves with the virtual platform and be able to answer any questions as they arise from both patients and providers.

Care Coordination - schedule incoming appointments, confirm patient demographics and contact information, validate health cards, process and confirm private payments (as applicable), load and manage provider schedules, manage inbound and outbound referrals, submit provincial billing items. 

Platform Development - optimize clinical workflows for providers, identify potential improvements for patient experience, collect and report on user feedback. 

Patient and Provider Support - monitor patient and provider support lines (email, phone calls) to answer technical- and support-related questions in a professional, timely and friendly manner. 

General duties - develop, maintain and execute on our standard operating procedure (SOP) documents outlining your day to day responsibilities. Organize daily hand-off reports to those working the next shift. Keep patient and provider information confidential at all times.

KLM Planning Partners Inc. is a planning and design consulting firm that was established in 1988, serving clients across the Greater Golden Horseshoe Area. We provide land use planning consulting services for private and public interests who require assistance in acquiring municipal land use approvals including Official Plan Amendments, Zoning By-law Amendments, Minor Variance, Consents, Plans of Subdivision, and Site Plan approvals.

Job Summary: We are seeking a Civil or Geological Engineering Student in our North Bay office for the upcoming work term. We are interested in motivated and committed individuals who are working towards a degree in civil or geological engineering. Extended placements and future full-time employment are options for qualified applicants.
Job Responsibilities: If successful, you will interact with other members of our team in the office and in the field. We are currently working on projects in various domestic and international locations.

Job Summary:
Join us in shaping the future of women's and family health! 


Koble (www.koblecares.com) was founded in January 2021 with the vision to create space for all families so that they feel connected, supported, and loved. At Koble we are building an interactive digital health and wellness platform for growing families, supporting them through all paths to and stages of parenthood.   


To get market feedback early, in less than three months, we built Koble's Beta experience as a Progressive Web Application (PWA) using the Google Angular framework. Based on the success of our Beta, we are gearing towards growing our platform capabilities (native iOS and Android) and building our engineering team (first few!).  


We are looking for strong engineering leaders who are passionate about building a platform from the ground up. We ship code to production every day, and we're always looking to improve both the quality and speed of our releases. 


Location: 

The world has changed, and so has the way we work. We believe you can work where you work best, and still feel connected to our mission, values, purpose, and each other. Koble is headquartered in Toronto and we believe in empowering people to work anywhere that works for them in Canada and the US.
Job Responsibilities:
- Get an opportunity to join the founding team to build a first-of-its-kind digital health platform for growing families 

- Build, test and maintain front-end and back-end mobile applications 

- Participate in technical design and planning discussions 

- Collaborate closely with UX designers to build new features and delight our members 

- Uphold standards for quality by performing code reviews, fixing bugs, creating automated tests, and monitoring performance 

- Communicate technical limitations and roadblocks to your team
Required Skills:
You have the ability to continuously prioritize tasks and have a consistent track record of delivering complete, well-architected results. You will balance creative, reliable engineering with high quality and client focus. You will work as part of a small cross-functional team to deliver features on our roadmap, as well as continually maintain and improve a specific area of our product. You are self-motivated to expand technical and professional skills, foster a collaborative team environment, and communicate clearly and effectively with all company team members. 


- You have some experience building and maintaining mobile platforms 

- You have some working experience with Angular or React 

- You have some experience working with TypeScript or JavaScript 

- You know how to write high-quality, testable code, and understand the tradeoffs between expediency and maintainability 

- You have strong UX and design sensibilities and know how to bring complex designs to reality 

- You are a strong communicator, and you can explain complex technical concepts to designers, support, and other engineers without a problem 

- When things break, you're eager and able to help fix things 

- You are familiar with Agile development practices

				- Theme - Computing: Software

Job Summary:
Years working in a foreign exchange brokerage taught our founder, Adam, firsthand about the barriers smaller institutions face in the FX market. To compete in a system built for larger players, they had to piece together rigid, legacy stand-alone software, build everything themselves from scratch, or make do with emails, spreadsheets and grit. Believing that capital markets should encourage as much competition and innovation as possible, Adam founded Kooltra in 2014 with a vision of building technology to democratize capital markets. 

  

Today, Kooltra's cloud-based platform automates workflows, provides real time analytics, and seamlessly connects customers and their clients. Using the most innovative cloud-based technology, our platform increases efficiency and transparency, improves connectivity, and reduces risk, both internally in an organization and across the entire ecosystem. 


If you want to join a rapidly growing fintech delivering next-gen software to customers in a $5 trillion a day market, then we'd like to hear from you. You don't need foreign exchange experience to succeed - just a curiosity to learn and drive to improve your craft.
Job Responsibilities:
Kooltra's development team is a small but mighty group of engineers who are passionate about building great products. We practice Agile and TDD methodologies with short iterations. We code in Apex, Java (Spring, Hibernate, Gradle), Python (Behave), ES6, React deployed on Amazon Web Services and Salesforce. We have a micro-service architecture and we practice continuous integration. We ship frequently, deploying our code continuously. 

  

In this role, you will
 

Work on product focused scrum teams to identify requirements and specifications and contribute to design and architectural decisions
Collaborate with other developers on cross-functional scrum teams working on features for our customers
Build new applications and maintain components on the platform, including trading, accounting, risk management, integrations, REST API, etc.
Required Skills:
We are looking for people with:
 

A passion for software development and improving their craft
1 year experience building and delivering new features, processes, and tools (ideally with Java or Apex), or co-op equivalent
Excited about working with large codebases and writing robust and testable code
Ability to identify problems and take initiative in solving them
Ability to balance desire to ship code quickly to our customers with responsibility of making good technical decisions
Strong desire to learn Agile, Software Engineering best practices and Object-Oriented Programming
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computing and Financial Management
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
We are seeking talented and energetic candidates to join our Advisory team as a Consultant working in our Management Consulting practice in Toronto starting in January 2022. Positions are available in the following service lines:
Operations
Customer
People & Change
Finance Transformation
Supply Chain
Operations
KPMG's operational transformation teams help organizations develop efficient and effective operations to support strategic business objectives. Enterprises today must contend with constantly-evolving macro trends, global issues, and industry challenges. Our Operations team starts with the big picture, before narrowing it to reflect an organization's most pressing concerns, including growth acceleration, process and system redesign, cost optimization and operational strategy. In addition, our organizational design experience helps clients continuously improve and adjust business strategy to meet shifting market conditions.
 
People & Change
We advance our client's business performance by helping to shape and navigate the important people dynamics related to the transformation of work, capabilities, and behaviours. We assist our clients with strategic alignment, workforce shaping, embedding inclusion and diversity, capability building & learning, digital HR transformation and culture shifting. With experience in all industries, as well as both the private and public sectors, our People and Change practice helps organizations drive value and enhance success by optimizing their talent agenda and activating their most valuable resource, their people.
 
Finance Transformation
An effective finance function needs to be aligned to the business strategy, and should provide agile financial analysis and insight to support corporate decision making, while also meeting legal and regulatory requirements as a given. With a global network of professionals working in KPMG member firms around the globe, KPMG Finance Transformation is able to bring the right people, with the right skills, to the right place at the right time to assist helping organizations to become leaders in finance. Aimed at helping to maximize the finance function's performance and increase its value to the business, we help provide a range of financial management services under our three service networks?efficient finance operations, effective decision support, and finance strategy & transformation.
 
Customer
Digital disruption and rising customer expectations are creating unforgiving markets where loyalty is hard won and easily lost. If you can't deliver what your customers want, when and where they want it, they will go to someone who can. But there is no point in creating a breakthrough customer experience if the new business model runs at a loss. KPMG teams offer a suite of services that can help you achieve profitable, sustainable growth through customer-centric thinking. This is all about getting close to your customers and staying there.
 
Supply Chain
Amidst ever-changing technological, economic and regulatory challenges, varying industries need one thing: effective supply chain management to accelerate their corporate growth strategies, increase operational efficiency, and offer new and differentiated value to their customers.  KPMG understands the complexities of designing and managing supply chains, and our strategic business approach helps create and sustain bottom-line value across the extended supply chain -- from suppliers to customers. A career in KPMG's Supply Chain services can be extremely rewarding
Job Responsibilities:
Interns/Co-Ops
Consultant usually join Management Consulting coming from an undergraduate degree or Master's degree with less than 2 year's work experience.
 
You are enrolled in a university degree program (we will be considering candidates from a spectrum of programs such as business, commerce, science, engineering, arts, etc.)
You are a highly motivated individual, enthusiastic to take on a variety of challenges and opportunities
You have excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
You have a strong academic record
You have the ability to work independently without supervision
You have strong problem solving and analytical abilities, as well as a proven track record of successfully dealing with competing priorities and deadlines under pressure
ou have a strong sense of personal accountability
You have an entrepreneurial drive, and are a creative problem solver

Cover letter

Other relevant documents (i.e. GMAT score)
If you do not have access to an electronic copy of your transcript, we ask that you attach a screenshot of your grades from your school's website.

Key considerations as you apply:
This role is elgible for candidates who are graduating between May 2022 and August 2023

Come as you are. Let's do this.

KPMG Technology Risk Consulting has an exciting opportunity for a Blockchain Analyst (Co-op), to join our team in Winter 2022! This role will be a rewarding experience if you: 

 
 

Thrive on challenges and work best in a fast-paced environment where each day is different
Work well in a project team environment and have strong collaboration and interpersonal skills
Have a permanent "figure it out" mindset

  

Our blockchain and cryptoasset practice has several major areas of focus. First, we provide advisory services supporting the adoption of cryptoassets by institutional investors. Second, we guide fintech platforms and traditional financial services businesses through building and optimizing institutional scale cryptoasset products and services. Lastly, we help a wide array of organizations leverage enterprise blockchain technology to improve efficiencies in their businesses.
Job Responsibilities:
What you will do


As a Blockchain Analyst, successful candidates will support clients manage technology, cyber and regulatory risks in their cryptoasset and blockchain adoption by the following activities:
 

Advise clients on the key considerations for adopting cryptoassets or blockchain technology
Deliver market-leading and innovative blockchain solutions using Ethereum/Hyperledger Fabric or other blockchain platforms
Contribute to the architecture, design, and implementation of Blockchain enabled ecosystems with key focus in the areas such as consensus, distributed ledger, and smart contracts
Develop educational modules to enhance KPMG's workshop offering
Utilize a hypothesis-driven problem-solving approach to design, construct, and rapidly test/ iterate exploratory analyses that will reveal insight and opportunities for the client
Perform reviews, QA, testing for smart contracts
Required Skills:

A successful candidate will possess a strong mixture of education, experience, skills and behaviors such as the following:

Experience developing Blockchain applications or proof-of-concepts (POCs) using Ethereum/ Hyperledger Fabric or other blockchain platforms
Experience with one or more of the following - JavaScript, Angular, NodeJS, HTML5, CSS, JSON, Go, C/C++, Python, Solidity, MongoDB, CouchDB, Postgres SQL
Experience using versioning tools (Github), developing microservices and APIs.
Demonstrated experience with UI development, including creating design patterns and component libraries
Experience in agile development and establishing best practice for agile processes and delivery methods

Keys to your success:

Strong understanding and passion for concepts linked to blockchain such as decentralization, transaction hashs, wallets, public key cryptography, mining, Bitcoin and Ethereum protocol design, and Decentralized Finance.
Deep technical expertise and strong problem-solving and data analysis skills.
Ability to work both independently, with little supervision and within a team environment.
A passion for building great products that make an impact
Demonstrated ability to learn and succeed in a fast-paced environment.
Self-motivated learner; strong desire to learn on the job and apply state-of-the-art technology to solve business challenges
Has a high degree of personal confidence, enthusiasm and drive

Job Summary:
Overview


Please note that you are limited to one application during the recruitment period as we ask you to think ahead of what office and service line you are most interested in.

  

At KPMG in Canada, we believe our differences make us stronger. When you join the team you'll be part of a diverse group of professionals with a common goal - making an impact and driving innovation. 

  

In a culture that fosters inclusion and encourages flexibility, you'll receive the tools and guidance to grow your skills and achieve success your way. 

  

Come as you are. Let's do this. 

  

Why KPMG Government Risk Compliance Services?

  

Faced with new market opportunities, ongoing economic challenges, increased pressure to improve risk management effectiveness, and unprecedented regulatory requirements, many organizations are recognizing the need to transform their internal audit and risk management functions to turn these disruptive forces into opportunities. 

  

As the business and regulatory environments continue to evolve, organizations face emerging risks that challenge traditional strategies and assumptions. In this environment, resilience is the key to organizational survival, and companies need to achieve a balance of governance, risk-management, regulatory compliance, and performance. 

  

Leading organizations acknowledge that meeting these new challenges can actually protect and enhance business value and drive operational efficiencies. They need to envision and implement a holistic model that adds value and meets the demands of regulators, the board of directors, and key stakeholders. 

  

KPMG's Governance, Risk & Compliance Services deploys multidisciplinary teams of professionals experienced in financial and operational internal auditing, IT, fraud analytics and risk assessment, shared services, finance management, treasury and financial instruments, and the supply chain to augment and enhance an organizations' existing internal audit capabilities. 

  

KPMG's Governance, Risk & Compliance Services practice works with internal audit directors and audit committees to develop a quality internal audit function that delivers strategic business assurance, identifies business opportunities and enhances organizational value. 


How we can help:

Board Advisory Services
Continuous Auditing/Continuous Monitoring
Design and Testing of Internal Controls
Contract Compliance
Enterprise Risk Management Assessment and Implementation
Establishing an Internal Audit Function
Governance, Risk and Compliance
Internal Audit Sourcing
Regulatory Compliance Advisory
Internal Control Assistance Services
Strategic Performance Review of Internal Audit (K'SPRint)
Job Responsibilities:
What you will do


You'll have the opportunity to work across geographies and industries to take on challenging and groundbreaking projects while building strong relationships with our people and developing professional skills that will help set you up for success. 

 
 

Work closely with clients in understanding key business issues.
Gather and analyze requirements to develop impactful recommendations and solutions.
Utilize advanced analytical techniques to solve challenging business problems. Leverage a diverse set of technologies and tools to deliver insights.
Develop a strong experience in analytics, statistics, data mining, reporting, visualization and/or intelligent automation.
Develop a strong experience in data management, data governance, data quality and/or data processing
Develop problem solving ability through the use and/or development of algorithms, models, testing, etc.
Work with large volumes of data (structured and unstructured).
Run queries for descriptive analytics and provide formatted result sets.
Proactively contribute to the creation of presentation materials relating to data activities for stakeholder discussions.
Bridge the gap between technical platform needs and business issues.

Effectively communicate orally and written with peers within GRCS, KPMG and the client.

Ability to understand and explain business value of data and analytics concepts

Job Summary:
Overview

Please note that you are limited to one application during the recruitment period as we ask you to think ahead of what office and service line you are most interested in.

  

At KPMG in Canada, we believe our differences make us stronger. When you join the team, you'll be part of a diverse group of professionals with a common goal - making an impact and driving innovation. 

  

In a culture that fosters inclusion and encourages flexibility, you'll receive the tools and guidance to grow your skills and achieve success your way. 

  

Come as you are. Let's do this. 

  

Why KPMG Deal Advisory?

  

Business today is under more pressure than ever to deliver better, lasting results for stakeholders. In Deal Advisory, we think like an investor, looking at how opportunities to buy, sell, partner, fund or fix a company can add and preserve value. 

  

Today's deals do not happen in a vacuum. From business strategy to acquisition strategy, plans for divestments or for raising funds, or even the need to restructure, every decision must be made considering the entire business, the sector, and the global economy. 

  

Our teams of specialists combine a global mindset and local experience with deep sector knowledge and superior analytic tools to help our clients navigate a complex, fragmented process. 

From helping to plan and implement strategic change to measurably increasing portfolio value, we focus on delivering tangible results. The kind of results that let clients clearly see what they gained from the deal at hand, and what they want to bring to the next deal down the road.  

  

Deal Advisory is growing its practice in Data Analytics and Data Science. We are looking for talent with deep technical skills that have an appetite for Investments, M&A and Deal Advisory. 

  

KPMG Deal Advisory Toronto has an exciting opportunity for a Data Scientist, Consultant intern to join our team Winter 2022! This role will be a rewarding experience for you if you:
 

Thrive on challenges and work best in a fast-paced environment where each day is different
Work well in a project team environment and have strong collaboration and interpersonal skills
Have a permanent "figure it out" mindset

Video: Digital Opportunities

Learn more here: Transaction Services, Deal Advisory - KPMG
Job Responsibilities:
What you will do

Work closely with public, private and third-party data sets to generate data-driven insights.
Carry out rapid analysis in Python of data sets (structured and/or unstructured).
Using KPMG proprietary and third-party data analytics tools, you will deliver deeper insights to our clients at deal speed
Identify and report key issues, perform relevant financial analysis, and interpret results
Develop analytical procedures and templates that can be deployed to others to increase the capabilities of the wider team
Work with large volumes of data (structured and unstructured) - investigate and perform deeper analysis to produce impactful insights to achieve targeted outcomes.
Work shoulder to shoulder with KPMG's engagement teams to deliver deep insights at speed to achieve the best client outcomes.
Draft detailed professional reports and other client deliverables e.g. Excel schedules, Tableau dashboards, results of predictive models etc.
Establish credibility and develop relationships with current and prospective clients.
Provide support/assistance for proposals.
Develop and support other business units to identify use cases and increase the use of data & analytics in a cross-functional role (e.g. Valuations, Corporate Finance, Operations M&A / Value Creation, Restructuring & Turnaround, Global Infrastructure Project Group, etc.).

At times, business needs arise, and employees are required and agree to work beyond their normal workday or work week to fulfill the accountabilities required for their job. Likewise, people need extra time to devote to personal matters, and our approach to flexibility provides for this.
Required Skills:
What you bring to the role

A solid understanding of Python, Pandas and essential python libraries.
A solid understanding of advanced statistics to generate quantitative data-driven insights.
An ability to rapidly prototype and extract data-driven insights in a Jupyter Notebook environment by plotting the data or creating visuals to answer relevant business questions
An understanding of how to deal with structured and unstructured data such as text and geospatial data such as maps.
An ability to rapidly extract, transfer and load (ETL) data preferably in Python or Alteryx or even SQL.
Prior exposure to data visualization tools like PowerBI or Tableau.
An ability to script in Python an unsupervised machine learning algorithm such as k-means clustering.
An ability to script in Python a supervised machine learning algorithm such as a decision tree.
An ability to rapidly automate ETL process using Python or other tools such as Alteryx.
Proficiency in Cloud computing with AWS, Azure or GCP is a plus, especially to use API services.
An advanced user of Microsoft Tools (Excel, PowerPoint, etc)
Client-facing communication skills such as presenting data-driven results and insights.
An understanding and willingness to learn about investments, finance and M&A.
A background in physics, math, statistics, computer science and/or engineering is preferred.

  

Keys to your success:

 
 

Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Highly motivated to learn and succeed in a fast-paced environment
Curiosity, healthy skepticism, creativity, and attention to detail.
Committed, able to work independently with minimal supervision and flexible to cope with changing priorities and strict deadlines.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Skilled in building a network and working relationships internally and externally.

  

The Deal Advisory practice is hiring for Data Analytics & Data Science. Specifically, KPMG is interested in talented Data Scientists with advanced skills in Python that have an appetite and interest in Mergers & Acquisitions, Private Equity, Transactions and Investing. This unique skill will enable you to provide a new level of data-driven insights.

 KPMG Lighthouse Exponential Toronto has an exciting opportunity for a Data Engineer to join our team! This role will be a rewarding experience for you if you:

 

Thrive on challenges and work best in a fast-paced environment where each day is different

Job Responsibilities:
What you will do

Work in terms or individuals to performance ETL/ELT (extract, transform and load) of data from a variety of databases, from SQL, NoSQL, Hadoop, Neo4j, etc.
Strong experience with large scale and or distributed processing methodologies such as Storm, Spark and many others.
Review data quality and definitions, and perform data cleansing and data management tasks.
Work with the engagement team to translate business and analytics requirements into a data strategy for the engagement including ETL, data model and staging data for analysis
Architect the data platform for scalability, repeatability and performance.
Develop standards for data processes and automate routine tasks.
Run queries for descriptive analytics and provide formatted result sets.
Proactively contribute to the creation of presentation materials relating to data activities for stakeholder discussions.
Support application testing and production implementation as required.
Bridge the gap between technical platform needs and business issues.
Enable overall solution and full-scope architecture design and build.
Design software architecture following best practices after understanding customer requirements enterprise environments
Required Skills:
What you bring to the role

Strong experience working in teams to perform ETL/ELT (extract, transform and load) of data from a variety of databases from SQL, NoSQL, Hadoop, Neo4j, etc.
Independent ability to review the data quality and data definitions, and perform data cleansing and data management tasks
Experience working in a multi-disciplinary team to tack unstructured data processing problems across a diverse range of industries
Strong ability to use Python, Panda and NumPy for data analysis and cleansing tasks
Some experience with visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBI, QlikView, etc.)
Basic understanding of Data Warehousing and Data Modeling.
Experience or knowledge in one major cloud service: AWS, MS Azure and GCP.

Keys to your success:

Ability to explain data and analytics concepts to non-technical team members.
Ability to apply data and analytics concepts to business problems.
Ability to understand and explain business value of data and analytics concepts.
Knowledge of basic machine learning to collaborate with the team on ML projects
Experience in visual exploration to perform data discovery and highlight insights
Knowledge of how specific visual components drive usability and understanding
A knack at telling a story with purpose. Strong facilitation and collaboration abilities to conduct discussions and workshop with engineers and business analyst to advocate for positive user experience and recommend potential solutions to identified problems

Ignition Tax is a team of technology trailblazers who pride themselves on creativity and innovation. KPMG Ignition Tax helps organizations realize opportunities through our far-reaching intelligence capabilities that allow for the development of modern software solutions. 

  

In a fast-paced, experimental environment, our team collaborates with strategic partners and tax leaders across Canada to build next-generation solutions. Our culture is rooted in the belief that our people are at the heart of everything we do, and your growth, happiness, and wellbeing are of utmost importance to us. 

  

By fostering an inclusive startup culture within the stability and support of KPMG's world-class firm, Ignition Tax approaches each project with a unique perspective, a multitude of complementary skill sets, and expertise that allow them to build technology solutions that shape the future of KPMG's business.

Job Summary:
Overview

Please note that you are limited to one application during the recruitment period as we ask you to think ahead of what office and service line you are most interested in.

  

At KPMG in Canada, we believe our differences make us stronger. When you join the team, you'll be part of a diverse group of professionals with a common goal - making an impact and driving innovation. 

  

In a culture that fosters inclusion and encourages flexibility, you'll receive the tools and guidance to grow your skills and achieve success your way. 

 
Come as you are. Let's do this. 
 
Why KPMG Tax Transformation & Technology?

  

At KPMG, our Tax Transformation and Technology professionals help clients explore opportunities offered by technology to improve their tax processes, increase quality, and reduce risk. This multi-disciplinary team combines accounting, tax and technology expertise with Lean Six process engineers to ensure they are able to address the specific needs and challenges of our clients.  

  

As part of the team, you will work shoulder-to-shoulder with businesses to implement robust data and technology strategies through three key pillars: data and information, automation, and decision support and stakeholder value creation. 

  

Data and information:

The key to overall improvement starts here - understanding where data resides and how it is generated. Our teams explore how data can be captured digitally to better enable tax processes and to drive efficiencies, reduce risk, and derive insight. 

  

Automation:

Armed with oversight and control of data, our teams evaluate and deploy technology to streamline and automate repetitive and manual tasks using robotic process automation. 

  

Decision support and stakeholder value creation:

With the right software and tools, including workflow and data management platforms, our teams streamline compliance activities and harness all the management information clients need to support their business. 

  

Note: You will be given the opportunity to select your function of interest while completing the application questionnaire. Please carefully review which specific opportunities are available below before submitting your application, as openings vary by office. Please ensure you are applying to the correct type of job according to your availability. This is a co-op position.
Job Responsibilities:
What you will do

Apply accounting/finance acumen and computer programming skillset to solve client(s) problems and assist with tax compliance and consulting deliverables
Assist with day-to-day delivery of tax transformation projects for clients, and supporting client deliverables using a variety of technologies and tools
Assist on client(s) initiatives to identify opportunities to improve existing tax processes and use tax technology
Work with our managers to understand client(s) existing processes and propose new solutions
Participate in collaboration/design sessions with the business, clients and our team
Required Skills:
What you bring to the role

A keen interest in finance, accounting, tax, or similar business disciplines
A keen interest in computer science, technology, innovation and improving processes
Enjoys using business acumen and computer programming to solve problems
Willingly takes on and learns new skills - although you may not know all the technologies and/or have tax experience, you're willing to learn quickly and apply it effectively.
Excels in a fast-paced environment - We're a client service firm and we take pride in what we do and how we do it in tight deadlines
Has a Team First Mentality - We're a tightly knit team that lean on each other and teach each other
Able to interact with co-workers, management and clients alike in a manner that is respectful and understanding
Demonstrates the ability to handle multiple priorities
Has strong time-management and self-motivation abilities, with a great sense of ownership

Keys to your success:

Pursuing a Business Administration and Math/Computer Science Double Degree, Computing and Financial Management Degree, Management Engineering, or similar
Familiarity with any of the modern programming languages including but not limited to C#, SQL, HTML & CSS, Python, Jscript, Java
Experience with Microsoft Excel VBA, Microsoft Power Platform (Power BI, Power Query), UiPath or other similar RPA products, and/or SharePoint would be an asset
Your thought process on how you can see the whole picture and not just the one object to be coded
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Business Administration
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Hardware
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Information Systems 
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Quality Assurance

At KPMG in Canada, we believe our differences make us stronger. When you join the team, you'll be part of a diverse group of professionals with a common goal - making an impact and driving innovation.

Scientific Research & Experimental Development (SR&ED) at KPMG:

  

The R&D Tax Incentive team at KPMG works with engineering/technology clients across a broad spectrum of industries (including, but not limited to Gaming, Fintech, Healthcare, etc.).  Our IT team engages clients on projects where IT technologies are pushing the boundaries of the current state of the art.  For these types of projects, the Canadian government offers R&D tax credits (SR&ED program) to incentivize the continued development and to offset the cost of innovation. 

  

The successful candidate will be involved in KPMG projects (internal and/or client facing) and will:

Contribute to the development of software automation tools/solutions to address client problems
Conduct targeted research/analysis on leading practices and current trends in IT and digital innovation
Conduct data analysis
Support KPMG project teams in developing client deliverables (specifically project justifications to highlight technological innovations)
Be exposed to new and exciting technologies and state-of-the art innovations in a wide range of industries
Gain valuable business experience to complement your technical training

Note: You will be given the opportunity to select your function of interest while completing the application questionnaire. Please carefully review which specific opportunities are available below before submitting your application, as openings vary by office. Please ensure you are applying to the correct type of job according to your availability. This is a co-op position.
Job Responsibilities:
What you will do

Help execute project engagements, develop deliverables and work independently and in teams as required by the varying nature of different project requirements.
Working with the Engineering Manager, participate in meetings towards identification of client projects that may qualify for the SR&ED Program and gathering the required technical information to articulate/justify SR&ED eligibility.
Keep abreast of current and latest trends in science and technology with focus on Information Technology, Software Development, Systems Engineering, Communications, Electronics and emerging technologies (e.g. machine learning and artificial intelligence applications).
At times, business needs arise and employees are required and agree to work beyond their normal work day or work week to fulfill the accountabilities required for their job, and some travel may be required. At the same time, KPMG greatly values work-life balance and mental well-being for all staff and strive to be flexible with respect to a variety of work arrangements.
Required Skills:
What you bring to the role


Candidates should have the below skills & qualifications to apply for the position:

Working towards a University degree in Computer Science, Engineering or other related field. (Prefer students who have completed at least 2 years of study)
Minimum of 1- 2 co-op terms with some professional experience in Software Development or Information Technology. Knowledge and/or experience with the SR&ED program is a definite asset.
Student Membership in one of PEO, IEEE, ACM, ISP or similar professional organization is an asset.
Experience in other R&D related government tax incentive programs such as IRAP, NSERC an asset.
Good working knowledge of Excel, VBA, SQL, SharePoint a definite asset
Experience/knowledge of JIRA or related tools a definite asset.
Learns quickly and adapts to new situations; flexible and comfortable working with ambiguity
Strong analytical and problem solving skills with the ability to clearly identify problems and develop creative solutions
Excellent communications (both written and oral) and interpersonal skills
Proven ability to work within teams and also independently under limited supervision
Professionalism, a high degree of personal responsibility, integrity, and an ability to work with internal and external teams on time compressed engagements, often on highly confidential matters is mandatory

  

In addition to the above, the following skills & qualifications will be considered an asset:

Technical knowledge of or experience with principles of software development/design, and design or network architecture
Experience working on IT processes, IT control frameworks, and projects with knowledge of and experience using business analysis and project management methodologies

Job Summary:
Please note that you are limited to one application during the recruitment period as we ask you to think ahead of what office and service line you are most interested in.

  

At KPMG in Canada, we believe our differences make us stronger. When you join the team, you'll be part of a diverse group of professionals with a common goal - making an impact and driving innovation. 

  

In a culture that fosters inclusion and encourages flexibility, you'll receive the tools and guidance to grow your skills and achieve success your way. 

  

Come as you are. Let's do this. 

  

Why KPMG Advisory - Cyber Security?

  

At KPMG, our business-savvy cyber security professionals understand that businesses cannot be held back by cyber risk. They recognize that cyber security is about risk management - not risk elimination. 

  

As part of the cyber security team, you will work shoulder-to-shoulder with clients to work through strategy and governance, organizational transformation, cyber defense and cyber response.  

  

Strategy and governance:

Focusing on security needs versus wants, our teams build enterprise-wide security strategies that help to move organizations from reacting in crisis mode to having a proactive, value-added business solution. 

  

Transformation:

Delivering large-scale transformation programs through global service and methodology / tool alignment to help build and improve programs and processes. 

  

Cyber defense:

Helping clients maintain an information protection agenda as their business and technology programs evolve and provide greater visibility and understanding of changing risks. 

  

Cyber response:

Exercising experience in investigations, digital forensics, and recovery, which can help organizations secure evidence, understand what happened, mitigate risks, and support internal, legal and or law enforcement inquiries. 

  

We are seeking talented and energetic candidates to join our Cyber Security team as a Co-op Consultant starting in 2022.

  

This role will be a rewarding experience for you if you:

Thrive on challenges and work best in a fast-paced environment where each day is different,
Work well in a project team environment and have strong collaboration and interpersonal skills,
Have a permanent "figure it out" mindset.

Video: Digital Opportunities

Please ensure you are applying to the correct type of job according to your availability. This is a co-op position. 

  

Please be advised that all candidates must be living in the Toronto region to be considered for this role.
Job Responsibilities:
In KPMG's Risk Consulting practice, you will be part of a multi-disciplinary team, equipped with deep sector knowledge, and use superior cyber security knowledge and solutions. You will work directly with your clients to help assess and enhance their cyber security posture and ultimately enable confidence that their cyber strategy, cyber defense and cyber response capabilities will protect their business and support their growth strategies. 

  

Learn more at kpmg.ca/cyber
Required Skills:
You're a highly motivated student who strives for excellence, innovation and collaboration. You're passionate about being involved in your local community and university and have a proven ability to achieve personal and professional success while juggling competing priorities and deadlines.  

  

Candidate Profile

  

You have a passion for, or strong interest in Technology and/or Cyber Security and are looking to use your skills and knowledge to find solutions that meet our clients' needs. You have a keen interest in technology and business issues, as well as good communication skills and the desire to take on early responsibility. You have business and commercial awareness and a desire to get involved in a variety of projects but do not necessarily require a background in technology (our current graduates have degrees in a variety of subjects)! Most importantly, you have an appetite to learn about cyber security and how we can best help keep our clients secure. 

  

This role is eligible for candidates who are looking to complete a co-op in 2022.

Good understanding of information security domains and ability to demonstrate/explain them with real-world scenarios

Overview

At KPMG in Canada, we believe our differences make us stronger. When you join the team you'll be part of a diverse group of professionals with a common goal - making an impact and driving innovation. 


In a culture that fosters inclusion and encourages flexibility, you'll receive the tools and guidance to grow your skills and achieve success your way. 


Come as you are. Let's do this.  

  

Technology Risk Consulting at KPMG 

  

Today's organizations - whether businesses, public sector entities or not-for-profit organizations - are heavily and increasingly reliant on information technology (IT) and other computer-based technologies to gain and maintain strategic advantage, and to achieve and sustain operational efficiency and effectiveness.  

  

Similarly, they are increasingly reliant on not just internal resources, but also on third parties to successfully select, design, implement, and maintain these technologies and technology-enabled processes, services and solutions. Accordingly, the effective identification and management of opportunities and risks associated with the selection, implementation and operation of information technology is a critical success factor for many organizations today. 

  

Our Technology Risk Consulting services help our clients achieve these goals successfully. Our team brings technology risk awareness to the boardroom while helping clients ensure that their technology selection supports their strategy and operations - safely, securely and consistently. 

KPMG Technology Risk Consulting has an exciting opportunity for a Student Co-op, to join our team in Winter 2022! This role will be a rewarding experience if you: 

 
 

Thrive on challenges and work best in a fast-paced environment where each day is different
Work well in a project team environment and have strong collaboration and interpersonal skills
Have a permanent "figure it out" mindset

What you will do
 

Conduct assessments of IT risks and controls in support of our external audit engagements.
Perform other engagements within the context of supporting the external audit, IT internal audit or attestation engagements such as CSAE 3416 / SSAE 18 Service Organization Control (SOC) audits and assessment of System Under Development controls in large transformation projects.
Develop & utilize technical and industry knowledge to resolve complex client challenges and consult on leading practice technology enabled solutions
Identify issues / challenges and provide recommendations, opportunities and mitigation strategies to client personnel
Build long-term business relationships with client teams and executives through engagement delivery and networking in professional organizations
Participate in business development by taking an active role in the business community to increase awareness of the firm's services and level of commitment to the local market, developing and maturing relationships with internal staff and clients, and assisting with proposal development.

A successful candidate will possess the following skills and behaviors:
Ability to obtain Government of Canada security clearance
Aspiration to pursue relevant audit or accounting designation(s) (e.g. CPA, CISA, CISSP, CRISC)
Ability to work both independently and within a team environment.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Demonstrated ability to learn and succeed in a fast-paced environment.
Attention to detail and strong organization and analytical skills.
Strong interpersonal skills, professional maturity, and demonstrated ability to effectively interact and build relationships with a diverse group of clients and colleagues.
Willingness and ability to travel within Canada when required

In a culture that fosters inclusion and encourages flexibility, you'll receive the tools and guidance to grow your skills and achieve success your way. 

  

Come as you are. Let's do this.  

  

Why KPMG Cyber Security? 

Cyber Security at KPMG is a growing and successful team that offers a range of Cyber consulting services to help clients keep their systems and data secure. We provide a comprehensive range of services to many of the largest corporate companies in Canada. We are increasing our capability in Ottawa and across Regions East. 

  

You'll help our clients to protect, detect and respond to high end cyber threats; supporting them understand the cyber threat landscape, make sensible decisions on investment priorities, and build out the specialist capabilities they need to counter cyber-attacks and other threats.  

  

We are seeking talented and energetic candidates to join our Cyber Security team as a Co-op Consultant starting in Winter 2022. 

  

This role will be a rewarding experience for you if you:
 

Thrive on challenges and work best in a fast-paced environment where each day is different,
Work well in a project team environment and have strong collaboration and interpersonal skills,
Have a permanent "figure it out" mindset.

Video: Digital Opportunities 

  

Note: You will be given the opportunity to select your function of interest (Audit, Tax, Advisory or Digital) while completing the application questionnaire.  Please carefully review which specific opportunities are available below before submitting your application, as openings vary by office. Please ensure you are applying to the correct type of job according to your availability. This is a co-op position. 

  

Please be advised that all candidates must be living in the Ottawa region to be considered for this role.
Job Responsibilities:
What you will do
 

Working on various cyber security client projects to strengthen their defences.
Executing cyber maturity and gap assessments against industry standards such as ISO27001, NIST CSF, CIS Critical Security Controls and COBIT.
Creating and/or assessing cyber policies, practices and governance.
Performing penetration testing to test and probe client systems and defences
Helping our clients with cyber security issues and incident response.
Simultaneously work on delivering multiple client engagements of varying size, scope and complexity.
Service Delivery: conducting research, performing technical testing, writing reports, conducting interviews and communicating regularly with clients and resources.
Required Skills:
What you bring to the role 


Candidate Profile 

  

You have a passion for, or strong interest in Technology and/or Cyber Security and are looking to use your skills and knowledge to find solutions that meet our clients' needs. You have a keen interest in technology and business issues, as well as good communication skills and the desire to take on early responsibility. You have business and commercial awareness and a desire to get involved in a variety of projects but do not necessarily require a background in technology (our current graduates have degrees in a variety of subjects)! Most importantly, you have an appetite to learn about cyber security and how we can best help keep our clients secure. 

  

This role is eligible for candidates who are looking to complete a 4 month co-op starting in January 2022.
 

Ability to work both independently, with little supervision and within a team environment.
Excellent communication skills being able to express insights, both written and orally.
Demonstrated ability to learn and succeed in a fast-paced environment.
Attention to detail and strong organization and analytical skills.
Commercial awareness and understanding of business risks
Has a high degree of personal confidence, enthusiasm and drive.
Ability to obtain Government of Canada clearance

Knowledge or a strong interest in one or more of the following areas would be an asset:

 

Cloud Security
Business Continuity
Security strategy & Governance
Incident Response
Application security testing
Security transformation
Penetration testing

Job Responsibilities:
What you will do: 

You'll have the opportunity to work across geographies and industries to take on challenging and groundbreaking projects. From analyzing and assessing business processes to improving client performance, you'll be building strong relationships with our people and developing professional skills that will help set you up for success. 


In KPMG's Deal Advisory practice, you will be part of a multi-disciplinary team, equipped with deep sector knowledge, and use superior analytical tools. Deal Advisory is one of three practices within Advisory, consisting of: 

       i.         mergers and acquisitions, 

      ii.         debt and equity financing, 

     iii.         restructuring, 

     iv.         public and infrastructure finance, 

      v.         valuations and 

     vi.         transaction services. 


This role will provide exposure to Corporate Finance and Transaction Services activities. KPMG's Corporate Finance services are principally comprised of merger, acquisition and divestiture advisory services and financing services including raising debt and equity capital. We offer independent financial advisory and investment banking services to both private and public companies. Acting independently of financing sources, we provide clients with pure, objective advice, focusing on strategies that can help meet corporate objectives. From a Transaction Services perspective, we support buy-side transactions, sell-side transactions and integration and separation. To learn more about KPMG's Corporate Finance and Transaction Services practices, please visit kpmg.ca/advisory.

 

Co-op: January 2022

The successful candidate will be involved in the delivery of client services, including:

 

Preparing, including research for, sales and marketing materials
Assisting in identification of potential acquisition targets, purchasers and/or investors
Preparing and distributing of Investment Profiles and other key documents
Conducting financial analysis, diligence and valuation/pricing analysis (including the development of complex financial models) of companies in a variety of industries
Conducting buy and sell-side diligence activities
Communicating directly with clients, advisors, Partners, Managers and colleagues
Providing analytical and market research information (ie, public company pricing multiples, industry research, etc).  
Participating in a wide range of assignments involving local, national and international clients

You're a highly motivated student who strives for excellence, innovation and collaboration. Job Title: CPA Co-op in Audit & Canadian Tax
Application Documents Required: Co-op Main

Job Summary:
Overview of the opportunity:
			 
			At KPMG in Canada, we believe our differences make us stronger. When you join the team you'll be part of a diverse group of professionals with a common goal - making an impact and driving innovation.

			In a culture that fosters inclusion and encourages flexibility, you'll receive the tools and guidance to grow your skills and achieve success your way.

			Come as you are. Let's do this. 
			 
			We are seeking a Winter 2022 Co-op Student who is interested in obtaining relevant experience in Tax. You will join our Scientific Research and Experimental Development (SR&ED) Tax Incentives Practice group in the Vaughan Toronto North Office. As a Tax Technician you will be working as part of a KPMG Tax team to deliver on a variety of assignments.
Job Responsibilities:
What you will do: 
			KPMG's SR&ED team consists of a multidisciplinary team of engineers, accountants, and tax specialists who assist our clients to obtain tax savings and credits through programs offered by the federal and provincial governments which support the development of new technologies in Canada (for more information on these programs, please visit Scientific Research and Experimental Development Tax Incentive Program - Canada.ca .
			 
			 
    
Working with clients´ finance and accounting information with respect to their SR&ED claims.
Work with engineers to ensure that clients receive government tax incentives for their research and development efforts.
Work in a team environment in completing the SR&ED claims of small through large corporations.
Preparation of SR&ED tax forms using Taxprep software.
Respond to tax questions relating to the SR&ED program.
Assist in completing accounting and tax documentation for SR&ED claims.
Ensure that SR&ED claims documentation is filed and completed in accordance with the established quality controls.
Required Skills:
What you bring to the role:
			You are registered in a University accounting or finance co-op program and possess advanced Microsoft Office skills, with a focus on Excel, and have knowledge of relevant accounting frameworks. You are highly motivated and a strong team player. You are an excellent multi-tasker and work effectively towards tight deadlines. You possess strong written and verbal communication skills, with emphasis on attention to detail and accuracy, in a way that is open, honest, consistent and clear. Previous experience in preparing tax returns and using Taxprep would be beneficial.
			 
Keys to your success:

			 
			 
    
Experience in a public accounting firm, combined with T2 preparation would be considered an asset.
Strong communications skills (written, spoken, and verbal) in English.
Curiosity and willingness to learn computer software and technology.
Able to work closely with clients and to resolve disputes with third parties.
Ability to prioritize tasks for multiple clients to consistently achieve delivery milestones.
Knowledge of tax rules relating to the SR&ED program would be considered an asset.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:

				- Theme - Accounting and Financial Auditing
				
			
				- Theme - Data Analytics, Statistical Analysis and Mathematical Optimization 
				
			
				- Theme - Finance and Investment 
				
			
				ARTS/MATH - Finance
				
			
				MATH - Applied Mathematics
				
			
				MATH - Computing and Financial Management
				
			
				MATH - Pure Mathematics
				
			
				MATH - Statistics and Actuarial Science

At KPMG in Canada, we believe our differences make us stronger. When you join the team you'll be part of a diverse group of professionals with a common goal - making an impact and driving innovation. 


In a culture that fosters inclusion and encourages flexibility, you'll receive the tools and guidance to grow your skills and achieve success your way. 


Come as you are. Let's do this.
Job Responsibilities:
What you will do: 

In KPMG's Advisory practice, you will be part of a multi-disciplinary team, equipped with deep sector knowledge, and use superior analytic tools. You will work directly with your clients to help them improve business performance, leverage IT investments, protect financial assets, manage risk, and boost market confidence. Learn more at home.kpmg/ca/careers. 

  

Opportunities are available in our following Deal Advisory Service Line:   

 
 

Transaction Services (Winter Co-op 2022)
Required Skills:
What you bring to the role:

You're a highly motivated student who strives for excellence, innovation and collaboration. You're passionate about being involved in your local community and university and have a proven ability to achieve personal and professional success while juggling competing priorities and deadlines.  

  

Keys to your success:

Strong relationship-building skills that will enable you to easily interact with clients, colleagues, and the wider community.
A commitment to continual learning - developing new skills, taking on new responsibilities and broadening your knowledge through research.
The ability to provide crucial consultation and analysis for the variety of clients you will serve.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Accounting and Financial Auditing
				
			
				- Theme - Data Analytics, Statistical Analysis and Mathematical Optimization 
				
			
				- Theme - Finance and Investment 
				
			
				ARTS/MATH/SCI - Chartered Professional Accounting
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Cover Letter,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
We are an early-stage ed-tech startup, co-founded by the Co-CEO and CAO of Top Hat. We are looking for talented, self-motivated students to join our team and help us grow our business as we introduce our product to classrooms.   


Kiritk.io is an ed-tech platform with a focus on helping students develop their critical and creative thinking abilities, as well as communication and leadership skills in modern higher education. The system is emerging from a decade of research and experience working with the teaching faculties in dozens of universities across North America.   


We are looking for highly motivated, energetic self-starters with excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to grow and progress in a fast-paced environment. You'll be responsible for outbound lead generation, as well as supporting marketing inbound leads by scheduling demonstrations for stakeholders and decision-makers in universities and colleges across North America! You will be working with and reporting to the VP of Sales and Co-Founder, while seamlessly cooperating with other team members to complete assigned tasks in an efficient manner.  


At Kritik, we encourage a cross-functional/flat, open and creative office environment. We want to ensure all of our team members are healthy both physically and mentally. We have weekly game times to bond with the team, monthly celebrations to have fun, and weekly business check-ins to help you learn about all facets of a business. At Kritik, we want our team members to fly high. We expect everyone to come every day feeling ambitious and ready to share our vision and mission. Kritik encourages a fun environment where there is a lot of room for advancement and support. Everyone here is a team player with a critical, yet motivational mindset to support the growth of our ed-tech platform. That might look like providing constructive feedback, problem-solving and having integrity with the work you provide.  


Additional Benefits/Perks

We take professional development seriously. We put strong training and coaching programs in place to help you level-up skills, and provide clear paths for career progression. Given the stage and fast-growth of Kritik, the opportunities to grow here happen early and often.
We want you to add value to our outstanding company culture which is built around honesty, transparency and creativity.
Weekly team bonding activities!
Dog-friendly office - we have our own Kritik mascot named Indie!
Working From Home policy even before and after COVID
Job Responsibilities:
Job Responsibilities
 Business Development: 


Prospect for high-value sales leads
Qualify and develop new deals within defined prospects accounts
Set qualified demonstrations of the Kritik platform through high volumes of calling and emailing
Educate professors on how Kritik is utilizing a "Learning by Teaching" methodology to allow students to reach their highest levels of cognitive skill
Take a consultative approach to uncover educators' pain points
Track activities and log relevant information in the Hubspot CRM system 
Work on special projects and help develop process and playbooks 
Run demonstrations of "Kritik Lite," our free version for Kritik, to Community College Professors and other qualified educators.
Work on various other projections such as community engagement, virtual conference exhibition, and qualification of marketing leads
Other ad hoc tasks upon request

 Marketing:


Create webinars and presentation materials with the marketing team
Help to create HTML email campaigns for promoting upcoming events and outreach
Engage with prospective customers and leads via social media while representing Kritik 
Creating social media campaigns
Gather and create content for monthly newsletters
Engage with conference members and initiate follow-ups prospective clients

 More: 


Other ad hoc tasks upon request
Helping the CS team when necessary
Help build on-boarding materials for future co-ops!

Some hired BDRs will split time between their marketing and business development responsibilities, others may focus solely on business development or marketing.
Required Skills:
Required Skills/Qualifications

Highly motivated and driven individual
An entrepreneurial mindset who strives in a fast-paced environment
Experience with inbound/outbound (* 3+ months experience in cold calling at volume is an asset)
Strong team player with a positive attitude and passion for relationship building 
Strong interpersonal skills
You have persuasive communication skills and can deliver a strong pitch to clients in an efficient and effective manner
You are determined and persistent and can overcome roadblocks through creativity
You are a true believer in changing the educational landscape for the better and can convey this message effectively to prospective clients
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Business Administration
				
			
				- Theme - Sales and Business Development 
				
			
				ARTS - Business
				
			
				ENV - Business, Enterprise and Development
				
			
				SCI - Business
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Cover Letter,Résumé,Grade Report

Product Manager

You will define the strategy and roadmap for a best in class peer assessment platform that aligns with Kritik's mission and immediate business goals
Work with internal customers (sales, customer success, operations) and external customers (University professors and students) to ensure their insights contribute to product decisions
You will collaborate with engineering and design teams to ship new, impactful platform capabilities that drive revenue and product growth
Collaborate with our design team to come up with wireframes and UI
Work with the development team to write stories, plan, and manage sprint work

Co-op Main

Job Title:
NEW
									



										Sales Assistant & Assistant Cider Maker - Sales and Marketing Focused
Job Summary:
KW Craft Cider is an award-winning, local, refined dry cider made using Champagne yeast. Our goal is to raise the standard for ciders in Canada. Our cider is currently available in over 200 locations across Ontario including bars, restaurants, grocery stores, and LCBO. 


The position of Sales Assistant & Assistant Cider Maker will focus on sales and marketing related tasks. You will have the opportunity to conduct sales with established customers, help expand our customer base and sell finished products through the use of e-commerce and online retail platforms. You will also be interacting with customers to hear first-hand how the cider that you helped make is being experienced in the market. Other potential opportunities include attending events and conducting outside sales meetings/tastings. The marketing aspects of this position will primarily be conducted using social media but will have opportunities to delve into further marketing campaigns and projects. 


This position also has some hands-on aspects. Primarily, all hands-on aspects of this position will relate to final packaging of products and assisting team members with packaging related operations. 


Learn how a small and rapidly growing company functions while working with other experienced professionals.
Job Responsibilities:
Work with and support team members as required.
Meet with customers to conduct sales meetings.
Prepare prospective client lists based on sales criteria.
Maintain an online retail store.
Prepare and ship finished products to customers.
Update and maintain social media posts and campaigns.
Conduct tastings with customers.
Keep all paperwork up to date.
Pump, mix, and filter the cider as required.
Drive a company van or car as needed to customer and supplier sites.
Work with pressure vessels.

  

Non-essential requirements:

Experience with social media marketing
Experience with ecommerce tools & platforms
Required Skills:
Professionalism.
Willingness to learn.
Willingness to take on customer-facing roles.
Openness to feedback.
Ability to work collaboratively.
Basic mechanical aptitude in order to work with threaded fittings, gaskets, valves, and compressed air.
Hold a valid Ontario driver's license.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Business Administration
				
			
				- Theme - Event Planning and Co-ordination 
				
			
				- Theme - Marketing and Communication 
				
			
				- Theme - Natural Resource Management 
				
			
				- Theme - Quality Assurance and Control 
				
			
				- Theme - Sales and Business Development 
				
			
				- Theme - Sustainable Development
				
			
				- Theme - Waste or Wastewater Management
