Job Summary: KX (https://kx.com/) is looking for co-op students for our Ottawa office for January-August 2022 to work with us to develop our streaming analytics platform, our Python interface for it, and our Python interface for Kdb+, the world's fastest time-series database. At KX we don't relegate co-op students to busywork - you'll be doing the same sort of work that everyone else on the team does, working with a mentor to deliver value to our customers. Everyone at the Ottawa office began their career with KX as a co-op student, and we are keen to keep this tradition going.
Job Responsibilities: At the beginning of the placement, you will learn the functional array language q (https://code.kx.com/q4m3/), and use it in combination with other languages for the tasks mentioned in the job summary.
Required Skills:
The following skills/experience are desired, but not required:
 

    Functional programming (e.g. Haskell, Scheme, Lisp, Racket, j, k, q, APL, etc.)
    Array programming (e.g. Numpy, MATLAB, j, k, q, APL, etc.)
    Stream processing
    Python
    C
    C++
    Programming language interop (e.g. using C code from Python)
    Cloud & containers (e.g. AWS, GCP, Azure, Docker, Kubernetes, etc.)
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

Job Summary:
NOTE:  This is a residential position and you will be living at the L'Arche home with the core members and staff.  


L'Arche is part of a worldwide network of over 120 communities where men and women with developmental disabilities and those who support them share life together. Every year, L'Arche communities welcome 'assistants' who come to live, work and create home with people with intellectual disabilities. www.larche.ca 


Often called 'the school of the heart,' L'Arche is a dynamic example of how people of different intellectual capacity, social origin and culture can live together. 


L'Arche Ontario 


This time I want my work term to be an experience I will carry with me for the rest of my life! 


L'Arche is
 

a way of life rather than a work place
a place of reflection and action
self discovery through being with people
a place where I am valued and appreciated for who I am
a place where practical skills develop in conjunction with a willingness to be challenged and an openness to change


At L'Arche we reframe the client/caregiver model by promoting mutual relationships.   In our homes, people with a variety of abilities live and share the fun and challenges of life together by supporting each other with gifts and talents which we all possess.
Job Responsibilities:
Your role as a L'Arche assistant will be to share your energy with the people you will be living with in various challenging and fun ways, from household tasks, accompanying someone to an appointment, helping someone prepare for the day, cooking a meal together, to enjoying a good concert, and developing long lasting relationships. 

 
 
 Responsibilities:

Ensuring that the physical, emotional, spiritual, vocational and recreational needs of the Core Members were met.
Completing any documentation requested to record progress.
Ensure the home is safe, clean and inviting to all.
Respond to each Core Member's individual needs by respectfully supporting them with their personal hygiene, dress and eating.
Actively share the lived experience with other team members.  Encourage open communication between fellow team members in response to situations that may result in team tension if not addressed
Meet regularly with the Assistants' Coordinator for mentoring and orientation.
Participate in the planning and presentation of house celebrations.  Support community events as possible after house commitments are met.


Because mutual relationships are essential to our professional and personal lives, experience at L'Arche has a broad application in the working field.  Former L'Arche assistants have gone on to be lawyers, teachers, actors, social workers, doctors and even business consultants. 


Shannon Seager worked at L'Arche for  her Cooperative Education work term and says: 


"The last 4 months have been the most challenging but more importantly, the most rewarding time of my life.  The experience I had here at L'Arche Hamilton has changed my perspective of myself and the world.  I have discovered the kind of person I want to be and the kind of life I would like to live." 

Basic Information for Co-op Students in Ontario:
Required Skills:
Training:  We will provide training for First Aid & CPR (some locations require this training prior to employment); Crisis Prevention Intervention (CPI), and possibility of further formation and training.
Pre-employment requirements:  Criminal reference check (vulnerable sector).
Mentorship: There will be regular one-to-one mentoring sessions for first 3 months of the placement (once every two weeks) and then less frequently afterwards.  These are opportunities to discuss the rewards and challenges of the placement.
Personal Time:  3 hours during the day
Time Away:   One and a half days away per week + one long weekend per month
Additional Placements:   We have had students stay for multiple placements or return for additional placements.  This should be discussed with your hosting location is mutually desirable.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Health Care: Therapy and Patient Care 
				
			
				- Theme - Occupational Health and Safety
				
			
				AHS - Kinesiology
				
			
				AHS - Public Health and Health Systems
				
			
				AHS - Recreation and Leisure Studies
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Cover Letter,Résumé,Grade Report

At L'Arche we reframe the client/caregiver model by promoting mutual relationships.   In our homes, people with a variety of abilities live and share the fun and challenges of life together by supporting each other with gifts and talents which we all possess.
Job Responsibilities:
Your role as a L'Arche assistant will be to share your energy with the people you will be living with in various challenging and fun ways, from household tasks, accompanying someone to an appointment, helping someone prepare for the day, cooking a meal together, to enjoying a good concert, and developing long lasting relationships. 


Responsiblities
Ensuring that the physical, emotional, spiritual, vocational and recreational needs of the Core Members were met.
Completing any documentation requested to record progress.
Ensure the home is safe, clean and inviting to all.
Respond to each Core Member's individual needs by respectfully supporting them with their personal hygiene, dress and eating.
Actively share the lived experience with other team members.  Encourage open communication between fellow team members in response to situations that may result in team tension if not addressed
Meet regularly with the Assistants' Coordinator for mentoring and orientation.
Participate in the planning and presentation of house celebrations.  Support community events as possible after house commitments are met.


Because mutual relationships are essential to our professional and personal lives, experience at L'Arche has a broad application in the working field.  Former L'Arche assistants have gone on to be lawyers, teachers, actors, social workers, doctors and even business consultants. 


Shannon Seager worked at L'Arche for  her Cooperative Education work term and says: 


"The last 4 months have been the most challenging but more importantly, the most rewarding time of my life.  The experience I had here at L'Arche Hamilton has changed my perspective of myself and the world.  I have discovered the kind of person I want to be and the kind of life I would like to live." 

Basic Information for Co-op Students in Ontario:
Required Skills:
Training:  We will provide training for First Aid & CPR (some locations require this training prior to employment); Crisis Prevention Intervention (CPI), and possibility of further formation and training.
Pre-employment requirements:  Criminal reference check (vulnerable sector).
Formation: Throughout your time with L'Arche, you will be part of a Formation group of assistants where you will have the opportunity to reflect on and discuss the rewards and challenges of life in L'Arche.
Personal Time:  All live-in Assistants are responsible to be present for 40 hours/week.  The schedule is developed by the House Leader and will reflect the needs of the house.  Your time will be scheduled accordingly.
Time Away:  Each community handles this differently, but you will receive an average of 2-days away per week.
Additional Placements:   We have had students stay for multiple placements or return for additional placements.  This should be discussed with your hosting location if mutually desirable.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Health Care: Therapy and Patient Care 
				
			
				- Theme - Occupational Health and Safety
				
			
				AHS - Kinesiology
				
			
				AHS - Public Health and Health Systems
				
			
				AHS - Recreation and Leisure Studies
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Cover Letter,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
L'Arche is part of a worldwide network of over 120 communities where men and women with developmental disabilities and those who support them share life together. Every year, L'Arche communities welcome 'assistants' who come to live, work and create home with people with intellectual disabilities. www.larche.ca 


Often called 'the school of the heart,' L'Arche is a dynamic example of how people of different intellectual capacity, social origin and culture can live together. 


L'Arche Ontario 


This time I want my work term to be an experience I will carry with me for the rest of my life! 


L'Arche is
 

a way of life rather than a work place
a place of reflection and action
self discovery through being with people
a place where I am valued and appreciated for who I am
a place where practical skills develop in conjunction with a willingness to be challenged and an openness to change

At L'Arche we reframe the client/caregiver model by promoting mutual relationships.   In our homes, people with a variety of abilities live and share the fun and challenges of life together by supporting each other with gifts and talents which we all possess.
Job Responsibilities:
Member of the Program Team or House Team is responsible to support individual Core Members (adult with developmental disability) to develop and experience a repertoire of daytime activities that build on their existing skills, enable individuals to learn new skills and are reflective of each Core Members choice of meaningful daytime activities.  The second possible responsibility is to support core members (men and women with intellectual disabilities) by sharing in their daily life.  Support the health and wellbeing all members of L'Arche Hamilton individual homes. 


Daily rhythm and responsibilities are much like in any household where members of the household require personal care support:
 

Assisting Core Members with their morning and evening routines
Assisting with bathing and using the toilet as needed
Supporting Core Members in following the direction of medical professionals including administering medication
Cooking & cleaning
Grocery shopping
Yard work as required
Required Skills:
Training:  We will provide training for First Aid & CPR (some locations require this training prior to employment); Crisis Prevention Intervention (CPI), and possibility of further formation and training.
Pre-employment requirements:  Criminal reference check (vulnerable sector).
Mentorship: There will be regular one-to-one mentoring sessions for first 3 months of the placement (once every two weeks) and then less frequently afterwards.  These are opportunities to discuss the rewards and challenges of the placement.
Additional Placements:   We have had students stay for multiple placements or return for additional placements.  This should be discussed with your hosting location is mutually desirable.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:

				AHS - Recreation and Leisure Studies

Job Summary:
Locations can include: : Saint-Malachie


L'ARCHE: PEOPLE WITH DIFFERING ABILITIES TRANSFORMING LIVES - TRANSFORMING SOCIETY 

We welcome Assistants to live, work, and learn together with men and women with developmental disabilities in our communities.  Founded by Jean Vanier in 1964, L'Arche strives to shape a more human and just society. 


"Community Assistant" Role Description: 


Assistants support Core Members (men and women with developmental disabilities) in their daily life.  We cook and eat dinner together, get together with friends, participate in activities in our neighbourhoods, go on vacation together, and celebrate often. 


L'Arche brings together people from different cultures, ages, genders, abilities, faiths, and invites all of these people to create community together. Through friendship and relationships with Core Members, Assistants gain valuable life skills and opportunities for personal growth and leadership.  All new Assistants participate in the L'Arche Leadership Development Program. 


Shannon Seager worked at L'Arche for her Cooperative Education work term and says: 

"The last 4 months have been the most challenging but more importantly, the most rewarding time of my life.  The experience I had here at L'Arche Hamilton has changed my perspective of myself and the world.  I have discovered the kind of person I want to be and the kind of life I would like to live." 

Why choose to come to one of the communities in Québec?

Improve your French, with weekly support if needed. 

Get to know another culture 

Meet and share life with Francophones from around the world. Share your experiences and knowledge and have a truly life changing experience. 

Formation: There will be regular one-to-one mentoring sessions for first 3 months of the placement (once every two weeks) and then less frequently afterwards.  These are opportunities to discuss the rewards and challenges of the placement.
Job Responsibilities:
This is a live-in position whereby you share life as you would in a normal home setting with individuals with and without developmental disabilities.  The assistants (care-providers) are living in the home 6 of 7 days / week.  Assistants have the same responsibilities as one would have in any home (i.e. cooking and cleaning), but more importantly have the responsibility of spending time getting to know people in the home, sharing time and activities together, and learning about themselves as they discover that they can just be themselves and be valued for who they are.  As an assistant, one does not go home after a day of work, because home is also the place where one works.  Assistants have a bedroom that is their private space within a L'Arche home. 


We offer an exceptional and life changing adventure in friendship and self-discovery.  L'Arche is your opportunity to make a meaningful difference in the world while having an experience that is so much more than a job! 


L'Arche is 

- a way of life rather than a work place 

- a place of reflection and action 

- a place of self discovery through being with people 

- a place where you are valued and appreciated for who you are 

- a place where practical skills develop in conjunction with a willingness to be challenged and an openness to change
Required Skills:
Training:  

We will provide training for First Aid & CPR; Crisis Prevention Intervention (CPI), and the possibility of further formation and training. 


Requirements: 

We hire people from a wide variety of educational backgrounds. 

We are looking for people with an open attitude, a desire to grow, and who want to make a difference 

Basic knowledge of French, fluency is not required 

Training is provided through the L'Arche Leadership Development Program 

Pre-employment requirements:  

Criminal reference check (vulnerable sector). 

Personal Time:  3 hours during the day, plus 1.5 (36hrs) 

 days per week + one long weekend of 3 days per month
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Architecture and Design
				
			
				- Theme - Business Administration
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Quality Assurance 
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				- Theme - Construction and Infrastructure Development 
				
			
				- Theme - Event Planning and Co-ordination 
				
			
				- Theme - Health Care: Public Health and Wellness 
				
			
				- Theme - Human Resources
				
			
				- Theme - Natural Resource Management 
				
			
				- Theme - Sales and Business Development 
				
			
				- Theme - Supply Chain Management and Logistics 
				
			
				- Theme - Sustainable Development
				
			
				- Theme - Visual, Urban & Industrial Design 
				
			
				AHS - Kinesiology
				
			
				AHS - Public Health and Health Systems
				
			
				AHS - Recreation and Leisure Studies
				
			
				ARTS - Humanities
				
			
				ENV - Planning
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science
				
			
				SCI - Biological Sciences
Application Documents Required: Cover Letter,Résumé

Job Title:
NEW
									



										L'Arche Community Assistant - Western or Atlantic Canada
Job Summary:
L'ARCHE: PEOPLE WITH DIFFERING ABILITIES TRANSFORMING LIVES - TRANSFORMING SOCIETY

We welcome Assistants to live, work, and learn together with men and women with developmental disabilities in our communities.  L'Arche strives to shape a more human and just society by offering people of different abilities a life changing experience of companionship, community, belonging and fun.  


Role Description: 

Assistant teams support Core Members (men and women with developmental disabilities) in their daily life. We cook and eat dinner together, get together with friends, participate in activities in our neighbourhoods, go on vacation together, and celebrate often.  At L'Arche, people with and without intellectual disabilities live together creating communities of friendship and belonging. 


L'Arche brings together people from different cultures, ages, genders, abilities, and faiths, and invites all of these people to create community together. Through friendship and relationships with Core Members, Assistants gain valuable life skills and opportunities for personal growth and leadership.  All new Assistants participate in the L'Arche Leadership Development Program. 


Shannon Seager worked at L'Arche for her Cooperative Education work term and says: "The last 4 months have been the most challenging but more importantly, the most rewarding time of my life. The experience I had here at L'Arche has changed my perspective of myself and the world.  I have discovered the kind of person I want to be and the kind of life I would like to live."
Job Responsibilities:
This is a live-in position somewhat comparable to being a counselor at an overnight summer camp in that Assistants are responsible for supporting Core Members throughout the entire day as well as overnight as needed. Assistants receive at least two hours of personal time each day, as well as two days off per week. (This is simply a time away from responsibilities - Assistants may stay in the house as they like during this time or go elsewhere.) Assistants have a bedroom that is their private space within a L'Arche home. 


Daily rhythm and responsibilities are much like in any household where members of the household require personal care support:
 

Assisting Core Members with their morning and evening routines
Assisting with bathing and using the toilet as needed
Supporting Core Members in following the direction of medical professionals including administering medication
Cooking & cleaning
Grocery shopping
Yard work as required

More importantly Assistants have the responsibility of building community by spending time getting to know people in the home, participating in the spiritual life of the home and community, sharing activities together, and learning about themselves and others as they discover that they can just be themselves and be valued and appreciated for who they are.  


We offer an exceptional and life changing adventure in friendship and self-discovery.  L'Arche is your opportunity to make a meaningful difference in the world while having an experience that is so much more than a job! 


L'Arche is: 

- a way of life rather than a work place 

- a place of reflection and action 

- a place of self discovery through being with people 

- a place where you are valued and appreciated for who you are 

- a place where practical skills develop in conjunction with a willingness to be challenged and an openness to change
Required Skills:
Training: 
 

We will provide training for First Aid & CPR; Crisis Prevention Intervention (CPI), and possibility of further formation and training.

Requirements:

 

We hire people from a wide variety of educational backgrounds.
We are looking for people with an open attitude, ability to work as part of team, a desire to grow, and who want to make a meaningful difference in the world
Personal traits of creativity, flexibility, attention to detail, and ability to organize time and carry responsibility are important for the role of Assistant.
Opportunities available in either English or French
Training is provided through the L'Arche Leadership Development Program

Pre-employment requirements: 

 

Criminal reference check (vulnerable sector).

Personal Time:

 

2-3 hours during the day, plus average of 2 days per week
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Health Care: Therapy and Patient Care 
				
			
				AHS - Kinesiology
				
			
				AHS - Public Health and Health Systems
				
			
				AHS - Recreation and Leisure Studies
				
			
				ARTS - Social Sciences
				
			
				ARTS - Sociology and Legal Studies
				
			
				ARTS/SCI - Psychology
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
Lake Harbour is a world-class team of product engineers and manufacturing experts ready from day one to deliver any product to market. We work with clients, from small start-ups up to global companies in diverse domains, ranging from infrastructure, transportation, mobility, automation, and even construction.  

Our clients count on us to resolve problems they can't!  


Note: there is flexibility for an 8-month term if both parties are interested.
Job Responsibilities:
Create 3D models in SolidWorks: assemblies, parts, and drawings 
Measure physical samples using a caliper 
Re-create parts in CAD based on physical samples 
Perform engineering calculations (static analysis) to ensure the designs are robust 
Prepare presentations in PowerPoint to showcase the design to the client 
Organize design documentation for patents or R&D reports
Required Skills:
Working towards a bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering 
Efficient use of CAD software (SolidWorks) 
An understanding of the manufacturing methods for a variety of parts 
Tolerance stack-up analysis would be an asset 
Independent and resilient team member 
Show up every morning with a positive attitude 
You are legally authorized to work in Canada.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:

Job Summary:
Layer2 Financial is a Crypto FinTech startup with a mission to bring safe Crypto Banking to anyone and everyone. We believe deeply that safe banking is a basic human right. It underpins strong communities, which enables strong economies which leads to a better world.  


We are a small but rapidly growing team staffed by passionate people. We have a rich variety of experience covering technology, crypto, banking, payments, security and regulation. It makes us different and positions us to take on the challenges facing global banking and payments today. 


We are building the next generation of banking services to bridge the gap between traditional banking and decentralized finance that will support the farmer in Canada to the field worker in Cambodia - driving the 'banking of the unbanked'.
Job Responsibilities:
You will work directly within our engineering team, and be supported and mentored by a group of highly experienced engineers. You will learn while delivering high quality code into production. You will enjoy being thrown in with real challenges while being supported to grow and deliver value to our customers and to yourself. 


Value and delivering quality code in a timely manner matters above all. We foster an environment of growth and discussion. You will be an experienced engineer with code in production when you leave us. If you feel you have something to contribute, are quiet or loud and want to learn - we want to hear from you. Join our team, and leave your mark.
Required Skills:
We are looking for people who have been involved in creating moderately complex software to some degree, with a preference for backend work.  We are less worried about what languages you have used - but have a preference for Java and Golang, mentoring will cover your knowledge gaps. You should be comfortable writing testable code and using source control (preferably GIT). 


We don't mind where your experience comes from, it could be in the form of a side hustle, open-source contributions or previous work experience. If you have any experience with blockchain or crypto development, smart contracts, accounting or finance knowledge - that would be an asset.

Job Summary:
LCBO Next is an enterprise innovation development team at the Communitech Hub. Our mission is to bring fresh ideas, creative problem solving, and developing new skills to complement LCBO's IT initiatives. We take pride in working on meaningful projects that often move into production at HQ. 


You will be working with 3 other bright and exceptionally capable co-ops, often finding yourself learning much more than your job title may entail. Our 2 lab leaders have 30+ years combined experience in Development, Architecture, Product, and Innovation. Our co-op alumni have had subsequent work terms at Google, Facebook, Microsoft, Apple, Yahoo, Uber, DraperAI, Yelp, and Bloomberg, to name a few.

The VCS Coordinator, under the direction and guidance of the VCS Manager provides technical and/or management support and assists operations staff to ensure projects are completed on time and within budget.  Check our VCS online presentation https://prezi.com/view/T0MTgt1rzv7aUABSKhvI/

Job Summary:
At Left Turn Right Turn (LTRT), our mission (and yours, should you choose to accept it!) is to get people out of cars and onto transit. We work with transit agencies to understand their service, and plan, design, and implement improvements to the customer experience and operations. Transit Explorers support a wide range of projects and get full exposure to the glamorous life (or so we tell each other) of a consultant as part of a fun and dynamic team working with Canada's largest and smallest transit agencies.  

  

Projects delivered in the past year include:
 

Undertaking a regional planning exercise and governance review for multiple agencies
Developing a technology roadmap and organizational plan
Crafting an accessibility policy and developing an accessibility program
Undertaking operational and business process reviews of transit scheduling and dispatch
Assessing on-demand transit opportunities for low-density geographic areas
Analyzing and preparing capital infrastructure plan including fleet plan

  

Our DNA

The LTRT team is creative, collaborative, and balanced - it's in our DNA.  

  

Creative: We look for new ideas and methods to inject at the start of each project. This keeps things fresh and relevant for the client, and exciting and interesting for us. We innovate in the work that we do because one can, and one should, always strive to improve.  

  

Collaborative: We communicate effectively, whether in-person, in writing, or by smoke signal. We mix working meetings and workshops regularly into our projects to keep us in sync internally as well as with clients. Most importantly, we'll support each other during crunches so no one bears the load alone. 

  

Balanced: We value a balanced approach to work and life. We'll crack a joke when the time is right, and crack down when it's not. We'll follow up that long work week with necessary recovery time off (with some food, drinks, and the occasional board game to accelerate the process!).
Job Responsibilities:
Transit Explorers will support and learn through a wide variety of projects, applying their smarts, experience, and creativity at a culture-focused firm. Your responsibilities could include:
 

Researching and documenting cutting-edge industry best practices through the beauty of the interweb, phone, or in-person interviews with vendors and agencies.
Analyzing operational, financial, horoscope, and other data to derive insights.
Evaluating niche transit software systems, from the perspective of contract compliance, system accessibility, or the 'cool-factor'.
Writing technical and non-technical reports that bring a (figurative) tear to the reader's eye.
Crafting and designing breath-taking, head-turning powerpoint presentations and workshop materials.
Researching, reviewing, and summarizing key findings from documents such as Official Plans and Transit Master Plans.
Developing jaw-dropping, project-winning proposals.
Required Skills:
Qualifications

Have an interest in public transit issues (bonus points if you have a model railroad collection).
A superb eye for detail and accuracy (like, seriously, ok).
Excellent writing and communication skills, with a knack for translating technical concepts to a non-technical audience (consulting = smart report writing, it's true).
Experience in analyzing data using Excel.
Demonstrated problem-solving and decision-making skills.
Ability to work independently as well as in team environments.
Bonus gold stars if you have graphic communication skills (infographics, charts, and graphs), GIS analysis, or killer Excel skills.
Student in good standing at Waterloo University (Planning/Engineering).

Job Title:
NEW
									



										Software Engineering - Late Stage Fintech Startup
Job Summary:
LendingHome is a real estate tech company. We won our leadership position in the hearts and minds of our customers by leveraging technology and data to solve their financing needs, and are now building on that success to offer them additional services to help them build and grow their businesses.


A co-op term with LendingHome offers you great networking and mentorship to kickstart your career in an emerging tech ecosystem. We're a product and technology-led company that values building a diverse and inclusive team who support each other with respect and empathy. We're entrepreneurial, diligent, and emphasize a culture that promotes creativity and growth. We've been featured for 5 consecutive years in Wealthfront's 2021 Career-Launching Companies List, comprised of tech companies ideal for young people starting their careers, as well as Forbes' Fintech 50. Come meet your future colleagues, investors, and even co-founders! 


Get Things Done

We believe in hiring the absolute best, and strive to achieve quality over quantity. Because we move large amounts of funds in transactions every day, we value finding the right balance between speed and stability. Our team engages in all dimensions of the business, from sales and marketing to capital markets and underwriting. 


We'll work with you as you own and deliver business features that directly impact our core business, user experience, and ultimately help us to revolutionize the mortgage industry. Previous interns have worked on projects from launching a pilot consumer mortgage program to a machine vision lambda for text extraction.
Job Responsibilities:
Tech Stack / What You'll Learn

At LendingHome, we love exploring new technologies and have an emphasis on shipping clean, robust code. 


Our stack is primarily built with Ruby (on Rails) and ReactJS (with TypeScript) and we are moving toward an event-sourced Service Oriented Architecture using primarily Kotlin. At LendingHome, we are always looking for and adopting new technologies such as GraphQL. Our engineering team uses Git for source control and an automated build system to test and deploy on AWS. Quick iteration and shipping is a core part of LendingHome's engineering culture. We use Continuous Deployment so you will have the opportunity to deploy your code every day. Co-op students will learn to and be expected to ship code through our devops pipeline to actual production environments for our users. We believe in integrating co-op students into our engineering and cross functional teams rather than assigning you separate "intern projects". As such, you will work with business, product, design, and other engineering teams to shape and deliver features that will be used by real people across the country.
Required Skills:
Who we're looking for

You will be working with a team to write, read, design, and communicate about software. You need to be able to do all of those things.
We want you to grow while you're with us. You need to be able to tackle hard problems with motivation, learn from failure, ask for help, and help others.

These skills will help

Object-Oriented Design 
Functional Programming
Experience with one of Ruby, Python, or JavaScript/TypeScript
Experience working with groups to build and deploy projects
Mortgage experience not required - just general curiosity about real estate/fintech and a willingness to learn and make a difference

Send us a link to your GitHub / LinkedIn, or apply using the link below. We look forward to hearing from you!

Job Summary:
Metadata

Position: Software Developer 

Level: Intern 

Location: Remote (Toronto, UTC-4) 


Company Description

We are revolutionizing the internet; putting people back in control of their online privacy and data. 

LetAlone is an exciting tech start-up that is changing the rules and ecosystem of online advertising. We firmly believe that the future of the internet should lie in the hands of the users, not a few large corporations, and we're building a platform to enable users to take control of their data. We are creating an ethical, inclusive and equitable internet for everyone. 


LetAlone values diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We are committed to creating an inclusive work environment. LetAlone provides equal employment opportunity for all applicants and employees. We do not discriminate based on any legally-protected class or characteristic. Employment decisions are made based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. 


It is important to note that LetAlone is a self-funded startup and as such, we need to be mindful of our operating costs. We rely on funding to help subsidize wages. Therefore, our preference is for students who meet the funding criteria of being a Canadian citizen or a Canadian permanent resident however, holding a Canadian citizenship or permanent resident card is not a requirement for employment with LetAlone. All students must hold a valid Canadian work permit for the duration of the work term.
Job Responsibilities:
Job Description

You will join our organization at a very exciting time, and will have the opportunity to work with and learn from our company leaders. We want you to learn, grow, and thrive, so we will spend time together in the beginning to learn what project suits your interests and skills. We want you to grow into a role where you own the full product lifecycle, gaining skills throughout your time with us, and filling in the gaps with the support of our team along the way. Collaborating closely with ex-Arup and ex-Google employees, provides you with an incredible hands-on learning experience. Our team is small and nimble, which allows us to rapidly unpack ideas and design considerations to determine the impact of functionality and suitability for broader solutions. 


The ideal candidate will have the opportunity to own a piece of work through all stages of development, from ideation to deployment. At the end of the internship, we want you to walk away having put your stamp on a particular product or feature. We want you to be proud of having overcome the challenges of taking an idea all the way to production. Aside from programming, you'll be involved in whiteboarding sessions and a number of ideation workshops.
Required Skills:
About You

You will be working directly with the CTO. The ideal candidate has a mixture of experience in some of the following areas. There is no requirement to be a full stack developer, and we do not expect you to know, or be interested in, all of the following areas. 

- Frontend frameworks: Vue, Angular, React 

- Server side languages: Go, NodeJS, Python 

- Authentication: Firebase, Auth0 

- Databases: Redis, Postgresql 

- Infrastructure: GCP, AWS, Azure, Terraform, Kubernetes 

- Collaboration: Google Workspace, Git, Kanban

Company Description

We are revolutionizing the internet; putting people back in control of their online privacy and data. 

LetAlone is an exciting tech start-up that is changing the rules and ecosystem of online advertising. We firmly believe that the future of the internet should lie in the hands of the users, not a few large corporations, and we're building a platform to enable users to take control of their data. LetAlone is a self-funded startup and as such, we need to be mindful of our operating costs. We rely on funding to help subsidize wages. Therefore, our preference is for students who meet the funding criteria of being a Canadian citizen or a Canadian permanent resident; however, holding a Canadian citizenship or permanent resident status is not a requirement for employment with LetAlone. All students must hold a valid Canadian work permit for the duration of the work term. 


Work Environment

We have a virtual work environment, and our team currently works from home. While we believe that in-person engagements promote a unique aspect of creativity and innovation, we are fully committed to a work from home option. As such, if an in-person meeting is scheduled, there will always be an option to join remotely. If you can join in person, the meetings will take place in the City of Toronto.
Job Responsibilities:
Job Description

You will join our organization at a very exciting time, and will have the opportunity to work with and learn from our company leaders. We want you to learn, grow, and thrive, so we will spend time together in the beginning to learn what project suits your interests and skills. We want you to grow into a role where you own the full product lifecycle, gaining skills throughout your time with us, and filling in the gaps with the support of our team along the way. 


Collaborating closely with ex-Arup and ex-Google employees, provides you with an incredible hands-on learning experience. Our team is small and nimble, which allows us to rapidly unpack ideas and design considerations to determine the impact of functionality and suitability for broader solutions. 


The ideal candidate will have the opportunity to own a piece of work through all stages of research and development; from ideation to presentation and deployment. We want you to be proud of having overcome the challenges of taking an idea all the way to production. Aside from research and development, you'll be involved in whiteboarding sessions and a number of ideation workshops. 


You will research existing methodologies, tools and products for performing segmentilization (to attribute training data to advertising segments). This will include research of existing techniques available in the open source community, generating a hypothesis and testing the techniques available on generated test data, working alongside engineers to build an interface to utilize your model, and reporting on the results of your hypothesis.  


In addition, we envisage the following goals for this role:
 

Analyze user internet behaviour
Assign user internet behaviour to advertising segments
Visualize the assigned advertising segments to the user for review

Job Summary:
About Level

Level is an employer-sponsored benefit that allows people to easily find, manage, and pay for care. We're first tackling dental because it's an often-ignored segment of healthcare that accounts for over $100 billion in US spending each year. Our team includes smart, passionate people that includes former employees from Square, Oscar, and Uber. We're backed by top investors, including First Round Capital and Homebrew. We've seen amazing feedback from early customers in our first few months in the market. 


How we work

We love working with engineers who delight in writing constructive comments as much as writing elegant code, who thoughtfully define API specifications, and who articulate the rationale behind their engineering decisions. 


As a company, we pride ourselves on collaboration. We believe you bring a valuable, thoughtful perspective to the conversation. We look to your experience and insights to help elevate the quality of our work and our impact when solving problems for customers. 


If it interests you, there are also opportunities to wear hats outside of engineering - for example, anything from product development to business strategy.  


Our community

Level is bringing together talented, passionate people from diverse backgrounds. We're looking for teammates who are naturally curious and love to ask questions, even when it means challenging the established way of doing things. We foster a work environment where every voice in the room is heard and encourage people to have a strong sense of ownership over their work. We believe in an inclusive culture where all team members can grow, contribute, and feel valued. 


Our Internship Experience

- Mentorship from day 1 to help acclimate you to the company and ensure you're set up to succeed 

- Frequent feedback on projects to help fuel growth and success 

- Ability to learn new technologies and work on projects based on your current skillset and growth goals 

- Participation in decisions that go into launching the product 

- Opportunity to work closely with a team that collectively has decades of experience in the tech industry 

- Social hour every two weeks 

- Competitive compensation 

- $100 monthly Uber Eats stipend 

- $200 home/office set-up reimbursement
Job Responsibilities:
Your role

- Learn how to design well thought-out APIs that allow members, dentists, and administrators to interact with Level in real-time 

- Work on building the data model our platform will use to organize information about members, dentists, and employers 

- Build features for our web and mobile applications so members can easily understand their benefits and access care 

- Help launch the company's first product by collaborating with the product, design, actuarial, sales, and operations teams! 


Our technologies

These are some of the technologies we use today, but they aren't a requirement. Many successful members of our team learned them with us. During our interview process, you are free to use any language you're most comfortable with. 

- Go 

- Kubernetes 

- Bazel 

- Protobuf / gRPC 

- AWS 

- MySQL 

- ElasticSearch 

- React / React Native 

- Typescript
Required Skills:
- Completed CS projects before and are comfortable discussing them 

- Experience with one server-side language (Go, Java, Python, etc.) or client-side language (e.g. Android, iOS, React, Ember, Angular, Vue, Javascript, Typescript, Swift, Objective-C, Java, Kotlin, etc.)

Job Summary:
Our purpose is sustaining energy and water for life, and it is demonstrated in everything we do as a business, and as an employee team. 


Algonquin Power & Utilities Corp. is a growing renewable energy and utility company with over $15 billion of assets across North America and internationally. 

  

For more than 30 years, Algonquin has demonstrated an unwavering commitment to delivering clean energy and water solutions. Our rapid growth has led both our regulated utility services and renewable energy business groups into different geographies and commodities, but our purpose remains unchanged: Sustaining Energy and Water for Life. 


Through our operating business (Liberty), we provide regulated electricity, water, and natural gas utility services to over 1 million customer connections, primarily in North America. And, our growing portfolio of clean, renewable wind, solar, hydro and thermal power generation facilities represent over 3 GW of renewable generation capacity in operation and under construction. 


With our robust, diversified, and growing presence in communities across North America and internationally, we are continually demonstrating our "Think Global,  Act Local" business model.
Job Responsibilities:
Purpose
 

To support the Transformation team with projects associated with the Customer First Program.

Accountabilities

 

Conduct regulatory research and scan the market for information on public filings
Conducts due diligence regulatory research on industry issues, emerging rules, and regulatory precedent 
Assists team in addressing how these issues may affect regulatory processes 
Supports the preparation of regulatory documents, testimony, and other filings before the Commissions
Assist in running ROIs for marketing programs.  
Assist in the implementation and development of communication strategies for various projects 
Stay up to date on industry trends and make recommendations for adjustments to communications strategies and practices 
Assist with maintaining onboarding processes 
Create reports, project documents and conduct analysis on best in class technologies 
Assist in the compilation of data
Ability to deliver quality work across multiple concurrent assignments with different work streams and meeting deadlines
Present written and verbal data analysis
React to changes in work assignments; prioritize and undertake all other tasks as assigned
Required Skills:
Education and Experience
 

1st year Business student attending College or University with a focus on Accounting, Finance, Mathematics or equivalent program
Must have strong experience with Microsoft Office Programs: Outlook, Word and Excel 
Must be detail oriented and possess excellent follow up skills
Strong communication, interpersonal and team-building skills
Excellent organizational skills with ability to work independently and manage priorities

Job Summary:
Our purpose is sustaining energy and water for life, and it is demonstrated in everything we do as a business, and as an employee team. 


Algonquin Power & Utilities Corp. is a growing renewable energy and utility company with over $15 billion of assets across North America and internationally. 

  

For more than 30 years, Algonquin has demonstrated an unwavering commitment to delivering clean energy and water solutions. Our rapid growth has led both our regulated utility services and renewable energy business groups into different geographies and commodities, but our purpose remains unchanged: Sustaining Energy and Water for Life. 


Through our operating business (Liberty), we provide regulated electricity, water, and natural gas utility services to over 1 million customer connections, primarily in North America. And, our growing portfolio of clean, renewable wind, solar, hydro and thermal power generation facilities represent over 3 GW of renewable generation capacity in operation and under construction. 


With our robust, diversified, and growing presence in communities across North America and internationally, we are continually demonstrating our "Think Global,  Act Local" business model.
Job Responsibilities:
Purpose
 

This position is focused on raising capital to finance infrastructure and renewable power projects. This includes arranging project financing, construction loans and other forms of non-recourse financing in support of the company's development strategy. The incumbent will play a role in all aspects of the financing process including: going to market to raise financing, negotiation terms, documentation of transaction, due diligence process, final closing of financing, drawing down funds and repayment of debt facilities.

  

Accountabilities
 

Work closely with senior level members of the Project Finance Team (Director and Senior Manager) in a high-profile role sought at supporting Algonquin's strategic growth through active participation in the capital markets.
Role in all aspects of the project finance and tax equity raise process including: market eminence, soliciting initial lender interest, soliciting indicative term sheets, obtaining signed mandate letters, due diligence, financial close, drawing down debt facilities, lender reporting, troubleshooting issues during construction / commissioning, conversion of construction debt to operating debt or the repayment of debt facilities on maturity.
Assist the Project Finance Team in preparing for negotiations with financing parties through all deal phases ensuring the best possible terms for Algonquin.
Responsibilities connected to supporting aspects of the financing process including the management of due diligence. Expedite and coordinate efforts of the various Algonquin contributors, ensuring due diligence and funding achievements are met.
Support the Project Finance Team's work with internal and external legal counsel for drafting, editing and finalizing financing agreements.
Partner with Algonquin's Business Development team to ensure partnership and bilateral support of the overall company's development strategy.
Support the Project Finance team to establish standard and repeatable work processes for sourcing and executing on Project and Tax Equity financings.
Day to day execution of Project Finance Tasks, including but not limited to: getting projects to a bankable state, taking projects to market to raise financing, financial modeling, maintaining data rooms, updating due diligence logs, market intelligence, planning conference attendance, updating reporting dashboards and other tasks in support of the project financing team
Required Skills:
Currently enrolled in College or University within Business with a focus on Finance, Accounting or Economics as well as Mathematics Statistics or Actuarial Science degree. Preference to a 3rd or 4th year Undergrad or MBA.
Working towards a finance designation is an asset (i.e. CFA, CSC, CPA etc.)

Job Summary:
Our purpose is sustaining energy and water for life, and it is demonstrated in everything we do as a business, and as an employee team. 


Algonquin Power & Utilities Corp. is a growing renewable energy and utility company with over $15 billion of assets across North America and internationally. 

  

For more than 30 years, Algonquin has demonstrated an unwavering commitment to delivering clean energy and water solutions. Our rapid growth has led both our regulated utility services and renewable energy business groups into different geographies and commodities, but our purpose remains unchanged: Sustaining Energy and Water for Life. 


Through our operating business (Liberty), we provide regulated electricity, water, and natural gas utility services to over 1 million customer connections, primarily in North America. And, our growing portfolio of clean, renewable wind, solar, hydro and thermal power generation facilities represent over 3 GW of renewable generation capacity in operation and under construction. 


With our robust, diversified, and growing presence in communities across North America and internationally, we are continually demonstrating our "Think Global,  Act Local" business model.
Job Responsibilities:
Purpose:

This co-op position will assist and support all team members of the Environmental Planning and Permitting Team in duties related to project management, permitting, GIS and land acquisition administration related to ongoing Wind and Solar development projects. 

  

Accountabilities:

Project Management:
 

Support Environmental Planners, Land and Stakeholder and GIS Technologist in actions and activities related to Wind and Solar development projects.
Assist in the edit, format and quality control of documents
Attend planning team meetings, assist in project documentation and in activity follow-ups

Permitting:

 

Support Environmental Planners in the development, submission and review of environmental permit submissions
Support activities related to open houses and public hearings

GIS:

 

Support by creating, editing, and producing maps for a variety of functions using ESRI's ArcGIS
Maintain geographic data and filing structure for incoming data, seek out new open data sources on an as-needed basis

Land Acquisition:

 

Support and assist Development Specialist in the administration/documentation of land leases/easements of current wind or solar development projects.
Required Skills:
Education and Experience
 

2nd to 4th year University Student with a program focus in GIS, Geomatics, Environmental Sciences or Environmental Planning
Strong working knowledge of ESRI's ArcGIS 10.6 and AutoCAD
Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office Applications
Knowledge of project management principles a definite asset
Great teammate with good social skills that values communication, collaboration and coordination
Ability to work within a fast pace working environment and to changing priorities

Lifion is ADP's next generation platform, being built from ground up on cutting edge technology. Based in Chelsea, Manhattan, more than 95% of us are new hires - many from enterprenurial backgrounds. We have several Waterloo alumni currently working at Lifion. 


Our Software Engineers get to work with the most progressive technologies in the business.  We utilize Javascript with React on the front-end and Node.js on the back, Docker containers, Scala and more. If you are the kind of person who thrives in a challenging environment and has creative expertise and a thirst for pushing the limits, we are interested in you! 


Our scrum teams are comprised of Software Engineers who get a thrill out of setting up test frameworks and thrives on quality code. If that's you, let us know and you can take the lead.
Job Responsibilities:
Deliver highly automated, intelligent and predictive solutions for our client offerings
Responsible for building out the core frameworks of the metadata-driven platform being developed in-house, including building out the Source Control
Management piece that will allow application developers to have their own isolated development environments
Deliver innovative solutions to drive next generation user experiences, designs and technologies
Responsible for ensuring the successful transition to a Service Oriented Architecture framework with the help of containers
Spearhead POC's on the latest technologies and help Lifion by ADP move even faster
Choose the right tool for the right job
Required Skills:
Minimum Qualifications

Completed at least 4 previous co-op work terms
Knowledge of one of the JavaScript frameworks such as Angular.js, Backbone.js, Ember.js or React
Experience with OOP technologies like Java and C#
Must have had exposure to browser technologies like: JavaScript, CSS3, HTML5
Knowledge of agile development methodology
Strong knowledge of data structures, algorithms and run-time optimization
Strong OOP principles, knowledge of various languages such as C#, Java, C++, Ruby on rails, Python 

Preferred Qualifications

Graduating Spring or Summer 2022
In depth and proven full stack enterprise experience with at least one major web development stack, preferably a progressive stack like JavaScript, CSS3, HTML5
Technical knowledge of RDBMS or NoSQL
Experience with React and Node.js
Experience with Test Driven Development (TDD)
Knowledge of Continuous Integration & Delivery methodologies

Job Summary:
Winter 2022 term will be virtual

Job Summary:


At Lifion, we are building ADP's next generation platform, from the ground up, on cutting edge technologies. Over 95% of us are new hires, many from entrepreneurial backgrounds. We have several Waterloo alumni. We are looking for engineers interested in building the next generation platform for human capital management software; "what Salesforce did for CRM, we're doing for HCM." 


The Reliability (DevOps and SRE) teams at Lifion are tasked with provisioning and hosting environments for our microservice architecture. We manage infrastructure complexity through code, we deploy microservices as containers, and we help developers integrate with cloud native solutions. We also provide tools to monitor and observe our platform in production. 


You are passionate about automation, but you know when human intervention is the safer choice. You think in terms of infrastructure as code, immutable infrastructure, and continuous delivery and deployments. You have experience building and deploying containerized applications (we use Docker). You love collecting and analyzing metrics, and you're good at debugging application issues. You have experience building automated, elastic, cloud-orchestrated platforms on IaaS providers like AWS, GCP, or Azure. 


Winter 2022 term will be virtual
Job Responsibilities:
- Design and implement tools to improve the reliability and efficiency of Lifion infrastructure and container platform. 

- Automate infrastructure and configuration management. 

- Consult in system design to meet reliability and capacity requirements. 

- Run software performance analysis and system tuning. 

- Conduct timely post-mortems of production incidents. 

- Implement new deployment and monitoring features; for example, canary deployments and Prometheus
Required Skills:
- Completed at least 3 previous co-op work terms. 

- Experience using Docker and container orchestration technologies like Docker Swarm, Kubernetes, Nomad or Mesos. 

- Experience with Linux system administration. 

- Experience developing and monitoring distributed systems. 

- Experience with continuous integration and continuous deployment tools. 

- Knowledge of Ansible, Terraform, or other centralized configuration management tools. 

- Fluency in one or more languages, such as Python, Go, JavaScript, Ruby, Bash, and Java. 

- Systematic problem solving approach. 

- Strong communication skills. 

- Strong sense of ownership, and an ability to drive tasks to completion.

Targeted Clusters

				- Theme - Computing: Information Systems

Job Summary:
Virtual co-op term


We are looking for an incredibly bright Machine Learning Engineer (intern) to join our growing Platform Machine Learning team. 

  

If you have passion, strong CS fundamentals, and hands-on experience solving real-world business challenges using machine learning, and want to make a huge positive impact in people's lives around the world, then this is a great opportunity for you. 

  

The role involves application of machine learning and other related techniques in areas of natural language processing, predictions and recommendations to improve user experiences and decision making, customer service, security, image recognition and retrieval, and more. If you are the kind of person who thrives in a challenging environment and has creative expertise and a thirst for pushing the limits, we are interested in you! 

  

Our platform teams are comprised of talented Researchers and Engineers who get a thrill out of solving hard problems, working in a full stack environment, delivering quality code at scale, and enhancing performance and functionality. If this is you, let us know and you can be a part of it.
Job Responsibilities:
Responsibilities

Design, build, and train highly scalable custom models and evaluate model performance
Adapt standard machine learning methods to apply to our use cases and to best exploit modern parallel environments
Help the team deploy production ready models to customers, to learn from customer feedback and make frequent model improvements
Contribute to the overall architecture and implementation of our ML infrastructure, data pipelines, inference engine(s), APIs, and products
Collaborate with our engineering and product teams to understand their machine learning related needs and to provide guidance and support where necessary
Participate in functional, technical, and code reviews
Work in an Agile environment
Required Skills:
Minimum Qualifications

Currently has or is in the process of obtaining a Masters or PhD degree or completing a postdoctoral assignment in the field of Machine Learning or similar
Research and/or work experience in machine learning, NLP, recommendation systems, pattern recognition, signal processing, data mining, artificial intelligence, information retrieval or computer vision
Experience in systems software or algorithms
Knowledge in Python, including experience in developing data-intensive software in Python using pandas
Demonstrated software engineer experience such as via previous internships, work experience, coding competitions, or used contributions in open source repositories (e.g. GitHub)

Preferred Qualifications

Experience in applying machine learning to large datasets and applications
Demonstrated knowledge and ability working with AWS, Google Cloud, or other cloud-based solutions to train models, set up data pipelines, and set up inference engines
Experience in microservices, Kubernetes, Docker, or other containerizers
Working knowledge of Node.js, JavaScript, and related technologies and frameworks
Knowledge of Continuous Integration & Delivery methodologies
Excellent problem-solving skills especially debugging of complex software systems
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
A passion for applying latest technologies into the development of innovative features and products
A collaborative attitude and demonstrated team-working ability
Self-motivated with a strong passion for learning

Job Summary:
Virtual co-op term


At Lifion by ADP, we are building a world class development platform that is used everyday by developers and designers to build our next-generation solution for HR products. It's an awesome product to empower people to build awesome products! Join our dedicated Development Platform Tools UX team and help empower developers with your work everyday. The right candidate loves building powerful tools, creating usable and intuitive structures, and working with engineers and product owners to ship quality dev tools every sprint. 


This role is for you if you:

- Love solving complex design challenges for expert technical users, empowering designers and developers to make great products.   

- Enjoy collaborating with product and technology to give the best experience for developers using our platform. 

- Are passionate about systematic design and sharing fundamental design knowledge to stakeholders.
Job Responsibilities:
Responsibilities:

- Create product designs for sophisticated development tools, from fundamental interaction design to detailed UI refinement.  

- Follow patterns and systems for complex layout, interaction, and visual design solutions, to make sure user experience across different tools are consistent. 

- Build prototypes for products and reusable user interface components. 

- Work with other designers, developers, and product owners across the company to define best practices and guidelines. Be an ambassador for great product design in our developer tools.  

- Conduct user research and usability testing with our developer users to help the cross-functional team better understand their needs and work process. 

- Stay up-to-date on the latest user experience and front-end development trends, and facilitate the development UI/UX guidelines for other UX designers to use.
Required Skills:
Qualifications:

- Ability to work hand-in-hand with product team members on requirements and design.  

- You've shipped product: you know the challenges (and rewards!) of release cycles and how to partner across the organization at every stage, shipping quickly and at the highest level of quality 

- Have moderate and/or lead user research, both generative and evaluative.  

- Experience building functional prototypes (experience with HTML, CSS, SASS, Javascript or Git a plus!) 

- A design portfolio with well thought out interactions and visuals across web/native applications.  

- Pixel-perfect hands-on design experience 


A Huge Plus If:

- Have used products for building other products: a low-code dev tool, IDE,  or other kind of highly-technical software tool.  

- Experience as a developer or programmer is a major plus, as your users will be technologists using complex development tools. 

- Experience using real user data and analytics to inform smarter UX design decisions

Job Summary: Lincoln Electric Canada is seeking a Robotics Software Engineer CoOp with a passion for building world-class products and a desire to change the way Industrial Robotics are programmed outside the traditional production process. We are a fast-moving group tasked with delivering cross-platform integrated Offline Robotic Programming experiences that will define the future of automated robotic fabrication. Our solutions are a suite of transformative technologies which enables the industrial robots to do more with less human input. We are looking for a Robotics Software Engineer CoOp who is excited to join our team of engineers who will develop new techniques to solve some of the most interesting challenges within Industrial robotics.
Job Responsibilities:
Work as part of a small team in a start-up environment with the benefits of working for a multi-national organization.
Implement underlying robotics algorithms, such as planners, motion control, and perception, to improve robustness and autonomy.
Design, integrate, test, deploy, and maintain new software to facilitate the robotic functionality and interactions that perform various industrial fabrication tasks such as welding, cutting, and additive manufacturing.
You will work alongside systems and hardware engineering teams to integrate software into robotic systems and subsystems
The successful candidate for this role for this role will work with a multidisciplinary team to design motion planning software that will aid in delivering programming efficiencies within real-world industrial robotic solutions. 
Design, develop, implement and test new cutting-edge algorithms related to path planning and navigation for industrial robotic systems
The successful candidate for this role will aid in the design of solutions that will automate industrial robot arm control, toolpath planning, multi-robot collaboration, force control, and industrial robot calibration.
Required Skills:
Enrollment in computer science, computer/electrical/mechanical engineering or other related programs
Software Engineering skills in software design, programming (C or C++, Python), and debugging.
Experiance with 3D CAD solutions including SolidWorks, AutoCAD or Creo.
Experience with C# in a desktop environment (MS .NET, WPF, etc.)
Experience with collaboration and continuous integration tools (Azure, Microsoft TFS/DevOps, GitLab, etc.)
Experience as a hands-on software development engineer working on automation, robotics and/or electromechanical systems.
Understanding of motion control and programming to interface with motion control.
Understanding of the Robot Operating System (ROS)
Understanding of robot kinematics and trajectory planning is desirable

Targeted Clusters

				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

Job Summary:
Linxus Group partners with leading businesses to deliver industry leading recruitment solutions to enhance performance and for a successful business strategy. 

  

As Marketing Assistant for Linxus Group, you will be responsible for the branding of our business.  You will work across all areas of the business, from developing our "why" with the Senior Team, to coordinating marketing and community events with local teams and branches. Although you will be given specific goals, Linxus Group takes pride in not following the crowd, our focus is to create a great business by understanding that our team makes our business great.  We understand that your performance should not be limited to the opportunities you are given. we encourage everyone to own their roles and take them where they want.
Job Responsibilities:
We encourage you to make the job yours - create what you want!  However, here are some pointers that can help to get your creativity flowing:
 

Create and develop the Linxus Group brand.
Work with the Senior Team to create our "why".
Identify media channels and effectively broadcast Linxus Group to prospective new clients.
Create the plan on Corporate Social Responsibility.
Roll-out the new Linxus Brand across the business.  Aligning all internal and external points (email, letterheads, resume templates, on-boarding, and presentations).
Work with the business to input on the development of the new website.
Conduct market research.
Create original content.
Identify USPs vs. competitors.
Engage with clients and candidates (RFF).
Develop, execute, and monitor marketing campaigns.
Required Skills:
There are no "required skills" YOU are the skill, these are some pointers that could suit the role:

 

Creativity!
Strong written and verbal communicator.
The ability to communicate effectively across all marketing functions and communicate back to key functional stakeholders.
A winning, team oriented, passionate attitude.
Selling the big picture.
The ability to link your ideas to business performance opportunities.
Enthusiasm and a passion to grow our/your brand.
Great listening skills.
A natural salesperson.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Marketing and Communication 
				
			
				AHS - Recreation and Leisure Studies
				
			
				ARTS - Business
				
			
				ARTS - English Language and Literature
				
			
				ARTS - Social Sciences

Job Summary:
Lipton LLP

At Lipton LLP, we are guided by a simple vision: to be the CPA, CA firm of choice for privately-owned businesses and entrepreneurial individuals through excellent and personalized business advisory services by seeking new opportunities to positively impact our clients. 

  

Our team is united under one common purpose: to forge deep connections with our clients allowing us to build trusting and productive relationships that create lasting value. Our commitment is to build more effective client relationships, where we can bring together ideas, people and skills to create even better value for each of our clients - helping them achieve their true financial potential. 


Lipton offers a CPA Ontario pre-approved Practical Experience Requirement as part of the CPA Certification Program.
Job Responsibilities:
JOB DESCRIPTION

Using the technical knowledge that you have acquired through your accounting and tax courses, you will carry out a variety of work projects and assignments under the direct supervision of a Manager and other experienced team members. The successful candidate will learn the Lipton practices and methodologies in order to carry out tasks associated with audits, reviews, compilations and the preparation of tax returns. 


Duties & Responsibilities

- Gain a practical understanding of basic accounting procedures 

- Participate in audit, review and compilation engagements and draft related working papers 

- Prepare Notice to Reader statements to accompany financial statements 

- Process journal entries and perform reconciliations 

- Prepare personal tax returns and corporate tax returns 

- Work closely with other staff at varying levels from Staff Accountant to Partner 

- Engage with clients, as needed, to gather required information to complete assigned tasks
Required Skills:
Requirements


- Post-Secondary Degree/Diploma (in progress); focus in Accounting or Business Administration 

- Working towards prerequisites for admission into Professional Education Program (PEP) 

- Enrollment in the Co-op program at your post-secondary institution 

- A desire to provide outstanding client service and a commitment to teamwork 

- Proven leadership skills 

- Excellent verbal and written communication skills 

- Superior attention to detail, as well as a need for accuracy 

- Experience working CaseWare, Profile, Quickbooks and Simply Accounting is an asset
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Accounting and Financial Auditing
				
			
				- Theme - Finance and Investment 
				
			
				ARTS/MATH - Finance
				
			
				ARTS/MATH/SCI - Chartered Professional Accounting
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary: Under the general supervision of the Marketing Coordinator, the Marketing Assistant will assist in the development and maintenance of marketing communication materials, including online content.  These responsibilities will require meeting with internal customers, completing data analysis (Google Analytics), preparing news items for publication, and assisting with the creation of internal and external company presentations.
Job Responsibilities:
Create and update marketing items, website and intranet information for the products and company news.
Assist with research, development, writing and editing of content for both print and digital communications. Copywriting, proofreading, and design presentations and news. (LENS Articles, Litens' website, presentations, and reports). 
Assist with marketing material production: initial supplier screening, gathering quotations and coordinating samples from vendors. (web, illustrations, videos, animations, print materials, banners, giveaways).
Analyze data to identify opportunities to improve marketing actions (Google Analytics, LENS access report, Job fairs, Marketing Activities Reviews, etc.).
Helping with shipping and receiving materials.
Assist with supplier management, e.g. setting up suppliers, creating PO orders, etc.
Assist with department budget control, e.g. updating and maintenance of budget file, reporting.
Support future actions, such as global intranet launch, Litens website improvements (SEO, Contend), and other initiatives.
Required Skills:
Must have exceptional writing skills for intranet, website, and customer presentations.

Job Summary:
We're Canada's largest 100% paperless & online Chartered Accounting firm.

That's right, there's no office.
This posting is not location-specific and is open to any candidate across Canada. 


About Us

LiveCA LLP is Canada's largest online Chartered Professional Accounting (CPA) firm serving customers in every province. We're a 80 person remote team and work closely together through online tools like Zoom and Slack. 

We're a customer service firm first and an accounting firm second. We're incredibly focused on serving our customers and what matters to us is not the cut of your suit but how you approach problems, offer solutions, and contribute to the team. We don't believe in billing by the hour (or even tracking them) and expect that everyone will contribute to providing value to our clients. 


As a Co-op Student, you'll be an essential part of our team through constant customer communication, completing full sets of accounting statements, and compliance work. 

  

Working at LiveCA

- Keep learning forever: we provide immediate feedback to ensure we're always learning from one another, encourage quarterly meet-ups for co-working and lunch, & host monthly Tax Chats and other learning opportunity calls. 

- Be treated right: we understand that the best ideas and the most refined work is completed in a respectful and collaborative environment. Negativity has no place here.   

- Remote friendly: want to head out on an adventure? Grab your laptop and head off on a workation - just make sure to take some pictures!
Job Responsibilities:
About the Role

- In this role the Co-op student will be supporting the Tax Team, assisting with T5 filings, T4 Filings, GST/HST returns, year-end corporation files and personal tax returns. 

- The Co-op student will learn to navigate in Xero and iFirm: pulling financial statements and sales tax audit reports in Xero and filing personal tax returns, T2 slips, T4 slips and T5 slips to the CRA in iFirm. 

- The ability to fine-tune your interests: while on the team you have the opportunity to have insightful discussions with other team members (including bookkeeping, payroll, accounts payable, Managers, and Partners) to help determine your specific interests.  

- In this role, you will have the support of your team but also the ability to work independently.
Required Skills:
About You

- Personable: you're personable and have great communication skills. You're writing is clear and concise, but not robotic. 

- Curious: you're a really quick learner who can figure things out on your own and easily adapt to changes. 

Accountable: you don't shy away from accountability. You like to get your hands dirty to get things done and take full responsibility to ensure the quality of your work is high and deadlines are met. 

- Independent: you're comfortable working from home. You can remain focused and diligent in an independent work environment (although we're only a Slack message away). 

- Techy: you know your way around a computer and enjoy researching and learning new applications.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Accounting and Financial Auditing
				
			
				- Theme - Finance and Investment 
				
			
				ARTS - Business
				
			
				ARTS/MATH - Finance
				
			
				ARTS/MATH/SCI - Chartered Professional Accounting
