Job Summary:
Livespot is building a new model for content creators to monetize their knowledge through interactive livestreams. Our mission is to create a world where anyone can make a living teaching their craft. Knowledge creators today are underserved by existing platforms that are focused on attention and eyeballs. The interactive experience on Livespot allows these creators to more effectively monetize their audience at scale with a better live video experience and integrated subscription payments. 

  

This internship is an opportunity to work at a fast growing startup in an exciting space. You'll be able to work on all areas of the stack, from frontend to backend to devops, that match your interests. We're an experienced team of serial entrepreneurs with past exits and veteran engineering leaders in Silicon Valley, backed by notable investors including SV Angel, Long Journey Ventures, Justin Kan, Kevin Hartz (Founder of Eventbrite) and Anish Acharya (Partner at Andreessen Horowitz). 


We are based in San Francisco. Due to travel restrictions from the University of Waterloo, this position will be remote.
Job Responsibilities:
You will develop new full-stack features for creators and participants. The ideal candidate for this role should be comfortable translating product requirements to technical implementation, researching and prototyping new technologies, and actively participating in technical discussions. You'll work with practical tools that help startups move fast and be intimately involved in decisions we make as a team. 

  

Our stack is React with Next.js and Relay (web), Hasura and Node.js (backend), Postgres (database), WebRTC (live video), and AWS (S3, EC2, and others).
Required Skills:
- Experience with developing web applications 

 - Interest in early stage startups 

 - Familiarity with Javascript is a plus

Job Summary:
Why Localintel:

Localintel is a pioneer in creating data-driven location marketing SaaS products for communities. We have played a major role in helping hundreds of organizations across North America promote their community's advantages, assist local businesses, and monitor trends. For additional information please visit: www.ecdev.org


If you are looking for challenge, an opportunity to be the driver of your own career and the chance to grow with an awesome team, we would love to hear from you! 


The role:

As a part of our engineering team, you will be working with a team of friendly and dedicated engineers to develop innovative location intelligence solutions. Your most valuable skill is the ability to learn, closely followed by the ability to know when you don't know something. You're willing to have a go at anything, but also acknowledge when you need help from a specialist on the team. Finally, you believe in working efficiently and collaboratively to deliver products with the WOW factor!  


Our Technology Stack:

C#, .net Core, Angular, Python, PostgreSQL, Microsoft Azure, MS SQLServer, MongoDB, Solr, Node.js, Typescript, Vector Maps, Docker, QGIS, Tensorflow and several other cutting-edge libraries and frameworks.

Engagement and exposure to full software development lifecycle
Develop APIs and SDKs for our services and products

Solid Knowledge of SQL and/or NoSQL databases
Solid foundation in data structures with strong analytical and debugging skills
Hands-on experience with multiple trending web technologies, libraries, frameworks, and APIs
Familiar with the Unix/Linux Environment
Hands-on experience with one or more scripting languages
Ability to write reusable and maintainable code
Track record of contribution to open-source projects and tech forums (e.g. GitHub, Stack Overflow)

Job Summary:
LocalStudent is a new technology startup that was created by students, for students.


We are changing the way that students work in the 21st century. 


Our app allows customers to hire students for on-demand services, with the click of a button. We're like Uber for student services. Our startup is quickly growing and people are starting to take notice, as we have been featured on CTV, Toronto Star, blogTO, Narcity and Breakfast Television. Recently, 14,000+ students have signed up on our platform. 


This position is ideal for someone who would like to take their soft skills to the next level. By the end of this co-op term, you will become a better communicator and problem solver. You will also learn a diverse set of skills, as you'll be assisting in sales, marketing, hiring, business development, strategy and more. 


Why join our team?

We value your learning and growth. Our #1 goal is to make sure that you learn as much as possible and gain new skills during your time working with us.
Our team is made up of 100% university students. We are very ambitious and we have a fun and very passionate culture.
Build your network and make connections with like-minded, entrepreneurial students.
We offer a flexible schedule and lots of autonomy.
Make your impact. Help us change the way that students work in the 21st century
Job Responsibilities:
So, what exactly will you be doing at LocalStudent? In this position, you will be wearing many hats and working many different roles. This position will entail responsibilities such as:

 

Assist the marketing team to generate leads (using Google ads, social media, etc.)
Help to manage our expected team of 100+ student contractors.
Provide exceptional customer service on a daily basis.
Assist with recruitment and hiring when necessary.
Help to promote a company culture that encourages top performance and high morale.
Assist the sales team when closing sales.
Collaborate with the team to make important strategy and planning decisions.
Required Skills:
Excellent communication skills.
Ability to work in a fast paced environment.
Effective conflict resolution skills.
Ability to work effectively under time constraints/pressure.
Very good time management skills.
Excellent collaboration skills.

Job Summary: Long View Systems is looking for a passionate and dynamic Business Systems Analyst for our Toronto office who will deliver consultative services directly to your clients and build relationships with our stakeholders and project teams!
Job Responsibilities:
A Day in the Life: 

Elicit, capture, and complete analysis on Business Needs Requirements to ensure that the requirements can be effectively placed in appropriate categories supporting Cloud, Security, End User, Business and Digital transformation solutions
Engage in and Lead Business Process Reengineering workshops to understand current state, develop roadmap to current state and develop detail steps to achieve future state
Ability to differentiate between Business Rules and Requirements to ensure clarity of business rules and requirements in solicitation sessions and all documentation
Ensure requirements traceability and requirements status throughout the full project lifecycle.
Manage changes to baselined requirements through effective application of change control processes and tools.
Establish and implement effective requirements practices, including use and continuous improvement of a requirements process.
Implement ways to reuse requirements across projects
Ensure requirement statements are complete, consistent, concise, comprehensible, traceable, feasible, unambiguous, and verifiable.
Participate in peer reviews and inspections of requirements documents. Participate in peer reviews of work products derived from requirements specifications to ensure that the requirements were interpreted correctly
Ensure satisfactory transfer of all deliverables to project owner(s) upon project completion
Required Skills:
What You Bring: 

Elicitation skills, and importantly listening skills to understand the client requirements
Analytical skills, to critically evaluate the information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a more general understanding, distinguish presented user requests from the underlying true needs, and distinguish solution ideas from requirements
An understanding of contemporary requirements elicitation, analysis, specification, verification, and management practices and the ability to apply them in practice
Experience with and knowledge of current SDLC best practices
Experience and exposure to cloud environments including Azure, AWS, and GCP
Understanding of building infrastructure as code in the cloud
Familiarity with IT architecture principles, such as TOGAF and other industry frameworks
Observational skills, to validate data obtained via other techniques and expose new areas for elicitation
Writing skills, to communicate information effectively to clients, marketing, managers, and technical staff
Interpersonal skills, to help negotiate priorities and to resolve conflicts among project stakeholders (such as clients, management, and engineering)
Analyze business processes used within and between lines of business and recommend technology or process changes that would eliminate unnecessary processes, improve department efficiency and effectiveness, and improve information flow
Modeling skills, to represent requirements information in graphical forms that augment textual representations in natural language

What Makes You Extra Awesome: 

Appetite to pursue Business Systems Analysis Certifications (ECBA, ECBA+, CCBA, CBAP)

Job Summary:
A&I Analyst, Co-Op
 
The AIR MILES Rewards Program has earned the trust and support of more than two-thirds of Canadian households. For over two decades, we have helped our Partners use Canada's most widely accepted loyalty currency, AIR MILES® reward miles, to influence customer behavior, drive profitability, and build long-term relationships. 
 
Benefits and Perks at AIR MILES:
 

COVID-19 Work-from-Home safety response
Annual Wellness Subsidy


Loyalty Days and Anniversary Air Miles
Recognized as Canada's Top Employer
Extensive Learning and Development Tools and Programs
Flexible Work Arrangements
Tuition Reimbursement
Summer Hours Program
AIR MILES Gold® Collector
Group RRSPs & Company match
Wellness Resources including Cognitive Behavioural Therapy

There's a reason we're recognized as one of the best places to work year after year: We give you more than a place to work, we give you a place to grow your career. That's what sets us apart.
 
What Will You Work On?
 
Working with and in support of Sponsor and Channel Marketing, the A&I Analyst (Co-op) will develop actionable insights and recommendations for marketing strategies. This position entails leveraging Air Miles consumer collector data and utilizing Business Intelligence (BI) software to interpret and extract strategies regarding consumer behavior.
 
How Will You Create Impact?

Job Summary:
About LRK Tax LLP
We are a boutique full-service Chartered Professional Accountancy (CPA) firm with a focus on Canadian and U.S. tax. Our partners were former directors and senior managers at top international accounting firms, including the Big 4. Combining our experiences and our entrepreneurial passion, we started LRK Tax to provide clients with big firm expertise with small firm agility and service in a laid-back, staff-friendly, technologically-driven culture.
Feel free to check us out at www.lrktax.ca. 


Your Role

Position: As a Staff Accountant at LRK Tax, you will embark on a journey that will provide you with opportunities to not just become a great accountant but become a trusted advisor for clients. As your career progresses at LRK Tax, you will have an opportunity to work with a variety of clients - including owner-managers, public companies, and high-net-worth individuals - to offer tax, accounting, and business advisory services uniquely. 


Term length: Co-op employment position. 


Salary: Compensation is very competitive. 


Office Location: Kitchener, Ontario. 


Why Us?

Cutting Edge & Innovative 

We are an accounting firm built for the modern world. We are cloud-based. We make accounting and tax simple for clients. At LRK tax, you will stay current with the latest technical developments, tools and technologies to equip you to become an accountant and tax professional in the 21st century. This has allowed us to be at the forefront in responding to technical and technological change. 


We Take Pride in Teaching You
As the old saying goes, give a person a fish and you feed them for a day. Teach them how to fish and you feed them for their lifetime.  Our partners take pride in teaching you to become the best version of yourself:

We started HTKAcademy.com (formerly, HTK Consulting) and as a result, have helped thousands of aspiring and practicing CPAs across Canada with their professional development.
We are involved with teaching accounting and tax at leading Canadian universities and with CPA Canada.
We are frequent contributors to industry-leading newsletters and have won awards.

We are committed to your professional development via world-class training:

 

Support you with pursuing the CPA Designation (This position does not require you to pursue the CPA designation, however we support those who are interested.)
You will participate in monthly tax and accounting technical updates; you will have an opportunity to present on developing tax news and topics.
We invest heavily in state-of-the-art tax research platforms and e-books. At LRK Tax, you will become a leading tax consultant that clients will look for valuable tax advice.
Learn directly from our partners who have a unique skillset in the area of tax consulting and advisory for private companies, public companies, and high-net-worth individuals.

Writing & Presenting Opportunities
Our partners are involved in writing and speaking engagements. We'll empower you to become the best version of yourself professionally by allowing you to also participate in these opportunities. With LRK Tax, among other things, you will have an opportunity to contribute to our monthly newsletters, Canadian Tax Foundation (CTF) publications, and other presentations.
We are a Firm for the 21st Century
We strive to be a firm of the future. With us, in addition to becoming an excellent accountant and tax professional, you will learn to keep up with the rapid change in our industry. You will master the following state-of-the-art technology:

Tax Compliance

CCH TaxPrep (Personal Tax, Corporate Tax, Trusts, Partnerships, and Forms)


Audits, Reviews & Notice to Readers

CaseWare Working Papers


Collaboration

Microsoft Teams
Jetpack Workflow
Office 365 Collaboration Tools (including Microsoft Teams)


Cloud Accounting

Xero, QuickBooks Online, FreshBooks, and Wave
Hubdoc


Tax Research Platforms

CCH Intelliconnect & Answer Connect
Thomson Reuters - TaxNetPro
Canadian Tax Foundation - Tax Find
Job Responsibilities:
Your Responsibilities
Your responsibilities will include the following. If these are intimidating, don't worry! We will be with you every step of the way to coach you. Before you know it, you'll be off doing most of these by yourself.

Prepare personal tax returns (T1 Return) during the personal tax busy season (February to April), including assisting with specific administrative tasks where needed.
Prepare tax returns for corporations (T2 Return), partnerships (T5013), trusts & estates (T3 Return).
Prepare financial statements (notice to reader engagements).
Bookkeeping & Accounting using the latest and greatest cloud accounting applications (see below).
Prepare public company deferred tax computations for financial reporting purposes.
Research tax issues by consulting CRA interpretations, tax publications, research platforms, and the Income Tax Act.
Prepare tax research memos to solve uncertain tax problems including corporate reorganizations and estate planning.
Correspond with Canada Revenue Agency via letter and over the phone.
Work with clients directly, over the phone, or email on audit, review, notice to reader, and tax engagements.
Contribute to tax newsletters or blogs that we publish. 
Work with excel models to map out the tax implications of tax reorganizations.
Participate and present in monthly tax technical meetings.
Required Skills:
Who Are We Looking For?

An aspiring accountant and tax practitioner with the following skills and ambitions:
First and foremost, a strong desire and enthusiasm to learn and apply what you learn on real-life client files.
A solid understanding of accounting fundamentals demonstrated by excellent grades in accounting courses.
Solid written communication. This will help you to prepare emails to clients, prepare research memos and slide presentations.
Solid verbal communication. You do not need to be a world-class speaker but should have a desire to work with clients and team members.
Strong mathematical and excel skills. 
A team player. Willingness to lend teammates a hand during the busy season.
Previous accounting experience is welcome, but not necessary.
Tech-savvy.
As long as you are enthusiastic about learning, applying what you learn, and putting in the hard work, we can help you become an excellent accounting and tax practitioner.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Accounting and Financial Auditing
				
			
				ARTS/MATH/SCI - Chartered Professional Accounting
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

It's an exciting time to join Lumentum!  Lumentum (NASDAQ: LITE) is a market-leading manufacturer of innovative optical and photonic products enabling optical networking and commercial laser customers worldwide. Lumentum's optical components and subsystems are part of virtually every type of telecom, enterprise, and data center network. Job Summary:
We are looking for an enthusiastic student to work in the Lumentum WSS Optical Alignment Automation R&D group to contribute to the development of our wavelength selective switch (WSS) products. WSS product development is inherently multidisciplinary, involving optics, MEMS, hermetics, micro-optics assembly and electronics. WSS is a cutting edge technology that is central to Lumentum's Agile Optical Network product strategy and it is these products which handle a significant portion of the world's voice and internet traffic.
                                                                   
This is an excellent opportunity to work in a multi-disciplinary environment and to learn about the product development process at Lumentum.  In this position, students will contribute to the development of processes and software relating to the advancement of WSS Optical Alignment Automation and robotics. Students will be mentored by senior engineers and together they will develop the processes, associated hardware and software to enable the targeted alignment improvements.  Students will collaborate with the Alignment Automation, Optical Design, Manufacturing Engineering and Automation Software Development teams throughout their work terms, giving them a broad overview of the many disciplines involved in the design of our products.

As a global, multi-cultural company driven by innovation, we are building a diverse and inclusive culture where differences are valued.  We are unified in our commitment to live our Guiding Principles:  Innovate, Engage, Deliver, Excel, and Win.  Our differences make us stronger, more creative, and capable of delivering better results.

Term: 4 or 8 Months

You might be interested to know:

Our team has a long history (15 years) of employing co-op students and we truly value the contributions our co-op students make to our team.  Several students have been hired upon graduation.
We are a passionate team of scientists, engineers and mathematicians who love our work and improving it each day
Most of our workforce is currently working from home during the global pandemic ? with some exceptions for lab work
We have a diverse team, many of whom hold advanced degrees, so there is a mentor here to help you grow and learn
Job Responsibilities:
Roles and Expectations:

Become familiar with Lumentum's optical alignment automation platform and manufacturing data management systems, as required
Advance the alignment platform (hardware and processes) under the mentorship of the automation team and in close partnership with the software development teams
Debug and field-test processes with end-users and other developers
Create, peer review, and release work instructions and other necessary documentation
Provide regular progress reports
Required Skills:
Recommended Education:        

3rd or 4th year: Mechatronics Engineering although candidates from other Engineering and Science disciplines would also be considered

Required Skills:                 


Good problem solving skills
Highly motivated and energetic
Excellent communication skills
Team player but can work autonomously
Any of the following would be considered a strong asset:                       
Practical experience with affixing and detaching components with adhesives
Practical experience with machine vision processes, hardware, and software
Practical experience with robotic gripper processes, hardware, and software
Practical experience with pick and place automation processes
Practical experience with the assembly and test of free-space optical systems
Practical experience with software-source and application-version control (any application).  Version control applies to process information and documentation.
Practical experience with tools to query, analyze and present data, such as Excel Pivots and Charts, JMP, Minitab, or Python.

We are looking for a student to join our Circuit Pack Product and Process Engineering team. This team is responsible for development and improvement of the manufacturing processes used to produce our most highly integrated telecom products.

In this role, you are going to help the team to optimize one or more of our key processes so that we have better product yield as the result of your work. Apply a solid knowledge of mechanical engineering and manufacturing philosophies to develop new solutions and to evaluate the merits and risks of alternative concepts.

What will you do in this role?
Lumentum is looking for a Simulation Engineer (Co-op Student) to assist with coding, optimizing, and validating the next generation simulation tool of our optical transport subsystem products. Lumentum is the leader in the optical transport subsystems market, producing industry leading products for Tier 1 network communications equipment providers. The position is in the Subsystems Product Development team which has overall ownership of all development activities for circuit packs and other highly integrated transport products.

Our products integrate optical components, electronics, software and mechanical elements which must properly mesh to create a working product.  Simulation tool development focuses on modeling optical and electronic components, tuning control algorithms, and automating design and fault detection processes using intelligent algorithms.  This is a hands-on role which will give you experience with leading edge optical communications technology.  It also gives you the opportunity to gain experience working with a multi-disciplinary product development team.

Lumentum's commercial lasers enable advanced manufacturing techniques and diverse applications including next-generation 3D sensing capabilities. Lumentum is headquartered in Milpitas, California with R&D, manufacturing, and sales offices worldwide.  For more information, visit www.Lumentum.com. Lumentum's Ottawa office is focused on Optical components and modules for Wavelength Selective Switches, Lidar and 3Dsensing applications. 

  

Lumentum welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
Job Responsibilities:
The Opportunity...

  

8 month term (preferred):            January 2022 to August 2022

4 month term:                               January 2022 to April 2022

  

What will you do in this role?

  

In this role you will be exposed to a number of state-of-the-art technologies including MEMS (Micro-Electro-Mechanical Systems), LCoS (Liquid Crystal on Silicon), DOE (diffractive optics elements). The successful student will work in a R&D environment as part of a multidisciplinary team developing optical components for current and next generation telecom and consumer 3D sensing applications. 

  

Roles and Expectations:

 
 

Development and implementation of test methods to characterize liquid crystal, MEMS, Diffractive Optics Elements and Silicon Photonics devices;
Working cross-functionally within the MEMS, LC, Diffractive optics design groups and with internal and external 'suppliers' and foundries to design components, develop processes and methods to manufacture these components for various telecom and consumer applications (Active and passive devices);
Data and root cause examination.
Running reliability and verification interval tests to monitor components' performance degradation/aging over time.
Developing scripts for automating lab equipment.
Running Optical, mechanical, or electrical simulation software tools.

Job Summary:
As an integral member of Lumibird's LIDAR team in Ottawa, the ideal candidate will support the existing LIDAR technology and the new product development, working alongside experienced staff to learn about the industry, technology and helping to address challenging and critical problems.  The incumbent will be expected to develop, verify, and test a multitude of software designs for a wide range of markets with scientific, automotive, aerospace and defense customers.
Reporting to the Senior Engineer, the Software Engineering Coop will support development of software solutions in support of ongoing Research and Development activities, new product introductions, and continuous improvement activities.  The incumbent will be involved with all phases of the software development lifecycle, including; requirements review, use-case definition, architecture creation, programming implementation, and verification / testing.  The ideal candidate will be comfortable working as part of a small, but talented, multi-disciplinary R&D team, dedicated to the development of innovative light-based solutions.
As Lumibird Canada is committed to the health and safety of its employees, and given the present nature of the ongoing pandemic, much of the work conducted by the incumbent can be completed remotely (i.e. off-site).  However, the Software Engineering Coop will be expected to be on-site at least once or twice per week to support in-lab activities, while respecting all Lumibird Canada COVID-19 policies and procedures.

This is an 8 month consecutive work term preferred.
This position is funded by the Government of Canada's Student Work Placement Program (SWPP).
Job Responsibilities:
The Software Engineering Coop will be expected to:
 

Support product design by addressing performance objectives through requirements review and the practical application of engineering principles, design procedures, and industry standards
Contribute to the definition of use cases and software specifications
Organize and complete the resulting product definition, specifications and associated documentation
Implement software solutions by studying requirements, interfacing with users, and examining systems flow, data usage, and work processes
Contribute to software development, implementation and testing for all embedded and support segments
Prepare and maintain software documentation, including flowcharts, code comments & verification plans
Support software configuration tracking, including revisions, versions and bug tracking
Improve operations by conducting systems analysis and recommending changes to policies / procedures
Cooperate with the mechanical, optical and electrical teams
Required Skills:
The incumbent must possess the following qualifications:
 

Student studying Software Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent
Experience with cross platform development with C++
Sound understanding of object-oriented design and concepts
Solid understanding of multithreading concepts
Familiarity with complex algorithm development
Experience with industry-standard version control tools (Git, Subversion, etc.)
Skilled in product design and development within an R&D environment
Highly organized, with an ability to efficiently handle multiple projects simultaneously
Excellent judgment, organizational, and problem-solving skills
Ability to analyze data, present results concisely, draw conclusions and make recommendations
Superior verbal, and written, communication skills
Strong desire to be part of a research and development team that is creating next generation LIDAR

In addition, the following qualifications would be considered an asset:

 

Experience in developing front end user software tools in Qt or similar frameworks
Advanced math and algorithm implementation experience
Experience with CMake
Experience with embedded Linux
Experience with data analysis programming tools such as MATLAB, NumPy (Python), etc.
Proficient in the development of systems and selecting parts for harsh environments, such as automotive, defense and/or aerospace
Previous LIDAR and/or vision system design experience
Experience with ISO 9001 and/or AS9100
Bilingual in French/English

Job Summary:
Lunarch is a small (<10 people, but growing significantly) Canadian game developer founded in 2013 by a group of Waterloo alumni, math olympiad champions, professional poker players, and MIT PhD students. We develop cutting-edge, intelligent games that leverage technology to create novel and deep experiences for smart players. 


We're the creators of Prismata: a multiplayer strategy game that blends elements of RTS, deckbuilders, and board games (check it out on Steam: https://store.steampowered.com/app/490220/Prismata) 


Our upcoming project (codenamed "Sophia") is a multiplayer first-person puzzle game for PC and consoles incorporating some elements of MMOs, escape rooms, and battle royale games. We're looking to hire throughout 2021 for a number of roles for the project (engineers, designers, producers, artists, etc.) and love working with talented co-op students who can add value to the project. 


Ideal candidates are highly intelligent, passionate about games, and capable of getting lots of work done quickly with new and unfamiliar tools. We use Unreal Engine so any experience with it (or similar software like Unity) is a bonus. Possible projects could include network programming, AI, graphics, procedural generation, puzzle design, maps/environments, gameplay programming, 3d modeling/animation, UI/UX, player analytics, backend dev, etc. 


Lunarch has been operating remotely since 2016 and all positions will continue to be remote for the foreseeable future. 


We can provide assistance setting up a virtual office if necessary.  A good internet connection is important.
Job Responsibilities:
Key Responsibilities:
 

Assist with the development of a high-fidelity PC/console video game
Design puzzles and other gameplay features
Contribute to the creative process of building a large open world multiplayer puzzle game
Document and fix bugs
Get a lot of work done in a remote environment

Possibly some of the following, depending on your skills and experience:

 

Gameplay programming using C++ or Unreal Blueprints
Implementing AI behaviour or procedural puzzle generation
Developing maps (terrain sculpting, foliage placement, environment art, lighting, etc.)
3D modeling or animation in Blender or Maya
UI development using UMG or Slate
Multiplayer programming in C++
Development of effects and particle systems using Cascade or Niagara
Performance optimization using debuggers and profiling tools

Applicants are not expected to be experts in everything, but they must be able to make a meaningful contribution over a short period of time.
Required Skills:
The following are a must:
 

A strong technical or artistic background (i.e. you are incredible at math, programming, or art)
Exceptional problem solving skills
Ability to rapidly learn new technologies and work in an unfamiliar codebase with unfamiliar tools
Passion for gaming

Tools we use (familiarity with these is not required, but helpful)

 

Unreal Engine for game development
Microsoft Windows and Microsoft Visual Studio or Rider for C++ development
Git for revision control
Discord for team management and communication
Amazon Web Services for cloud infrastructure

Lunarch is more like a tech startup than a traditional game studio. We're in a competitive space that rewards quickness and demands high-quality work that meets all requirements on the first try. Game industry experience is not necessary but relevant projects will help you stand out when applying. If you've made any games in the past (even small or unfinished ones), please send them to us (a short video can also be helpful). You can include links in your cover letter. We will look at them. 


We also love people who have excelled in competitions (math/programming contests, puzzlehunts, science fairs, infosec CTF, competitive gaming, poker, etc.) or people with heroic academic accomplishments (90+ grade averages, publications, awards, etc.).

Job Summary:
Lux is a space robotics company creating a predictive digital twin of the Earth's surface using a high-altitude platform consisting of long-endurance stratospheric balloons. Using the data collected, useful insights are produced using machine learning allowing for predictive analysis and insight.  


We are seeking two Mechanical Engineering Interns to help drive our design, analysis, testing, and deployment work. In this role, you will join our innovation team, managing projects from concept to completion. From day one, our engineers step away from the desk and have the chance to work hands-on to develop, test industry-leading solutions for our clients-both nationally and internationally. Our ideal candidate is an independent and driven individual who shares our passion for space and solving some of the world's most pressing issues through technology.
Job Responsibilities:
Design of mechanical parts, mechanisms, and systems for high-altitude balloons 
Validation and optimization of design through FEA and hand calculations using principles of solid mechanics, heat transfer, and fluid dynamics 
Integration of sensors, antennas, cameras, and other hardware alongside our electrical and software engineers to ensure optimal performance during launch, operation, and recovery of our payloads
Develop and execute testing of prototypes for aerospace conditions
Assist in the maintenance of documentation on the system in adherence to local high altitude ballooning standard
Lead vehicle build and assembly testing for upcoming launches  
Coordinate with local and international suppliers to order and integrate both custom and off-the-shelf components
Assist in flight operations including launch protocols, execution, and recovery
Required Skills:
Required Skills and Qualifications:

Working towards a bachelor's degree in mechanical, aerospace, industrial, mechatronics engineering or related field
Previous internship or student team experience in mechanical engineering design
Proven track record of project completion from design to deployment 
Strong 3D and 2D CAD experience (SolidWorks preferred)
Hands-on experience in prototyping, machining, and physical assembly
Familiarity with FEA and other analytical tools (MATLAB, Excel, etc)
Knowledge of aerospace concepts and ability to apply them to design efforts
Strong interdisciplinary communication skills 
Effective in remote work
Supplier relations and supply chain management experience 
Capable of quickly root-causing problems and iterating through rapid changes
Test preparation, execution, and evaluation experience


Bonus Skills or Qualifications
 

Strong FEA experience (thermal, structural, dynamic, etc.)
Experience in project management and leading technical teams
Hardware integration and electronics thermal analysis
Mechatronics experience in automating mechanisms

				- Theme - Project and Process Management
				
			
				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering

Job Summary:
Lystek International is an organic materials recovery technology company that is helping municipalities and other generators world-wide optimize resource recovery and reduce greenhouse gas emissions through its innovative approach to biosolids and organics management. The multi-use Lystek thermal hydrolysis technology can be leveraged to optimize anaerobic digesters and biological nutrient removal systems while also contributing to waste diversion and environmental sustainability. This is achieved by transforming non-hazardous, organic materials into nutrient-rich, federally-registered fertilizers and other multi-purpose products. 


Lystek is seeking a co-op student with an interest in resource recovery and commercial scale project development to join a fast-paced, dynamic team. This role will focus on assisting activities in pursuit of new full-scale deployments of the Lystek technologies and their applications as well as support for the design, installation, and commissioning of these solutions. It is expected that the candidate will spend the majority of their time in the Lystek office and in-house Laboratory, located in Cambridge, ON, with some time allotted for site visits to customer wastewater treatment plants and Lystek managed facilities. 


The ideal applicant will have an interest in:
 

Project management and system design
Interdisciplinary business and technical communications with the ability to assess facility challenges, collaborate on proposed solutions, and provide technical writing support throughout the facility assessment, solution proposal, and project implementation stages.
Job Responsibilities: This role will focus on assisting activities in pursuit of new full-scale deployments of the Lystek technologies and their applications as well as support for the design, installation, and commissioning of these solutions.
Required Skills:
Requirements:
 

G2 License with their own vehicle (required for occasional site visits)
Registered in one of the following or related programs: Environmental Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, and Environmental Sciences.
Excellent written and interpersonal communication skills
Detail-oriented self-starter

Organization: M E Andrews and Associates Limited
Job Summary: Andrews.engineer (A.E) is a consulting engineering firm specializing in municipal infrastructure. We are a growing firm with focused expertise in the inspection, condition assessment, and rehabilitation planning of local and large diameter trunk sanitary and storm sewers. Our projects involve the development and implementation of innovative inspection and assessment techniques for live sewers ranging in diameter from 150mm to 3050mm, and with access chambers up to 45m deep. We also work closely with other specialist firms and contractors, as needed, to complete various specialized tasks.
Job Responsibilities:
Andrews.engineer has compiled several in-house condition assessment databases which are used to benchmark inspection results of over 1,000,000m of trunk sewers and nearly 5000 chambers. A.E's goal is to consolidate the data, improve its usability, and optimize the efficiency of mutli-year sewer inspection programs. 


The successful candidates will be involved in the following tasks:
 

  - Improving, refining, and updating the user interfaces for the in-house condition assessment database and application (knowledge of VBA or SQL is considered an asset) 


  - Assisting in the development of data controls and processes to manage data from current projects. Tasks include compiling data from field crews and contractors, updating project databases, assisting in condition assessment, and testing/validating the in-house database using current data 


  - Performing field work as required including collecting, managing, and interpreting field data (such as maintenance hole inspections and GPS locations) 


  - Supporting engineers in sewer rehabilitation design projects, including structural analysis 


Projects that are currently active in the office include processing and management of a local and trunk sewer program in the City of Toronto, trunk sewer rehabilitation projects in the City of Toronto, trunk sewer and manhole inspection program in the Region of Peel, and manhole and sewer rehabilitation projects in the Region of Peel.
Required Skills:
We are looking for a candidate with the following skills:
 

  - A strong working knowledge of spreadsheet and database (Access) applications 


  - An Understanding of various material properties (concrete etc.), basic municipal infrastructure principles, and willingness to learn 


  - A motivated self-starter with the ability to work both independently and as part of a team 


  - Attention to detail and the ability to achieve thoroughness and accuracy when accomplishing tasks 


  - Excellent communication skills

Targeted Clusters

Job Summary:
This is an in-office placement.

Note: Orientation/Training will be December 29th- December 31st 9am-5pm. This placement will be done on April 29, 2022


m-Health Solutions specializes in remote patient monitoring and cardiac diagnostics. Using leading-edge technologies, m-Health Solutions (mHS) has created a system where the patient is the center of care. Once attached to the patient, the mobile technology sends cardiac data directly to a centralized and secure facility where a cardiac technologist reviews the information in near real-time. In the event of an urgent finding, the cardiologist is immediately notified. Using advanced supply chain, the service includes a patient-centric system that delivers the monitoring technology directly to a patient's home. Easy access and hook-up improves patient compliance and prevents the need for the patient to have multiple trips for device hook up and removal making the system COVID friendly. The system can also be used by health care facilities to monitor patients in the comfort of their own home post-discharge.  

  

Students will be working at m-Health Solutions head office located in Hamilton. All protective equipment, if required, will be supplied by mHS.
Job Responsibilities:
Responsible for managing inquiries from doctors, clinics, hospitals, and patients (customers) via phone, mail, fax, email, live chat, or virtual methods.
 

Open and maintain customer accounts by recording information
Processing and logging incoming calls into CRM/Medical record system
Identifying customer needs
Forwarding and escalating inquiries to the relevant individuals and departments
Contacting customers to give them accurate feedback on the progress of their referrals using proprietary virtual systems
Updating customer information as required
Maintains operations by following policies and procedures and reporting needed changes
Maintains customer confidence and protects operations by keeping information confidential
Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed
Required Skills:
The ideal candidate will have:
 

a positive and up-beat attitude,
excellent communication skills,
be a creative thinker with a strong work ethic.
Patience in dealing with people will be essential. I
n addition, the candidate will require skills such as decision making, positivity, time management, motivation, flexibility, problem-solving, critical thinking, and conflict resolution.


Technical skills

Processing and logging incoming calls into CRM/Medical record system
Open and maintain customer accounts by recording information
Contacting customers to give them accurate feedback on the progress of their referrals using proprietary virtual systems

Job Summary:
This is an in-office placement.
Note: Orientation/Training will be December 29th- December 31st 9am-5pm. This placement will be done on April 29, 2022.


m-Health Solutions specializes in remote patient monitoring and cardiac diagnostics. Using leading-edge technologies, m-Health Solutions (mHS) has created a system where the patient is the center of care. Once attached to the patient, the mobile technology sends cardiac data directly to a centralized and secure facility where a cardiac technologist reviews the information in near real-time. In the event of an urgent finding, the cardiologist is immediately notified. Using advanced supply chain, the service includes a patient-centric system that delivers the monitoring technology directly to a patient's home. Easy access and hook-up improves patient compliance and prevents the need for the patient to have multiple trips for device hook up and removal making the system COVID friendly. The system can also be used by health care facilities to monitor patients in the comfort of their own home post-discharge.  

  

Students will be working at m-Health Solutions Warehouse located in Stoney Creek. All protective equipment, if required, will be supplied by mHS.
Job Responsibilities:
Responsible for the accurate receiving, storing, and shipping of medical devices in accordance with government regulations, customer (doctors, clinics, hospitals, and patients') requirements and company safety, security, quality, and productivity standards within a fully automated environment.
 

Maintains database by entering new and updated customer and account information.

Job Summary:
Role Description

Co-op Software Developers at Macadamian design, develop, and implement software for technology based products or applications. They apply their knowledge of programming techniques to plan, develop, test and document computer applications. Co-op Software Developers create, maintain and implement the source code; design prototypes, specify program unit structure and conduct verification on their own designs. At times, they may gather requirements directly from users/clients or consult with their assigned Lab mentor. 

Mentored by a Lab Senior Software Developer, the Co-op Software Developer works closely with  their mentor and with guidance from other members of the Lab team to accomplish tasks and increase their knowledge and skill. The Co-op Software Developer  is responsible for contributing high quality work to Lab-lead client projects by using standard coding practices and in consultation with others.
Job Responsibilities:
Accountabilities and Responsibilities

Applies learned skills and knowledge to semi-routine tasks associated with the job family
Uses established practices and standard procedures to complete assignments 
Generally makes decisions/exercises judgment within clearly established procedures or practices, specific to the department or workgroup.
Consults with others on unclear situations
Works under supervision and receives guidance from others as needed
Has progress and output regularly reviewed, and is provided feedback to support continued learning
Required Skills:
Qualifications

University student  in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent
1-2 co-op terms of relevant experience or equivalent university or personal project experience in the areas of software development 

Core Competencies

Accountability: You take pride in your work and are accountable for delivery quality code and contributing to your best abilities to support the team
Communication: You communicate your ideas clearly and effectively and your needs as far as mentorship and support in a timely fashion
Service Orientation: At Macadamian, the customer always comes first, and you are an ambassador for the organization in your dealings with our customers.  You value being able to deliver a great customer experience.
Teamwork: Participates in team or group activities, offers help to team members as required
Problem solving: You know how to learn about new concepts and technologies and are able to come up to speed on these independently while knowing when you reach out to your mentor to ensure high productivity
Planning and Organization: You are able to manage your time and handle multiple tasks and priorities effectively  while keeping those depending on your deliverables aware of the status of each

Job Summary:
MacLean Sport Physiotherapy is a fully equipped clinic which provides a variety of treatments.  It is an ideal location to work if you are looking to pursue a health-related career.  This placement provides a great opportunity for you to learn about the physiotherapy profession, especially skills in Laser Therapy, Active Release Techniques, Manual Therapy and acupuncture. You will be working in a one-on-one environment with the physiotherapist, allowing for ongoing opportunities to learn (e.g. sitting in on assessments).  Throughout the term, you will gain experience working with a diverse group of clients, especially a high percentage of active people with sport related injuries.

Clinic Hours:
Monday (9:30am-9pm) Tuesday (9:30am-5pm) Wednesday (9:30am-9pm) Thursday (9:30am-5pm) Friday (9:30-3pm)
This is a four month placement, working five days a week for a total of 40+ hours.

Dress Code:
The centre does not have a formal dress policy.  All staff and students are expected to dress in an appropriate manner (business casual).
Job Responsibilities:
The kinesiologist supports the physiotherapist in a one to one relationship which allows for a high level of communication and great instructional opportunities.  They also take responsibility for clinical and administrative duties, supporting the physiotherapist by supervising clients during their treatment, ensuring clients perform prescribed activities in an appropriate and safe manner, and ensure the program area and equipment are cleaned and maintained on a regular basis.  The above responsibilities will aid the clinic to function most efficiently on a daily basis.

Duties:

Providing clinical care for clients
Providing timely and astute information to the physiotherapist about the client's performance
Working with the physiotherapist to facilitate clinical flow
Implementing the components of treatment plan as directed by the physiotherapist
Assisting the client with his/her individual physical programs
Demonstration of exercises, modelling for the clients
Cueing of good technique with clients
Charting on treatment provided
Application and removal of modalities (ice, hot packs, laser, ultrasound, IFC)
Required Skills:
Skills:

Ability to be consistent and display a positive and helpful attitude
Demonstrates a clear understanding of rehabilitation principles appropriate to the level of training
Awareness and understanding of privacy laws
Basic word processing computer skills
Demonstrates appropriate and effective written, oral and non-verbal communication with clients
Knowledge of the equipment and materials used in the provision of physiotherapy treatment an asset
Excellent interpersonal skills including the ability to give and receive both positive and negative feedback
Organizational and time management skills
Ability to solve problems and seek guidance of physiotherapist when appropriate
Ability to use good judgement in assessing difficult situations (Example: when assisting clients with limited mobility)
Remember to mention how great the Toronto Maple Leafs are in the interview
Ability to anticipate client's unique needs
Ability to function in a stressful environment while maintaining professional demeanour
Personal experience in fitness and athletic endeavours

Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Health Care: Therapy and Patient Care

Job Summary: You will be primarily responsible for the preparation of working paper files to support the financial statements as well as the preparation of the related corporate tax returns for our clients. Time management is particularly important during busy periods, as our clients may have different filing requirements for their financial statements, tax returns and special schedules and/or elections. Job Summary:
Company Introduction

At Magna, we see a future where everyone can live and move without limitations. That's why we are developing technologies, systems and concepts that make vehicles safer and cleaner, while serving our communities, the planet and, above all, people. Forward. For all. 


We at Cosma Assembly Technology (CAT) support this vision by providing best-in-class expertise in advanced manufacturing engineering, mechanical design, discrete event simulation, logistics simulations, human simulations to our global facilities. Our office is in Brampton, Ontario, and we are a division of Magna International. 


Join our team to learn how cars are made and about the latest technologies in manufacturing. We need support in Ergonomics Engineering. Will you join us? 


Job Summary

The Ergonomics Engineer reviews assembly processes and designs to ensure ergonomic risk to operators and assembly processes is minimized before equipment is built and installed at divisions. The successful candidate will act as subject matter expert amongst a team of process and design engineers.
Job Responsibilities:
Perform Ergonomics Failure Mode and Effects Analysis on assembly processes using industry accepted ergonomics analysis tools
Compile 3D human model simulations using available DHM CAD software (Siemens Process Simulate Human)
Perform design reviews on assembly processes and 3D design reviews of operator load fixtures to support process engineering team during new program launches
Provide quick feedback on in-house design projects
Test scenarios for improving ergonomics of assembly process and design in 3D CAD environment, and present recommendations to project engineering team
Maintain current standards on ergonomic design guidelines, operator movement times, operator utilization
Update report templates and guidelines to latest emerging research
Required Skills:
Visualization and critical analysis of physical demands associated with assembly processes in virtual design phase
Ability to learn new software
Ergonomics analysis tools not limited to Garg Equations, Jack/Process Simulate, 3DSSPP, RULA,  Liberty Mutual Material Handling Equations, Mital Tables, Strain Index
Ability to use CAD software (AutoCAD, Inventor, NX, Process Siimulate) an asset
Proficiency in MS office required
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Human Factors and Ergonomics
				
			
				- Theme - Manufacturing and Process Engineering
				
			
				AHS - Kinesiology
				
			
				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering

Job Summary:
Polycon Industries, Division of MAGNA INTERNATIONAL


Company Description:

Polycon Industries, located in Guelph, Ontario, is a tier one supplier of automotive fascias to assembly plants in North America. Polycon's facility has 3 paint lines and various assembly areas to assemble, pack and sequence fascias to the assembly plants.  The paint lines are automated utilizing ABB robots to apply the paint with either a rotary applicator or a spray gun. Assembly systems range from grille insertion machines, robotic clip cells to ultra sonic punching and welding machines.  Polycon represents an excellent opportunity for exposure to a diverse selection of industrial processes and equipment while obtaining solid production experience in the automotive industry.

Assist with process trials
Dimensional Studies
Assist with early project builds

Part design assessment
CAD analysis

Excellent attention to detail and accuracy required

Job Summary:
Company Description:  

Polycon Industries, a division of Magna International, located in Guelph, Ontario, is a tier one supplier of automotive fascias, trim and appliques to assembly plants throughout North America.  The fascias are moulded, painted and assembled on-site.  Polycon's facility has 3 paint lines with various assembly areas to pack and sequence fascias for assembly plants. The painting process is fully automated using ABB painting robots.  Polycon offers an excellent opportunity for exposure to a diverse selection of industrial processes and equipment while obtaining solid production experience in a fast paced tier one automotive industry. 

Video Link - http://bit.do/polycon


As a student in paint process engineering, you will engage in numerous paint yield, equipment downtime, and cost savings initiatives.  Eligible students will support process improvements including robot and paint usage efficiency and optimization, colour match, and appearance while maintaining a constant eye for product quality. Students are encouraged to be creative and identifying opportunities for process improvements and cost savings through data analysis and engineering. The student will be part of transforming robots and fluid delivery systems including paint storage, circulation, paint application methodologies, bake oven and curing process and applied industry best practices. There will also be exposure to a variety of substrate materials, including TPO, polyurethane, SMC, PC-ABS, and Aluminum.  Working at Polycon will develop individuals to a creative and dynamic manufacturing environment through hands-on experiences and cross functional team participation.
Job Responsibilities:
1)  Support yield, continuous improvement, and cost saving projects 

2)  Support downtime team initiatives 

3)  Manage paint usage reduction projects 

4)  Support painting production through online trials and root cause analysis for defect identification
Required Skills:
*  3rd or 4th year Manufacturing Student (Mechanical, Mechatronics, Chemical or Systems Engineering) 

*  Computer literate (MS Excel, MS Word, MS PowerPoint)  

*  Experience with data analysis and management (MiniTAB, Power BI, and SQL) 

*  Attention to detail and accuracy required  

*  Good understanding of computer hardware 

*  Good communication and interpersonal skills 

*  Strong interest in controls and plant instrumentation  

*  Previous manufacturing and paint application experience an asset

Job Summary:
Promatek Research Centre is a division of MAGNA-COSMA International.  We are a leading global automotive supplier with 338 manufacturing facilities and 89 product development, engineering and sales centres in 28 countries. We have over 169,000 employees focused on delivering superior value to our customers through innovative processes and World Class Manufacturing.  Promatek Research Centre located at 2550 Steeles Ave East Brampton, Ontario, Canada. 


Please visit www.cosma.com  and www.magna.com  for additional information. 


Promatek's function is to research and develop new process technologies for Cosma divisions around the world.  Promatek is fully equipped with leading edge equipment in hydroforming, stamping, robotics, casting, gas metal arc/resistance/laser welding and laser cutting. Our team consists of highly trained engineers and tradesmen.
Job Responsibilities:
We are looking for a co-op student who can work alongside and support our engineering R&D team.  This is an excellent opportunity to work with state-of-the-art equipment and processes and to gain exposure to the automotive industry.  The student will support the development and industrialization of new technologies within the automotive manufacturing industry.  


The selected candidate will be involved in:
 

Testing and validation of new materials for use in future vehicle development. 
Development of advanced automation and robotics for use in our world class manufacturing facilities. 
Participation on cross-functional design reviews for new technology testing and development. 
Design and Development of new tooling concepts, fixturing, equipment, etc.
Setting up of welding, stamping and process trials, training will be provided.
Required Skills:
Recommended qualifications include:
 

CAD - Inventor, Solidworks, or Catia are preferable
Project Management Skills
Proficient in MS Office - Outlook, Project, Excel, Word, Powerpoint. 
Metallurgical Lab Testing experience - Stress-Strain, Metallurgical, Hardness, sample preparation 
Automotive industry experience or knowledge


Other useful qualifications include:
 

Metal forming experience (stamping, hydroforming, casting, etc.)
Robotic and Controls Experience
Knowledge of welding (spot, mig, laser) and riveting of sheet metal, castings, extrusions
Laser Cutting/Welding Experience
Aluminum Casting preferably high pressure die casting
Knowledge of Hot Stamping of Automotive components


The engineering Co-op student will be reporting to the Promatek Engineering Manager.

Job Summary:
Murder. Terrorism. Child exploitation. Everyday, law enforcement around the world uses the tools made by Magnet Forensics to help find the evidence to not only solve these crimes but to stop them from happening in real time. The stakes are high and that's why we care so much about what we do.
 
What we are looking for:
The Technical Writer Co-op is responsible for creating and maintaining documentation for Magnet Forensics software products. Documentation is targeted towards a forensic investigator audience. As part of the Product Management team, the Technical Writer Co-op will work closely with various internal groups.

Why Magnet?

Mentorship
You will be paired with some of our amazing and brilliant employees to provide you mentorship and guidance throughout your work term. At Magnet, we believe in continuous learning and that there are no silly questions.

Team Work
You are not a number at Magnet Forensics. Every Magneteer has a voice and everyone is a part of a fun-filled, trusting, and selfless group. Whether your successes are work-related or a major life event, we all come together to make it special.

Purpose
You will be excited to come to work each day knowing your contributions make a difference in the world every day. No matter what role you play, you have an opportunity to help make the world a better place.
Job Responsibilities:
Job Responsibilities:

Update the Magnet AXIOM documentation set
Help build out team resources
Write and review UI strings
Build out knowledge base articles for external and internal audiences
Required Skills:
Required Skills:

You are working toward a Bachelor's degree in Literature & Rhetoric, or Rhetoric, Media, and Professional Communication
You have a basic understanding of topic-based writing (DITA)
You have excellent written communication skills and a strong attention to detail
You like working in a collaborative environment with smart, funny and interesting people

Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Professional and Technical Writing 
				
			
				ARTS - English Language and Literature

Job Summary:
Makeship.com is a crowd-funding platform for content creators to launch limited-edition merchandise to their fans. We're one of the fastest-growing companies in Canada with over 800% revenue growth rate and over $1M/month revenue with a team of 20. 


We are seeking an ambitious and personable Business Development Representative that will help us grow to the next level and continue our exponential growth trajectory. 


In this role, you will be targeting content creators and making our earliest relationships with them before they join our platform. Work directly with the largest content creators in the world. 


Why this role?

1. Impact the growth of the company. You will be the first point of contact to some of the largest content creators and us. 

2. Work at one of Canada's fastest-growing startup companies. Makeship is growing at over 800% YoY in Revenue and passing $1M / mo with a team of less than 20. 

3. Work directly with the largest content creators in the world. You are the first contact point between our platform and the people making content on Instagram, Youtube, Tiktok, and other platforms. 

4. Work in a growing market. The influencer industry is rapidly expanding with new creators exploding on a weekly basis. 

5. Join us at an incredible time. We're a profitable company and we've worked with over 150 creators. We are planning to work with over 500 this year. This is the time to experience exponential personal and career growth.
Job Responsibilities:
So, what will you do at Makeship in the Business Development role?

Find potential clients through content platforms like youtube, twitch, TikTok and others
Target and communicate with the creators to establish relationships and launch product campaigns
Learn, and follow Makeship's sales processes and identify areas for improvement
Evaluate and follow-up on our existing pipeline of opportunities
Work with our full-time partnerships team to help them with various prospecting and outreach tasks
Required Skills:
This might be for you if...

An interest in the content creation space (you love social media personalities!)
Entrepreneurial - you take ownership over your work and view it as more than a job
Extraordinary listening, communication, and organizational skills
Quick on your feet - you know when a situation requires out-of-the-box thinking
Extremely empathetic - you understand what other people are experiencing

Bonus points if you...

Have worked doing sales or BDR at a different company or startup
Created a social media account that grew exponentially
Are experienced with a CRM (preferably Hubspot)

Job Summary:
Malone Given Parsons Ltd. ("MGP") has provided land use planning services to public and private sectors since 1978. As an industry leader, MGP offers expertise in land use planning, regional planning, master planning, growth management strategies, and economic development. 

  

Our goal is to provide you with practical experience that complements your education at Waterloo. At MGP, the work environment is fast-paced, energetic, and engaging, and will provide you with an opportunity to work alongside our team of Planners for a variety of public and private clientele throughout the GTHA. As a mid-size consulting firm, MGP emphasizes a collaborative team-based work environment and strives to involve co-op students in a range of planning projects. 

  

MGP is committed to investing in our next generation of Planners. We have been a long-term partner of the Waterloo co-op program since 2004 and look to invite exceptional students back for their 2nd or 3rd co-op term; in addition, a number of our staff are Waterloo alumni. 

  

MGP also strives to foster a sociable work environment. We support charitable and industry organizations through alumni events, charity races, and other fun opportunities. As a company, we also attend sports events, host BBQs, throw holiday parties, and generally aim to play as hard as we work. 


During this time of encouraged social distancing, we have employed safety measures to ensure the continued health and protection of our staff. This includes moving towards a virtual platform as part of day-to-day activities and virtual social participation where possible. As municipalities begin to return to an in-office setting, staff will potentially return to the office on a minimum part-time basis as well.

Manorlead is an online technology real estate company using AI to digitally transform the Canadian real estate market. Manorlead hopes to leverage its data and technologies to bring innovation to the real estate industry.

As a software engineer, you will be working with a small team of high performing individuals to translate complex problems into scalable software. This work is a mixture of new feature development, research and development, application maintenance, and extensive testing.

Passion for coding and a quick learner with an excellent academic background

Knowledge of databases (e.g. MySQL, MongoDB, PostgreSQL)
A team player who loves to collaborate in a dynamic start-up environment

 We look for assets including:

Serverless and containerization experience (Docker, Kubernetes, ECS, GKE, and etc.)

Job Summary:
**Please note there are specific application instructions required to be considered for this role** 



Actuarial Co-op Program 


Actuarial Co-op students are given the opportunity to gain exposure to key actuarial disciplines including pricing, valuation, financial modeling, risk management, asset liability management and group actuarial.  As an Actuarial Co-op student, you will have the opportunity to work with a highly skilled team of actuaries and other professionals in a supportive learning environment, affording you the technical and business skills development you need in today's competitive environment. 


The Actuarial Co-op program offers salary increases for exam progress, a mentorship program, and various networking opportunities such as Orientation Sessions, Lunch 'n' Learns, Co-op Presentations and Job Shadow Day.

										436693 TOR - Software Developer / Project Coordinator
Job Summary:
About Manulife

Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States and Manulife elsewhere. We provide financial advice, insurance, as well as wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2018, we had more than 34,000 employees, over 82,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving almost 28 million customers. As of September 30, 2019, we had over $1.2 trillion (US$881 billion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made $29.8 billion in payments to our customers. 

  

Our principal operations in Asia, Canada and the United States are where we have served customers for more than 100 years. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we trade as 'MFC' on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in Hong Kong.  


Manulife is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization.   It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment.  A Human Resources representative will consult with applicants contacted to participate at any stage of the recruitment process who request an accommodation. Information received regarding the accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially. 


Job Description

We are seeking a candidate with a keen interest in working as a Software Developer and Project Coordinator under the guidance of skilled technical leadership and who is also interested in team management and other coordination activities. The candidate will be working with the Enterprise Architecture team in Investments Division. In addition, the candidate will have an opportunity to explore additional aspects of the developer role within Investment Systems. 

                                                          

The role involves suitable candidates to be interested in working at the capacity of a Software Developer/Project Coordinator with the Enterprise Architecture team. In this role, you will be exposed to industry-leading, enterprise technologies, including .Net, Java, Spring Boot, JavaScript, Pivotal Cloud Foundry, SQL Server and more. Additionally, you will also engage in Team Management & Leadership activities as described below.  The successful member of the team will be a self-starting, motivated individual wanting to develop his or her technical skills, leadership skills and expand business knowledge.
Job Responsibilities:
The position is divided into following main areas of responsibility:

Development activities/duties:

Design, develop and unit test code according to defined standards
Work with vendor products for Investment data management platforms
Help with Design documentation
Participate in technology evaluation/POC
additional duties to be considered as skills are developed and interest is expressed

Team Management:

Manage, prioritize, and track resource demands on projects
Prepare weekly resource utilization/allocation report
Assist in the hiring process and manage team meetings
Required Skills:
Keen understanding of technology and interest in learning about Development/Quality Assurance practice in a large organization
 

Excellent presentation and facilitation skills
Strong leadership and self-directed capabilities
Programming skills in any Object oriented languages, like .Net, Java, Python etc
Web and UI development
Experience in relational database such as Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle and MySQL
Ability to multi-task and adapt flexibly to conflicting workloads and deliverables in a dynamic environment
Ability to work independently as well as part of a team
Excellent time management skills
Good analytical and problem solving skills
Proven skills using MS Office (including Word, Visio, Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint, OneDrive and Yammer)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=no8ePgV532g

https://www.rankmyinternship.ca/companies/manulife/reviews

Written and verbal business and technical communication skills through providing support to end users and working with various internal and external clients
Strong problem solving, troubleshooting, analytical and team management skills
Learn about application development in a world class financial company
Gain domain knowledge in the Capital Markets industry
Working and networking with professionals in areas of interests pertaining to your program of study and/or research interests

Relevant majors of study:  Please note that candidates from the following programs would be given preference: Business Technology Management, Management Engineering, Computing Financial Management, Mathematics, Computer Science, System Design Engineering, Math and Business program

About Manulife

Job Description 

There is a possibility of the work term being virtual. If the work term becomes remote, we require students to be physically located in Canada. 


Overview: 

The Global Investment Performance & Analytics team conducts thorough analysis and analytical review on portfolio performance, attribution, and characteristics of various investment strategies of Manulife Investment Management (MIM) public markets to support the front office, product specialists, client reporting, and distribution teams. 

As part of the Global Investment Performance & Analytics team, the Analyst will help the team support  the SOD processes, respond to ad-hoc requests, look for efficiency gains opportunities and help develop new analysis to support all aspects of performance measurement and analytics reporting on our different portfolios and strategies. 

The role requires knowledge of financial markets, financial instruments and investment strategies as well as a desire for investment performance & analytics, including attribution, security and portfolio characteristics, and competitor/peer analysis. The opportunity is for a motivated and self-taught person who wants to work in a dynamic and rapidly changing environment. The candidate must be innovative and attention to detail.
Job Responsibilities:
Support the day-to-day operations to ensure the quality and accuracy of performance measurement, performance attribution, portfolio analytics, and competitor/peer analysis reporting for various MIM public markets strategies and portfolios.
Perform control checks and data reconciliation to ensure the accuracy and completeness of information being used to calculate performance and attribution results. Effectively identify and raise any issues using proper escalation process for prompt resolution.
Partner with operation groups to monitor controls and support valuation process.
Respond to ad-hoc requests and create value added analysis for investment distribution teams.
Calculate, analyze and report the performance of complex investment products or strategies to internal portfolio teams or external clients.
Contribute actively to implementing new measures, analysis, and reports that breakdown the performance of the various asset classes, strategic decisions, exposures and allocations.
Develop performance & analytics dashboards using Power BI.
Automate and streamline existing business processes.
Ensure timeliness and accuracy of client reporting.
Participate and/or lead projects as assigned.
Required Skills:
Progress towards an undergraduate degree in Finance, Mathematics or a business-related field.
Enrolled or willing to pursue the CIPM and/or CFA designation.
Good understanding of financial markets, financial instruments, different asset categories and their respective benchmarks.
Familiar with performance measurement methodologies and Equity attribution models.
Familiar with performance systems such as SS&C Sylvan and FactSet.
Experience with data analytics and data visualization (Microsoft Power BI) ? programming skills an asset.
Ability to work effectively with others in a team environment with diverse approaches and thinking styles.
Ability to work independently in a fast-paced, deadline-oriented environment.
Organizational, time management, and prioritization skills.
Analytical and quantitative reasoning skills.
Technical skills and a solid understanding of financial instruments;
High attention to detail and accuracy.
Autonomous and proactive.
Must be a collaborative and innovative team player.
Communication in both English and/or French (verbal and written) an asset.

Job Description 

We are seeking a Co-op to support our Global Sustainability team. The successful candidate will support the team with research, presentation development and best-practice peer analysis that will feed into our global Sustainability strategy as well as the development of our 2021 Sustainability Report. The Co-op will also support employee engagement initiatives to communicate our progress against Sustainability strategy objectives. 


We are seeking an individual that:
 

Thinks critically and strategically  
Has research capabilities and can analyze information
Has strong skills in development of presentation slides/decks
Thrives in a collaborative, high-performing, professional environment, with quick turn-around and changing priorities
Comfortable working in a sometimes ambiguous work environment
Job Responsibilities:
What will you do:
 

Support the Sustainability team with best-practice research around environmental, social and governance practices
Support the Global Sustainability team on research related to the global Sustainability Strategy and development of slides
Perform peer-analyses and collect information on peer external disclosures related to environmental, social and governance criteria
Support the Director, Global Sustainability in organizing and compiling information for the 2021 Sustainability Report and other ESG reporting and disclosure initiatives (CDP, DJSI, MSCI etc.)
Manage a content calendar and develop content to communicate the Company's progress internally against Sustainability strategy objectives globally

Qualifications:
 

Pursuing an education in Sustainability, Community Investment or CSR  Familiarity with ESG reporting and disclosure an asset
Demonstration of problem-solving skills and the ability to take initiative
Strong attention to detail
Excellent communication skills
Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Office suite, in particular Excel and PowerPoint, required
