Job Description 

There is a possibility of the work term being virtual. If the work term becomes remote, we require students to be physically located in Canada. 


Overview: 

The Global Investment Performance & Analytics team conducts thorough analysis and analytical review on portfolio performance, attribution, and characteristics of various investment strategies of Manulife Investment Management (MIM) public markets to support the front office, product specialists, client reporting, and distribution teams. 

As part of the Global Investment Performance & Analytics team, the Analyst will help the team support  the SOD processes, respond to ad-hoc requests, look for efficiency gains opportunities and help develop new analysis to support all aspects of performance measurement and analytics reporting on our different portfolios and strategies. 

The role requires knowledge of financial markets, financial instruments and investment strategies as well as a desire for investment performance & analytics, including attribution, security and portfolio characteristics, and competitor/peer analysis. The opportunity is for a motivated and self-taught person who wants to work in a dynamic and rapidly changing environment. The candidate must be innovative and attention to detail.
Job Responsibilities:
Support the day-to-day operations to ensure the quality and accuracy of performance measurement, performance attribution, portfolio analytics, and competitor/peer analysis reporting for various MIM public markets strategies and portfolios.
Perform control checks and data reconciliation to ensure the accuracy and completeness of information being used to calculate performance and attribution results. Effectively identify and raise any issues using proper escalation process for prompt resolution.
Partner with operation groups to monitor controls and support valuation process.
Respond to ad-hoc requests and create value added analysis for investment distribution teams.
Calculate, analyze and report the performance of complex investment products or strategies to internal portfolio teams or external clients.
Contribute actively to implementing new measures, analysis, and reports that breakdown the performance of the various asset classes, strategic decisions, exposures and allocations.
Develop performance & analytics dashboards using Power BI.
Automate and streamline existing business processes.
Ensure timeliness and accuracy of client reporting.
Participate and/or lead projects as assigned.

				- Theme - Information Science and Data Management

Job Description

Manulife's Investment Management Division is a leading global investment manager with offices in Canada, the United States, the United Kingdom, Japan, Hong Kong, and throughout Asia.  We manage a broad range of investments including equities, government and corporate bonds, real estate, commercial mortgages, oil and gas reserves, timber, agriculture and structured products totaling more C$1 T in assets under management. 


The Investment Management Division's Global Reconciliations team is currently rolling out a Global Reconciliations System and the Reconciliation Centre of Excellence for the Investment Division within the Global Optimization (GO) Program.  The GO program touches many of our investment processes and supporting systems from the Front Office, the Middle Office, Back Office, and the Reconciliations Operations team in the Philippines.  


The Candidate will provide supports to both the roll out of the above project and the business as usual (BAU) reconciliation processes by performing exception/account/process analysis, preparing reporting, coordinating and facilitating project/operational meetings.
Job Responsibilities:
Responsibilities: 
 

Perform daily and monthly reconciliations of assets for the General Accounts
Work with the Reconciliations teams and the business operations teams in middle and back offices to resolve exceptions
Manage daily/weekly/monthly reporting to internal and external stakeholders
Prepare management reporting for aged and high-risk exceptions
Support procedure compilation and updates with the Reconciliations Operations teams in North America and the Philippines
Work with the Reconciliations team to monitor the documentation and tracking of system enhancement and process improvement requests
Support testing and implementation of the new Reconciliation system
Support and/or manage end-to-end process improvement initiatives
Support internal operational meetings with the Reconciliations Operations teams and the business operations teams in middle and back offices
Support internal and external audits on the reconciliation processes
Coordinate training plans of the new platform across the Reconciliations Operations, middle and back office teams
Required Skills:
Skills and Knowledge

Good knowledge of the reconciliations process
Knowledge of a range of asset types, including equities, fixed income, derivatives, and how they are accounted for in the accounting book of records, booked in Bloomberg, Custodian books of records, and how they are represented in SWIFT messages.
Understanding of Investment Operations and data needs through the trading lifecycle.
Familiarity with Back and Middle Office functions as it relates in Wealth and Asset Management
Ability to establish priorities to meet tight and competing deadlines
Strong interpersonal skills and organizational skills
Communicating effectively verbally and in writing
Ability to work independently as well as part of a team in an international setting
High proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint
Knowledge of Microsoft Visio is an asset
Experience with SimCorp Dimension, Bloomberg, SWIFT and TLM is an asset

Education and Experience:

3rd/4th year of university student pursuing Business/Finance degrees
Prior co-op experience in the Investment industry

Are you a creative, self-motivated student looking for the opportunity to work in the fast-paced world of digital communications and client engagement? Are you a fun, energetic, team player who loves writing? If your answers are yes and yes, this may be the job for you.

Job Description

  

The Investment Co-op, Venture Capital role is an integral support function to Manulife Investment Management (MIM)'s Venture Capital team, as they assess new transactions, monitor portfolio companies and developments in targeted industries. The MIM Venture Capital team is focused on early stage (Series A/B+) investments in North American-based, B2B SaaS (software-as-a-service) startups across enterprise software, fintech, and insurtech. 

  

This position will assist the Venture Capital team in industry research, assessment, valuation, and comprehensive due diligence of a wide variety of B2B technology startups.
Job Responsibilities:
Responsibilities include:
 

Help collect analyst reports and conduct research on selected companies and industry sectors. Prepare industry reports which identify market and consumer trends, competitive landscape, key financial ratios, and performance measures as background for prospective investments 
Meet with prospective startup portfolio companies and complete in-depth company due diligence, as needed. Assist in team assessment of potential investment opportunities.
Assist in valuation analyses and financial modeling to support the analysis and diligence of prospective portfolio companies
Support completion of quarterly and annual reviews, risk ratings, and collateral valuations on all portfolio companies
Leverage engineering background, technology knowledge base, and/or prior experiences to assess software / SaaS companies for the quality of the underlying technology, appeal of its solution, and ability to scale and capture market share
Required Skills:
Preferred Qualifications:
 

Degree / pursuing a degree in: Engineering, Business, and/or Science
Prior internship(s) and experience in: product roles at tech-based firms and startups, strategy & operations at tech firms / startups, investment banking, venture capital / private equity, and/or consulting
Strong interest in new technology and trends, early-stage startups, entrepreneurship, and investments
Strong quantitative skills (e.g., financial modeling, valuations analysis, ability to assess and understand financial statements)
Strong written and communication skills ? able to synthesize and articulate thoughts about companies and markets in structured manner
Strong attention to detail
Highly motivated team player
Highly motivated self-starter, able to take initiative, prioritize, and run on own with limited guidance
Demonstrated project and time management skills in a fast-faced, multi-tasking environment

Job Details: 


The Global Asset Liability Management (Global ALM) group within Investment Division has the mandate to play a leadership role in the identification and assessment of ALM related risks globally along with the development of an effective risk management infrastructure and strategies to support the company's business strategies and financial objectives. 

  

Reporting to AVP, Solutions and Integration, this position is based in the Toronto Head Office and focuses on the development of financial applications that are used for asset valuation and market risk measurement. The student will have the opportunity to learn about modeling of assets and programming. In addition to learning financial modeling and risk analysis techniques, the student will have opportunities to gain experience with a variety of programming technologies: C#, VBA, SQL, Python, EXCEL and MatLab. 


This position will provide the successful candidate with an opportunity to join a highly motivated group of financial risk analysts and problem solvers and to participate in projects that require both technical and business acumen. The incumbent will also be involved in the review and development of various Asset Liability Management methodologies and reports.

  Excel, Access, Python)

Job Description 

The Investment Operations Co-op student will be responsible for providing operational support to all departments relating to the investment processes at Manulife. In particular, he/she will collaborate with senior team members to make sure that various investment activities are reflected in the Accounting Book of Records timely and accurately. Throughout the daily activities of this role, the successful candidate will interact with various parties extending from the internal portfolio management teams to custodian bank communities. This is an excellent opportunity to join one of the largest asset management firms in North America, and also contribute to the dynamic and collaborative atmosphere that Manulife offers. 

We are looking for an intelligent individual who can effectively use their skills to complete a variety of complex tasks. The successful candidate will have excellent organizational and communication skills, along with the ability to work as part of a team to monitor, research, and notify members of system information containing a high degree of principal risk. Furthermore, the successful candidate will also need to leverage their time management skills to meet strict deadlines in accordance with internal/external procedures and regulations. And lastly, the student we have in mind will strive to make a lasting impact on the operations department at Manulife Investment Management.
Job Responsibilities:
Job Responsibilities:
 

Work closely with various internal teams (transaction processing team, accounting team, system support team) and external parties (vender, and custodian banks) to make sure Manulife's investment transactions and financial activities are booked;
Perform various reconciliation jobs to ensure the accuracy of Accounting Book of Records; research and solve breaks;
Take initiative to improve current processes, such as reducing manual work and operational risks
Ensure integrity of trading system data and evaluating all investment transactions
Assist with designing and implementing internal controls around key processes
Assist with data aggregation and visualization to evaluate system / process robustness
Support additional projects as required
Required Skills:
Job Requirements:
 

Working towards a University Degree in Finance, Accounting, and Business
Experience with Middle Office Investment Operations management an asset
Possess strong knowledge of all security types including equities, bonds, derivatives and complex securities
The individual must be organized, professional, and demonstrate the ability to work independently with minimal supervision
Proficient in Microsoft Excel
Experience with business intelligence tools (Microsoft PowerBI) an asset
General knowledge of finance, portfolio accounting systems and general applications is required
Bloomberg OMS experience an asset
Ability to operate within a high volume, fast paced, complex environment under tight deadlines

Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States and Manulife elsewhere. We provide financial advice, insurance, as well as wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. Our principal operations in Asia, Canada and the United States are where we have served customers for more than 100 years. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we trade as 'MFC' on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in Hong Kong.

Job Details 

At Manulife Bank, we believe banking products are an integral part of every Canadian's financial plan. As one of Canada's youngest banks, we are growing at an unprecedented rate and need people with the skills, energy and drive to maintain our leadership position as an "advisor's bank." 

Reporting to the Senior Training Consultant, the Sales & Training Coordinator will primarily be involved in providing support for the national sales team consisting of Channel Heads, Regional Vice-Presidents, Business Development Managers and Mortgage Specialists. 


The coordinator will collaborate with various Bank departments to resolve inquiries from the sales team and will assist with creating and providing support of existing and new learning programs. This is an excellent developmental opportunity for a customer-service focused individual to gain insight into the Bank's sales support and training & development functions.
Job Responsibilities:
Responsibilities
 

Provide sales support to the Channel Heads, Regional Vice-Presidents, Business Development Managers and Mortgage Specialists by responding to inquiries regarding products, processes, administration, etc., within the specific service level agreements.
Provide behind the scene support for individual and group training sessions (facilitated face-to-face sessions or via video conference). 
Support departmental projects for training development
Provide coaching, training, problem resolution for general/escalated inquiries and participate in day-to-day work flow
Support internal system applications (i.e. mortgage application system) by handling phone and email inquiries from the sales team
Work with senior sales management to coordinate events from an event management/event planning perspective. This includes the immediate sales team, but can also involve stakeholders from our primary distribution channels ? Financial Advisors and Mortgage Brokers
Build and support training reports
Draft and coordinate field communications
Work closely with the VP Sales and AVP of Sales Enablement to drive out specific technical and non-technical initiatives
Identify opportunities for process improvement within the Sales Support and Sales Training department
Required Skills:
Qualifications
 

Post-secondary education or equivalent industry experience
Strong focus on attention to detail. Ability to take initiative; lead a project
Ability to think creatively - consider ideas that are outside of the box
Ability to work independently and as a team player
Strong implementation skills
Ability to work well under-pressure and prioritize tasks based on importance/urgency
Strong documentation skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong interpersonal skills
Excellent time management skills, and ability to organize multi-task
Demonstrated use of good judgment and professionalism when dealing with sensitive, confidential matters
Ability to be flexible and adaptable when dealing with change
Desire to learn the sales and training functions of the Bank
Strong technical aptitude
Proficiency in Microsoft Office; particularly strong with Excel
Bilingualism in English and French (oral and written) is an asset.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters

				- Theme - Marketing and Communication 
				
			
				- Theme - Supply Chain Management and Logistics 
				
			
				ARTS - Business
				
			
				ARTS - Global Business and Digital Arts
				
			
				MATH - Business

Job Description

Are you looking to join a team where you can accelerate your analytics skills and have fun along the way? If yes, read on. The Global Digital Marketing team's mandate is to Accelerate Manulife's Digital Marketing capabilities and programs globally to engage and inspire Consumers to become our Customers. 

The Digital Analytics Coordinator will support the digital marketing team to deliver broad, complex, and high-impact enterprise-wide data and analytics solutions. This individual plays a key role in helping us connect the dots to ensure we're getting the most out of Manulife's data. 

Global Digital Marketing is a nimble team working in a fast-paced environment where expectations are high and deadlines are tight.  

This individual will work closely with the Director, Digital Analytics and Director, Global Digital Marketing Strategy.
Job Responsibilities:
You'll do things like:

Build dashboards to better visualize our marketing data
Work with teams around the globe to ensure we're collecting the right data
Build and maintain relationships with global stakeholders to ensure we're working collaboratively
Support execution of high-potential, high-profile, digital programs and technology implementation (web, digital media, analytics, marketing technology, and more).
Required Skills:
This is the job for you because:

You learn fast. You pick up new ideas, concepts, technologies, applications, and tools.
You have a passion for analytics. You've got some experience, but want more!  
You're data-driven, consistently using data to guide decisions and strategies.
You're technologically savvy, always meeting and exceeding high standards of accuracy and quality.
You're able to identify technical problems and develop sound, carefully thought-out solutions.

Some experience that we are looking for

Proficiency with SQL
Experience with Tableau, PowerBI, or a similar data visualization tool
Understanding of Digital Marketing, e-commerce, or e-Business.
Experience with digital analytics tools such as Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, Google AdWords, Hootsuite Impact, and/or Brandwatch a plus.
Proven communication skills including: verbal, written and presentation skills.

Job Description 


Product Analyst 

We are looking for motivated and talented students who are driven to succeed. At Manulife Financial we provide students with real working experience and a wealth of opportunity for learning and development. Our co-op programs offer exciting student positions in a variety of roles, levels and functional areas. Gain valuable experience while working for one of Canada's largest Financial Services companies. 


The Product Analyst role is the ideal opportunity for a detailed and enthusiastic individual who is looking to develop within the Financial Services Industry.  This is a rewarding opportunity to join the Product team within our Guaranteed Investment Product team in Waterloo. The Product Analyst role will provide support for a variety of projects of various sizes and related to various Segregated Fund products.  This includes support for product development and product change projects.  When involved in a project, the successful candidate will make recommendations to the Product Managers and Directors and carry this through the development process.    This role is the ideal opportunity for a detailed, organized and energetic individual who is looking to develop and grow within the Financial Services industry. We are looking for an individual who is excited to learn, demonstrates ownership and accountability.
Job Responsibilities:
What you will be accountable for: 


The primary role for this student will be to work on our annual fund changes project. This project is responsible for adding, merging and removing underlying funds from our wide range of segregated fund products. The work will be detailed analytical work to determine the impact these changes will have to Manulife's products and Manulife's clients.
Required Skills:
The skills and qualifications you will need to be successful:
 

Strong Proficiency with Excel
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Excellent organization and prioritization skills
Project management skills
Proficiency with Microsoft Office (PowerPoint, Word etc)
Ability to understand and communicate technical information
Accurate with exceptional attention to detail
Strong customer focus
Enthusiastic, action oriented
Desire to learn and the ability to learn quickly
An ability to effectively and professionally interact with all levels of staff, management and field representatives

Job Details: 

The Sales Effectiveness group at Manulife Bank and Trust has an excellent career opportunity for a co-op position, Sales Effectiveness Coordinator, who is seeking an opportunity to bring strong data analytics and organization skills to a role with a significant reporting component. 

This role will be ideal for those candidates who have the right complementary mix of business & systems analysis, CRM technical skills to solve business challenges and savviness with numbers that enable them to unearth insights from analytics to support smarter and more efficient solutions.  You're a big-picture thinker and process improvement champion who is passionate & creative about understanding the user's point of view to achieve high engagement. 

The Sales Effectiveness Coordinator will report directly to the Inside Sales Manager and be based in Waterloo, Ontario.
Job Responsibilities:
Key Accountabilities:
 

Run and request reports from SalesForce.com for territory sales analysis
Prepare monthly call audit package for Manager Inside Sales using Verint call recording software
Maintain inside sales leaderboard and create weekly dial report
Assist Inside Sales Manager with call audit protocol
Participate in the monitoring, and execution of the national sales plan
Coordinate and monitor prompt distribution of marketing materials in electronic and print format
Maintain current advisor records in SalesForce.com
Manage email distribution lists, and organize and execute e-marketing campaigns as needed
Prepare and submit Concur expense reports as needed
Act as a subject matter expert on the SalesForce application for Bank
Create 'How to' step by step support material for all SalesForce features & functionality
Synthesize sales analytics to understand nature of business and identify trends and opportunities
Create and design processes of reporting and analytics using Microsoft tools such as Excel and Access.
Refine existing reporting to focus on producing clear, concise, timely and value-added reporting
Develop ad hoc reporting based on requirements and business need from management
Required Skills:
Job Requirements (Education, Experience, Knowledge, Skills and Competencies):
 

Ability to balance multiple priorities while maintaining a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail
Flexible and adaptable when dealing with change, including changing priorities and tight deadlines
Strong problem solving skills and analytical skills; ability to investigate problems without supervision
Fast learner and self-starter, who takes initiative and thrives in a fast-paced work environment
Strong PC skills with an emphasis on MS-Excel and Salesforce; ability to learn new software quickly
Demonstrate tact and professionalism and maintain confidentiality

Job Details: 

Manulife Private Wealth ("MPW") delivers investment counseling and private banking services to high net worth clients the way it should be delivered. At MPW, we believe that fresh thinking, open architecture solutions and a global approach should be an integral part of every Canadian's financial plan and future. As one of Canada's newest wealth management firms, our philosophy has been resonating with our target market and we are growing rapidly. We need people with the skills, energy and a drive to succeed to help us continue to service our growing client base. With our head office located in Toronto, Manulife Private Wealth offers an opportunity to work with a team that values new ideas and is committed to developing innovative solutions that will shape the future our business. 


In this role as a junior analyst, you will support the Manulife Private Wealth Investment Counsel Services team and ensure all tasks assigned are completed accurately and within the established timelines.

Support high net worth account administration and portfolio set up 

Ad-hoc data clean up projects 

Assist with creating client welcome packages 

Other tasks as assigned by team members

Are you looking for unlimited opportunities to develop and succeed? With work that challenges and makes a difference, within a flexible and supportive environment, we can help our customers achieve their dreams and aspirations. 


Manulife Wealth & Asset Management ("WAM") is the global asset management arm of Manulife, providing comprehensive asset management solutions for investors. This investment expertise extends across a broad range of public and private asset classes, as well as asset allocation solutions. 


WAM Operations is comprised of approximately 3000 employees across the globe and manage a variety of customer activities for retail, retirement, and institutional customers. Global WAM Operations also serve in a range of investment, accounting, data management, and project roles in support of the segment and its customers. 


As a member of the Global WAM Operations Strategy team, support the leadership team in planning and execution of strategic initiatives.

Develop business playbooks and roadmaps to address business needs
Analyze data and work with management to develop creative solutions.

Promoting and enabling a high degree of collaboration among stakeholders and decision makers to ensure successful and quick delivery

Completion of an Economics, Data Science or relevant undergraduate degree
1 year of business experience including business analysis, business requirement documentation or project management experience a plus

Financial Analysis background helpful
Data & Analytics savvy
Understanding of Wealth & Asset management is a plus
Ability to create and maintain relationships

Project support experience
Curiosity and willingness to learn

Self-motivated and directed, with keen attention to detail.

Strong problem-solving skills and analytical ability
Strong organization, communication and interpersonal skills
Comfortable analyzing and organizing large volumes of data.
Experience with business intelligence tools and building visualizations and dashboards with Power BI

Knowledge of the Asset Management Industry, particularly operations

Job Details 

As a Continuous Improvement Analyst, you will work with the Continuous Improvement and the Digitization & Automation ("Process Excellence") teams, both within the Business Optimization group. The ideal candidate is passionate about leading change and driving results through process improvements and business transformation, including the utilization of Lean Six Sigma methodology and techniques, digitization innovations (such as Robotic Process Automation or digital document management for example), and organizational readiness efforts. We are looking for dynamic candidates who want to expand their skill set by doing innovative, problem-solving and innovation based work and learning how transformations impact a business.
Job Responsibilities:
Responsibilities:
 

Assist project leads in large scale process optimization initiatives supporting the Investment segment's Finance & Operations teams - understanding the problem and helping determine solutions.
Ability to work with business owners in Finance and Operations teams and through exercise of impact and influence, persuade them to pursue quick win recommendations suggested by this team.
Proven ability to present compelling, fact-based analysis that enables efficient and sound decision-making at the senior management level.
Ability to leverage analytical tools to diagnose, recommend and resolve significant process issues with an ability to influence senior stakeholders to drive change across the functional area.
Creative problem solver to ensure appropriate data collection techniques are used to drive assessment and recommendations.
Required Skills:
Skills/Qualifications:
 

Studying for a Bachelor's degree in business, accounting, finance, mathematics, statistics, engineering or related field.
A proactive self-starter with demonstrated leadership qualities.
Interest and strength in Investment Management, as well as business process improvement.
A strong ability to adapt to an ever changing environment and the ability to work through internal ambiguity and changing priorities.
Highly developed planning, organizing and negotiating skills; can manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines.
A proven innovative thinker and problem solver; brings a big-picture perspective ? the ability to see how all the pieces fit together and contribute to the achievement of broader organizational objectives; strong business acumen and judgment.
Working knowledge of Excel and Excel VBA Macros, SharePoint are a bonus.

  

Leadership
 

Be part of a team that builds a center of excellence and a shared service within the Investment segment for process improvement.
Be emblematic of Manulife's client focused culture.

Job Title:
NEW
									



										0437355 TOR - Enterprise Strategy and Transformation Co-op
Job Summary:
Enterprise Strategy & Transformation Team 

The Enterprise Strategy & Transformation team is recruiting an Analyst (Co-op), Strategy & Transformation to assist in our transformation by driving the development and execution of corporate strategy and/or strategic partnerships across Manulife. 

Analysts (Co-op) are responsible for the research, analysis in support of the delivery of strategic projects. They analyze key business priorities and bring insights to generate actions that create value for the company. 

Analysts (Co-op) support strategic decisioning via the thoughtful analysis and presentation of current state, firm strengths/challenges, industry/market trends and competitive research. 

Analysts (Co-op) partner with staff across business lines, geographies and value streams to ensure strategic objectives achieve intended outcomes, through thoughtful analysis and clear presentation of results and recommendations. 

Analysts (Co-op) support the team in achieving the overall mandate for the Enterprise Strategy & Transformation area, partnering with leaders to mobilize resources to resolve special corporate strategy projects and track and report implementation progress. 

Analysts (Co-op) deliver comprehensive, forward-looking advisory services to senior management in a timely manner, while maintaining an effective monitoring framework and process that will help ensure successful execution on our strategy to achieve our objectives.  

Analysts (Co-op) are collaborators and help to communicate our strategic priorities, both to internal and external stakeholders, in an impactful way, providing context, focus and inspiration.
Job Responsibilities:
Responsibilities: 

Partner with team members to drive Manulife/John Hancock's transformation and strategic priorities, represent the team on cross-functional work, identify issues, escalate as required, and recommend solutions to keep priorities on track. Perform research and analysis of industry trends, market positioning or competitive activity related to a component of an overall segment or function strategy. Support the implementation of a strategic planning framework and process that engages leaders in effective strategic dialogues, decision-making and planning. Support in providing market and competitive intelligence profiles to share insights and help the team keep abreast of external developments. Based on the research completed, is expected recommend a course of action, or set of alternatives, to the overall Strategy Lead and/or relevant business partner for further discussion and ultimate decisioning. Act as a resource for insights for annual, quarterly and monthly management reporting deliverables. Support strategy discussions across key business units and with strategy groups across the organization.
Required Skills:
Knowledge/Skills/Competencies/Education: 

Pursuing a degree in business, STEM, or equivalent 

Good business acumen with understanding of and interest in the development and execution of corporate strategy and/or strategic partnerships 

Excellent analytical capabilities; comfortable with quantitative and financial analyses 

Ability to effectively execute both independently and as part of a broader team, while managing a diverse set of priorities 

Demonstrated ability to influence diverse stakeholders and drive adoption and delivery of results/recommendations 

Demonstrated ability to solve problems in a structured and logical way 

Must be a great communicator 

Ability to work effectively in diverse environments and cultures
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters

There is a possibility of the work term being virtual. If the work term becomes remote, we require students to be physically located in Canada. 

Are you looking for a career in an innovative area with great opportunities? 

As expectations for the Customer Experience continue to grow, our business is focused on creating an experience that is effortless, easy and meaningful to our clients.   With attention to detail and strong product and customer service skills, our business area is driven to provide solid financial management to clients who entrust us with their financial stability? and the ability to retire with dignity. 


Our Retirement Operations Transformation Team is looking for a dynamic, enthusiastic, team-oriented Intelligent Automation Analyst who enjoys working alongside other analysts and developers in the enhancement and creation of various technical tools to bring increased efficiency to our business stakeholders.  This position within the business requires background and experience in previous technical roles, automation, and a strong aptitude in finding creative solutions while always having the customer at the forefront of their thinking.
Job Responsibilities:
Does this sound like you?
 

Excellent demonstrated data manipulation skills using C#.Net, MSSQL queries, Microsoft Excel, Access and Visual Basic

Advocate of the Agile mindset and scrum processes
Exceptional customer service focus
Get it done attitude
Flexible & adaptable to change
Resiliency with ambiguity
Leadership & influencing skills
Enthusiastic & collaborative team player

IStill interested?  Here's what you'll be doing?

Creating applications using C#.NET

You enjoy working with stakeholders, have top-notch communication skills and are passionate about making their work easier and more efficient! 

Agile is a mindset you not only embrace, but are passionate about 

You love seeing your team and members of your team succeed?and if you helped them, it's all the more rewarding, even if you don't get all the credit!

Job Title:
NEW
									



										0436554 TOR/BOSTON - Data Analytics Co-op (Audit Services)
Job Summary:
Are you looking for unlimited opportunities to develop and succeed?  With work that challenges and makes a difference, within a flexible and supportive environment, we can help our customers achieve their dreams and aspirations. 


If you are ready to unleash your potential it's time to start your career with Manulife/John Hancock.


About Manulife

Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States and Manulife elsewhere. We provide financial advice, insurance, as well as wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2018, we had more than 34,000 employees, over 82,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving almost 28 million customers. As of December 31, 2018, we had over $1.1 trillion (US$794 billion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made $29.0 billion in payments to our customers. 

  

Our principal operations in Asia, Canada and the United States are where we have served customers for more than 100 years. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we trade as 'MFC' on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in Hong Kong.  


Manulife is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization.   It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment.  A Human Resources representative will consult with applicants contacted to participate at any stage of the recruitment process who request an accommodation. Information received regarding the accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially.
Job Responsibilities:
Key Accountabilities:
 

Develops and implements analytics enabled solutions to evaluate controls and audit business objectives on data validation, consolidation and cleansing processes and independently re-performs business processes, and identifies exceptions.
Owns and delivers complete projects of moderate complexity to prepare and integrate large and varied datasets to build statistical and machine learning models using Python and R and perform full-population data retrievals and/or sampling on large data sets
Works on problems of moderate scope / complexity to Validate and quantify accuracy and precision of analysis.
Develop requirements, design, code, test, and analyze results to provide support on audit activities using available tools/infrastructure.
Work independently to support individual audits, and collaboratively with both the team and Auditors on larger project
Analyze, document, present analytical results Communicates results of cases of moderate complexity to business partners and recommends to audit teams and provide conclusions/recommendations on data related issues.
Required Skills:
Job Requirement:
 

Working towards a degree (post-graduate preferred) in a technical (computer science, statistics, math, etc.) or business discipline or equivalent technical expertise
Experience in manipulating and analyzing data, connecting to various databases using python/SQL, data mining, statistics, Machine-Learning.
Excellent understanding of SQL, Python, R, VBA, MS Excel, Data Extraction and Data Mining tools.
Advanced data analysis techniques: regression analysis, statistical analysis, hypothesis testing, distribution analysis, correlation, variance, multi-variate analysis etc.
Proven hands-on experience in managing libraries, database management, importing and reconciling data
Experience with Big Data Platforms and EDLs.
Experience with visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau

Job Summary:
We're not just an insurance company. We're actually 1200+ technology specialists dedicated to improving the health and wealth of Canadians ? and doing it in some really cool new ways. We take technology seriously: last year Manulife spent $1.4 billion on technology as part of transforming into the digital leader in the industry. We are all in with Agile development, DevOps, Open Source, mobile apps, and modern tools and processes. There's no speed limit for this transformation! 

  

Unlike making minor changes or updates like at some of the larger tech companies, at Manulife you will make a real difference by working on some pretty impactful and meaningful projects. 


Here's the deal on being a co-op at Manulife

  

You might be surprised to know that Co-ops love Manulife ? and come back term after term. Why? We've got what you're looking for:
 

Jobs that embed you in passionate, productive teams.
Jobs with lots of opportunities for growth during your co-op term and opportunities for fulltime employment after graduation.
Jobs that leave you with great stories to tell at your next set of interviews.
Jobs that make your Co-op term a fun and profitable break from school.

Every term we hire 100+ students ? so you'll have plenty of new friends to chill with. And you can meet your new friends at Co-op events like Hackathons, Co-op Innovation Challenges, and other fun social events ? and yes food and treats are often involved!
Job Responsibilities:
Here's the deal on this role

  

We are looking for Platform Reliability Engineers: specifically, someone who is passionate about enabling visibility of application health and performance data. 

  

Regardless of what level role you're looking for (we have work that range from Junior all the way to Senior) you're someone who enjoys working with application monitoring, continual improvement with automation and channeling your inner Data Nerd. 

  

You will be digging into several of the following, so experience in any of these areas is a huge plus;
 

Monitoring tools: New Relic, Dynatrace, CA APM, PRTG
Node.js, Powershell, Python
Azure, Pivotal Cloud Foundry (PCF), Kubernetes
Atlassian Jira & Confluence
Git, Jenkins, VS Code
R, PowerBI, other data analysis tools
Required Skills:
Other skills we're looking for

 
 

You learn fast. Like "The Flash" fast. You pick up new ideas, concepts, technologies, applications, and tools at warp speed.
You question everything. Not in an annoying way of course, but in a way that gets to the root of an issue, so you can go do something about it.
You're an all-round super star: a passionate, team player with a zeal for designing, developing and improving cool software products.
You are always learning by using new tools and technologies.
You know that part of innovation is failure. And when you fail, you always fail forward and fast? learning something new and becoming even better than you were before.
You will have the opportunity to innovate and figure things out creatively with your team. You'll analyze a problem, find the best solution, and implement it. Then you iterate and do again.

Now here's what to do next

  

We want you here as a Co-op. And we want to make your experience with us SO AMAZING that you join us in a fulltime after you graduate.  It's really that simple. 


If you are ready to unleash your potential, then pick Manulife/John Hancock for your coming co-op term and apply today!

Job Description 

Manulife is looking for a Co-op/Intern to join our Global Technology Strategy team for the Fall 2021 term. The incumbent brings analytical thinking and a desire to learn about how technology at is enabling the transformation at Manulife. The position is well suited for someone who enjoys change, adapts quickly and able to navigate independently through complex processes. The position will be in the Toronto office. ·       Liaise with cross functional teams on key strategic initiatives driving transformation at Manulife

·       Create and maintain reports / dashboards on an as required basis

Job Summary:
Digital  Co-op Program  

Digital Innovation Business Analyst 

  

Why join the Digital Innovation team at Maple Leaf Foods? 

  

Why join the Digital Innovation team at Maple Leaf Foods? 

  

Join our team if you want to explore your passion for innovation, expand on your desire to build cutting-edge innovation systems, and most importantly, have a craving for quality food. 

  

What will you be working on? 

  

This is certainly not your average analyst position. As a business analyst on the Digital Innovation co-op team at Maple Leaf Foods, you will be responsible for identifying and solutioning ways to accelerate our digital strategy. 

  

You will be given several initiatives to lead and work with a multi-disciplinary co-op team to:
 

Drive digital tech adoption across the Maple Leaf plant network
Educate through workshops & white papers to create a digital shift across the organization
Create relevant and engaging content on Digital Innovation 
Host IS wide events to improve company engagement
Network with senior executives throughout the organizations by mentoring them on your expertise

  

  

What are some of the projects you may be working on? 

 
 

Tech Pilots - Support the development and execution of technology pilots across the organization
Mobility Adoption - Lead the iPad adoption initiatives across the MLF plant network for our mobile apps that were built in collaboration with MLF, SAP & Apple
Ideation Contests - Develop & manage innovation contests for different areas of the business to surface new ideas and to map novel opportunities. Research, assess, and document insights.
Tech Talks & White Papers - Develop and present content to promote & engage employees across the organization on emerging technologies

  

What will you get out of this experience? 

  

Being a co-op student means making important decisions, but we want joining our team to be an easy choice. When you join our team, you'll be given:   

 
 

An opportunity to have a key role in the Digital Transformation at Maple Leaf Foods
Mentorship and support from our senior leaders and leadership trainees.
The opportunity to mentor a member of our Senior Leadership Team through our Reverse Mentorship program
Gain teamwork and leadership experience through autonomous responsibilities
Exposure to network with senior leaders, internal & external stakeholders through projects and presentations
Flexible work environment - bring your own device, dress for your day, and work from home
Opportunity to become certified in various workstreams through Learning Hub, i.e. Six Sigma
Potential opportunity to be part of the Leadership Training program after graduation
Potential opportunity to attend tech events courtesy of Maple Leaf
Job Responsibilities:
Responsibilities

Leading adoption initiatives by effectively coordinating and communicating project deliverables, timeline, and progress to all project stakeholders
Developing content (articles, videos) for internal & external platforms to highlight progress on initiatives
Researching emerging technology & tech trends to educate the internal stakeholders
Assessing and analyzing current practices & processes to provide recommendations for continuous improvement 
Identifying initiatives and start-ups that can accelerate the digital strategy
Collaborating with internal & external stakeholders to deliver results on assigned initiatives  
Assisting with recruitment & other ad hoc activities
Required Skills:
Job Requirements

  

We're looking for a business analyst to be part of the Digital Innovation team. The successful candidate will be a 2nd or 3rd term undergrad coop student or currently pursuing their Master's in Business Administration, IT Management, or similar field with prior work experience as a business analyst who is interested in 4- or 8-month work term, as well as the following skills:
 

Experience working with senior decision makers
Proven analytical background with strong critical thinking skills
Experience writing business cases, detailed reports & articles
Excellent leadership skills and strong communication/interpersonal skills
Flexible person who is comfortable working in a fast-paced environment
Excellent planning, organization, and time management skills
Experience with Microsoft applications including Office365, SharePoint and Advanced Excel Skills
A passion for technology and start-ups

Nice to have:

 

Experience in an Agile work environmentProject Management experience
Experience conducting research
Change Management experience

Job Summary:
Maple Leaf Foods is a leading meat and plant-based protein company, employing over 11,500 people and publicly traded on the Toronto Stock Exchange. We are proud of our roots, which trace back well over 100 years, but our vision and purpose are decidedly forward looking. As we pursue our vision to become the most sustainable protein company on earth, we are committed to creating shared value ? creative business value through addressing some of the world's most critical social and environmental challenges. Our goal is to build a more sustainable food system, which provides nutritious affordable food, operates within planetary limits, cares for animals responsibly, and meaningfully engages with our communities to advance a more just society. We are advancing bold changes within Maple Leaf and more broadly within society to pursue our vision. We deeply believe this is the sustainable path to growth. 

  

Maple Leaf Foods embraces a strong values-based culture, where our people are deeply engaged in work that is purposeful, fast-paced and challenging.  We cultivate an open, non-bureaucratic and inclusive workplace that fosters safety and transparency, along with individual leadership and accountability. Each Maple Leaf team member has a voice and plays an active role in helping all of us achieve our goals with passion and discipline. We support one another to grow professionally, to learn new skills and to take on challenging experiences in the spirit of continuous improvement. 

  

The Opportunity:

Reporting to the IS Director, Insights, Information Solutions. The Data Insight Analyst, actively participates in the Data Science life cycle (focus on back end and front end) by gathering requirements and functional specifications from clients, helping to create Business Analytics designs with primary focus on user facing functionality (reports, dashboards, analytical applications, etc.). Additionally, back-end responsibilities including designing, building and improving Python code base that supports business critical metrics and insights using industry standard libraries. Moreover, the Data Insight Analyst will have the opportunity to work with other IS Teams to collaborate on designing and developing data driven analytic solutions that interest them.
Job Responsibilities:
Position Responsibilities

Helps design, build and support BI reports, dashboards and other forms of user facing analytical functionality using Microsoft PowerBI, SAP Business Objects WebI, SAP BW Bex.
Improve classification algorithm used to match Ad activity to internal SKU's. (Python, Text Analytics).
Collaborate closely with the Digital Innovation Team to deliver exciting applications using the latest technologies like PowerBI, SAP WebI, MS Azure, Python Data Science toolkits. As well as get involved in AI/Machine Learning Indicatives as they are available open source toolkits (as projects are available).
Participates in BI/Business Analytics projects utilizing key project management principles ensuring that own commitments are met
Support and undertake Ad-hoc Analysis using Data Science and basic Machine Learning principles.
Creates technical, compliance and process documentation as required
Reports to Director, Business Analytics, working directly with team of 8 individuals
Required Skills:
Required Education 

Working toward a degree in:  Management Engineering, System Design Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Information Technology, Science, or Business. 

  

Required Skills, Experience/Knowledge

Technical Skills - entry level
MS Office (Word/Excel/PowerPoint)
MS PowerBI (M Script, DAX) (optional)
Basic knowledge of Machine Learning techniques (NLP, classification, regression, etc.)  (optional)
Basic knowledge of data science toolkits (Python Libraries: Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, parallel processing)
Database experience (SQL) - optional
SharePoint - optional
Good communication skills
Good analytical skills - attention to detail

Job Summary:
The Opportunity

The CO-OP student Microbial Technologist will be responsible for supporting laboratory operations by conducting the relevant biological testing. You will ensure tests are conducted in accordance with standard procedures and regulations. To be successful in this role you must be team oriented, dependable and have a positive attitude.
Job Responsibilities:
A snapshot of some of the exciting things you will lead and do: 

 

Perform testing on samples received into the lab as directed by the lab supervisor or delegate and accurately report results into appropriate test forms or databases. This may include the handling of pathogenic organisms and hazardous chemicals/materials. Participation in proficiency testing and internal or external audits is required.
Perform startup/ shut down procedures for the Laboratory. This may include equipment start-up/shut down, laboratory disinfection / cleaning, incubator/ refrigerator checks, balance checks, pH etc.
Calibrate and maintain testing equipment and record calibration / maintenance activities and results as per laboratory technical procedures and/or work instructions.
Enter test results/ data into the laboratory database. Enter data onto laboratory forms. Verify the accuracy of data entered.
Perform preliminary sample preparation to label, scale and grind samples for analysis. Conduct pre-analytical testing on packaging and samples.
Lead a project that may involve testing a new piece of equipment, evaluating a test method or assessing the utility of a new reagent. You will be present findings to team and complete a short report. Guidance will be provided throughout.

What we have to offer you:

Be part of a company with an inspiring and unique vision, with a deep commitment to sustainability and expanding its leadership in sustainable protein across North America
Commitment to Learning - courses, resources and tools provided to all employees
Employee Assistance Program
Required Skills:
What you will bring:

Minimum: Enrolled in a science related discipline

Job Summary:
Maplesoft is a leading provider of software tools for engineering, science, research and teaching. Maple is math software that combines the world's most powerful math engine with an interface that makes it extremely easy to analyze, explore, visualize, and solve mathematical problems. Maple's powerful mathematics engine allows students to analyze, explore, visualize and solve complex mathematical problems. 

  

The Quality Assurance Team is a key part of the software development process at Maplesoft. We are involved in all stages of development, from initial requirements reviews through to testing and product release.
Job Responsibilities:
We are seeking Software QA Analysts to join our Quality Assurance team. As a member of the team you will be responsible for testing Maple - our world-class mathematics software and flagship product. 


In this role, you will establish a thorough understanding of our testing process and be responsible for the following areas: 

·         Functional and regression testing on a variety of platforms, with focus on manual testing of the graphical user interface 

·         Working with our QA group and developers to establish test strategies for new and existing features 

·         Recording defects and providing feedback from a customer perspective 

·         Creating and maintaining test cases 

·         Communicating testing status with Project Management
Required Skills:
Requirements: 

·         Enrollment in a Bachelor's degree program in Computer Science, Mathematics, Science or Engineering 

·         Must be creative and curious.  You'll need to develop ways to test (break!) our software. 

·         Knowledge of one or more of the following operating systems: Windows, macOS, Linux 

·         Software testing experience in an Agile environment would be an asset 

·         Experience with Maple or other Maplesoft software would also be an asset.
 

  Ability to read Japanese would be useful in testing localized versions of our software

Job Summary:
Who we are and what we do


Mappedin powers search and discovery indoors. Our software platform provides industry leading tools for property owners and operators to manage their dynamic indoor information and build digital wayfinding experiences into their customer-facing applications. 


Founded in 2011, Mappedin is headquartered in Waterloo, Canada. We work with clients in all industries around the world to help manage over 600M square feet of indoor space. In the last year, the Mappedin platform served over 140 million directions to people navigating the indoors. 


Our Mapping team is embedded within our Customer Experience team and we work closely together to deliver the best wayfinding experience.
Job Responsibilities:
Who you are and what you'll do


You are passionate about indoor navigation, design, and best-in-class maps used by millions of people. You enjoy exciting work and have great design sense. As part of the Mapping Team and reporting to the Map Design Team Lead, you will provide support to the Project Management and Customer Support teams to deliver maps pre- and post-implementation work: 

* Work with blueprints and architectural plans to understand and digitize various types of indoor venues 

* Use your exceptional design skills to create a good-looking map that is easy to understand and to navigate 

* Input the client's location data when required 

* Assist with on-going map updates 

* QA your work and your peer's work
Required Skills:
* Great attention to detail  

* Friendly attitude and fast learner 

* Experience with CAD-editing software (AutoCAD) is a plus but not required  

* Experience with Adobe Illustrator is a plus but not required  

* Interest and/or experience in Architecture or Urban planning

Job Summary:
Who are we?

We're Martello Technologies.  Martello delivers confidence in the performance of real-time services on cloud and enterprise networks.  Our solutions manage and optimize network performance with innovative SD-WAN technologies and performance management software as a service (SaaS). 


We're a friendly, energetic and diverse team with a great work environment.   (Why not check out the video at the end of this posting?) 


Who are you?

You are a computer science or engineering student, who wants to see their work become part of the product. 


You sweat the details and are detail-oriented.  You have never seen a bug you didn't have an immediate urge to squash and you enjoy building products that delight customers. 


You take pride and ownership in the work that you do.  You're not just looking to cross items off a "to-do" list.  You want to build software that satisfies users, write code that is easily testable, and provide functionality that doesn't cause the support team to pull their hair out.
Job Responsibilities:
What do we offer?

We can't afford to give you "busy-work" projects.  You'll be working on our core products and making an actual impact on the lives of our customers. 

  

Our goal is to give you as much responsibility as you can handle and as much help as you need.  We'll start you off slowly (testing is a great way to learn the ins and outs of our product), and then expand your role to include development of new features and functionality.  You'll work side by side with other developers and learn the practical side of commercial software development. 

  

Product ideas come from all sorts of places.  Customers may request new features, product managers may dream up new functionality and designers may think of better ways to present information.  We believe an excellent approach is to watch what customers actually do with our product and improve their experience.  To instrument our product gives us detailed information on what customers are looking at most often and what features they're making use of. 
 

Want to be a part of the team who use that information to improve the product by simplifying navigation to commonly used features, improving the discoverability of functionality and adding new tools to help users reach their goals?
Do you want to help track new product introduction, key performance indicators against Martello's business goals to help us achieve 'success'? 

Just another way you can have your work become part of the product and make a positive impact on the customer experience.
Required Skills: Required Skills:  We use C#, ASP.MVC, SQL, PowerShell and HTTP, HTML, JavaScript, CSS, AngularJS, AngularJS Material HTTP, HTML, JavaScript, CSS, AngularJS, AngularJS Material, and a whole bunch of other nifty and interesting technologies.  We don't necessarily care if you have experience in them, we appreciate people who want to grow and can quickly learn.

				MATH - Computer Science

Job Summary:
Hey there!

We are looking for a responsible, detailed oriented finance compliance student to join our passionate team!

Mastercard Foundation is an independent, global organization based in Toronto, Canada. Our programs promote financial inclusion and advance youth learning in Africa. The Foundation was established in 2006 through the generosity of Mastercard when it became a public company. From inception, the Foundation was designed to be a separate entity and independent from Mastercard. Our policies, operations and funding decisions are made by our President and Board of Directors.

The Foundation values innovative and fresh thinking as it strives to become a global thought leader. Its work is achieved by a strategic, nimble and highly entrepreneurial team with a proactive and results-oriented approach to its philanthropic activities. The organization's culture is shaped by people who are driven and passionate about the Foundation's mission. It is an exciting time to be joining the Foundation as we are working towards our new and ambitious strategy to create 30 million jobs in Africa by 2030. 

In this role, you will provide crucial support to the finance team by reviewing financial reports and supporting documentation submitted by partners and other related tasks. This is a fantastic opportunity to learn about the finance side of international development. Your work will be contributing to a bold and meaningful cause.

Job Title:
NEW
									



										Applied Deep Learning in Machine Vision (S-03-15)
Job Summary:
Looking for an applied deep learning internship position within a Research and Development team made up of experts passionate about artificial vision? An engineering culture, an open and collaborative environment where all your ideas will be listened to and valued? Matrox's Imaging division offers you this exciting opportunity to contribute to the improvement of the Matrox Imaging Library (MIL). 


MIL is a library of analysis and image processing deployed internationally on hundreds of thousands of industrial machines. Recognized for its performance, robustness and outstanding reliability, MIL solves vision applications with industry leaders. The library makes it possible, among other things, to locate objects, extract and measure their characteristics, classify them, read strings and barcodes, perform 3D reconstruction, and much more. 


* Masters Students our Undergraduate students with experience in AI should consider applying
Job Responsibilities:
Responsibilities

Assimilate state-of-the-art machine learning approaches to design, build and optimize solutions for the machine vision industry.
Actively review scientific papers to remain up-to-date with computer vision and machine learning developments.
Involved in preparing datasets, training and evaluating deep learning models and algorithms.
Document and share findings and results with the R&D teams.

Job Summary:
Do you have experience in web development, an interest in documentation technologies, and have a passion for continuously learning? Whether you are looking for experience in an engineering environment, want to put your programming and problem-solving skills to the test, or are looking for a career in XML development, this position might be for you! 


As a Junior XML Programmer on the Matrox Imaging technical writing team, you will work directly alongside a dedicated team of technical writers and an experienced XML programmer, to help produce and publish the documentation for our software products, including: Matrox Imaging Library (MIL) and Matrox Design Assistant. 


All documentation is created in XML. This allows us to separate content from layout, and enforces the organization and division of content. This guarantees a consistent layout for each set of XML files, and permits for the scope of each topic to be user-customizable. You will use your programming and technical expertise to develop custom solutions, and provide support to the technical writing team along the way.
Job Responsibilities:
RESPONSABILITIES:

- Develop, enhance, and maintain the infrastructure for Matrox Imaging software manuals. 

- Research and develop features and improvements for a custom, web-based help system.  

- Develop and update error checks and validations for XML source files. 

- Develop and update test cases for the documentation test suites. 

- Collaborate with the technical writers to establish requirements, and partake in brainstorming sessions to improve the documentation accessibility and user experience, the structure of its source files, and the documentation tools. 

- Assist and support the technical writers in day-to-day tasks and workflows. 

- Assist in maintaining software installations and hardware components for the team.
Required Skills:
QUALIFICATIONS:

- Pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Web Design and Development, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field. 

- Possess a good basis of front-end web development and related technologies, including knowledge of XML, HTML, CSS, - -JavaScript, and the jQuery library. 

- In-depth knowledge of XSLT, XPath, and XML Schema (XSD). 

- In-depth knowledge of C#. Knowledge of Java an asset. 

- Autonomous, analytical, open-minded, meticulous, and organized. 

- Ability to work under pressure, learn quickly, multi-task, and manage priorities. 

- Good interpersonal skills. 

- Ability to speak and write in English. 


STANDARD OF PERFORMANCE: 

- Complete tasks with well thought out solutions that demonstrate technical proficiency and are maintainable. 

- Grasp the full scope of tasks, asking questions during the process to clarify what is not understood.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				- Theme - Digital and Graphic Media; Web Site Design and Development 
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
Do you have very strong English writing skills, a passion for technology, possess a good understanding of programming, and enjoy learning? Whether you are looking for experience in an engineering environment, know how to program but are not interested in a programming career, or looking to become a technical writer, this might be the perfect job. 


Technical writers in Matrox Imaging are responsible for documenting Matrox Imaging products: Matrox Imaging Library (MIL), Matrox Design Assistant, and the various imaging hardware products. Using their programming and technical expertise, they document reference material, concepts, and processes. Technical writers benefit from learning and working on multiple aspects of a product, obtaining a global view of the product.
Job Responsibilities:
RESPONSABILITIES:

- Update the function reference and user guide of MIL and the user guide of Matrox Design Assistant with new functionality. 

- Learn about the new functionality and the underlying concepts, to provide good explanations. 

- Write clear and concise descriptions in English, paying attention to missing information, detail, flow, grammar, and consistency. 

- Illustrate concepts using basic drawings, and possibly animated GIFs and 3D drawings. 

- Communicate with developers and other teams to clarify information that needs to be documented and/or elaborated.
Required Skills:
QUALIFICATIONS:

- Student pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science,  Software Engineering, or related field. 

- Knowledge of C, C++, and/or C# language. 

- Excellent written and oral English communication skills. 

- Good deduction skills and ability to grasp technical concepts quickly. 

- Attentive to detail and consistency. 

- Good interpersonal skills. 

- Ability to work under pressure, multi-task, and manage priorities. 

- Asset: 3D drawing skills. 

  

Standard of Performance

- Submit work that has been well thought out and technically and grammatically accurate. 

- Understand what is being documented, asking questions during the process to clarify what is not understood.
